4GoymI6SEEmdgC9ac8dEzg.text: Went to Don and Charlie's tonight for Mother's Day. While the service was terribly slow, I will not hold it against them because they were slammed for the holiday. Everyone deserves to have an off day with service and this was their night. What I did find not acceptable was when I showed my server a simple $10 coupon I received from them 2 days ago, I was told by her and the manager that I wasn't able to use it tonight because they couldn't properly scan it into the system and that I could use it another night. Good idea for them. Sure makes sense. For me, won't be back as I feel that this was totally dishonest. Mind you that the bill was well over $200 so the measly $10 is not the issue but truly just the point. Not acceptable. They should be ashamed. No interest in going back. BTW Don, my family had been eating your ribs since you were in Chicago. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

lx6A1n2SgbtqaMmWCoFNUA.text: Hubby and I hadn't been here for awhile, but we were eager to see the new patio.  Even made a reservation requesting it.  What a disappointment!  Great potential, but seriously needs some tall tree dividers from noisy Camelback Road!  Never ceases to amaze me how restaurant owners  build a patio next to a parking lot or busy street and fail to add landscaping!  Seriously, plant some queen palms or a row of ornamental orange trees.  We moved to a table inside.   Food and ambience always great, but do agree with others that much touted ribs are lacking in real meat quantity.  Wait staff is always pleasant and professional.  I just want to have dinner on a beautifully landscaped patio!

_V8YThmtmNVwCtJtP0gFFw.text: Stopped by after the game and what a treat! Fortunately we had a reservation...place was packed! We had a wide variety of dishes we ordered from burgers to prime rib to bbq chicken to a steak. Everything was delicious! Things not to miss: the deli Cole slaw, the au gratin potatoes, the onion rings. We wanted ribs but they were sold out by 541pm!

7fbvtJGXBlASYhTHBQpMiQ.text: This place was recommended by a baseball friend of mine. So glad I went!!  Greeted at front door-- sat in the lounge area--- all the sports memorabilia was phenominal!!  Shelby was our server and she was friendly and did an outstanding job. I had the prime rib and it was prepared perfectly!!  Highly recommend this place if you are visiting Scottsdale area!! Or if you live here!!  Great restaurant !!

CkFH120ECIyZg_XgqqheCg.text: Ribs were great, but order early as they are known to run out within minutes of opening...not sure why they don't make more when they're so highly sought after. This place is is a real treat for any baseball lover; tons and tons of memorabilia.

uO5PXWyvJ4f0YJ56tjTSGg.text: Don & Charlies 7501 E Camelback Rd Scottsdale, AZ 85251  This is an old restaurant to Phoenix people that has survived simply because it's good. You don't stay in business for more than 20 years unless your doing something right.  The restaurant is decorated with tons of sport memorabilia; signed baseball bats and balls all over the place. I'm not sure that one would say that the restaurant has a lot of ambiance, and it's not the place to go for a romantic dinner, but it is interesting. Reservations are a must here.  Our wait for our table with reservations was about 10 minutes, which was spent in the comfortable bar. In fairness, the place was packed with people.  We were seated at our table, and were promptly served complimentary chopped liver, onions, chopped egg, and a basket of wonderful bread. I could have made a meal just out of this.  Companion and I both had the house salad ($2.50) to start and shared the Baked Spinach and Artichoke dip ($7.95). The salad was crisp and not watery, and the dip had good flavor and was nicely done. I ordered the House Anchovy dressing and companion had the Creamy Garlic. Both dressings were better than ordinary.  Next came the main course. The menu covers a lot of territory, ranging from chicken to fish to shrimp, and of course, meats. They like to trumpet their ribs, and they are very good, but I come here for the beef. They have the cooking of steaks down to a science, and they always are served exactly as you order it. Their Rib Steak ($30.95) and Bone-In Rib Steak ($44.95 - 22 oz) are always winners as is their Prime Rib ($25.95 - $31.95).  This evening I ordered the Skirt Steak. This particular cut of meat is extremely flavorful and when cooked right beautifully tender. The steak comes with burnt onions, but I ordered mine with sauteed onions instead. I prefer the taste of the sweet caramelized onions as opposed to the burnt ones. I ordered a baked potato with mine and companion and I shared a dish of Creamed Spinach. My steak came exactly as I ordered it, and was hanging over the sides of the plate it was so big. It was tender and juicy.  Companion ordered the Prime Rib large cut. Though companion could not possibly finish the large cut, the extra that was taken home made fine sandwiches the next day! The Prime Rib arrived medium rare with both horseradish sauce and au jus to go with it. Companion also ordered Sauteed Mushrooms ($4.95) which were pronounced excellent.  Neither of us had room for desert after this meal.   Interestingly, they have a gluten free menu which is a bit unusual to find these days.  Sanitation was as it should be for a restaurant of this caliber, and it is nicely handicapped available.  I give Don & Charlies 4 stars for quality of food and cleanliness.

wjaRSy-mnkoMCu4HpDmDhg.text: I have been going to Don & Charlies for years and am amazed how consistant the food and service is. Love the creamy cole slaw, liver, Seattle Salmon and especially the ribs. The memoriabelia is a Major League plus.

Efx1OXSnqbV1_3Wj_9wF2w.text: Love the food, the service is above average and so are the prices. They will be around for a long time if they keep up what they have. Never had my water below they halfway point in my glass.

Ebn1GAHWZDTlWUg7bSOyhw.text: I can't believe the great reviews this place gets. I think its reputation among people who actually care about good food was summed up by two separate concierges at our 5-star hotel when I told them we hadn't liked Don & Charlies: "WHO SENT YOU to Don & Charlies????" Its listing as a "steakhouse" and reviews referring to it as "steakhouse" or "chop house" leads you to believe this is going to be of a Flemings or Ruths Chris caliber, but it's absolutely nothing like that. Not. Even. Close.  I was with friends who are not foodies and don't go out nearly as much as I do, and even they were completely baffled why anyone would recommend it. I guess if you like (love) baseball you might enjoy going in just for the museum aspect. They certainly have a lot of balls (heh) and photos from the 70s. Nothing, including the cooking techniques, has been updated since then.  We had reservations and were seated promptly in the dining room -- two tables away from a large party celebrating the birthdays of a couple of small children. We immediately asked to be moved and were quickly and graciously relocated to the bar. This was fine with us, and actually was a bonus for one of our party since she had a burger from the bar menu which was the only edible meal.  I ordered a pomegranate margarita which was undrinkable -- too syrupy and sweet. Others had the prickly pear margarita and they said that drink was ok.  First out was the chopped liver which none of wanted so we sent it back. We had a spinach dip appetizer which was ok. I had a caesar salad, nothing special, the rest had the vinegar cole slaw which was deemed by all to be good but nothing special.  Then came the entrees. The gal who had the burger was the only happy one, but the "onion strings" that came with it were a joke. Gloppy strings of over-fried dough that looked to have sat out for awhile before being served. Four people had the famous ribs and proclaimed them to be dry, meatless, and impossible to eat. I had the filet trio with three different "crusts." The little blobs of meat were dry and flavorless, and the "crusts" were just dabs of some kind of mixture that added nothing to the meat. The only one I got any flavor from was the dijon mustard one, and that was kind of overwhelming. The twice-baked potatoes were huge, but so dry and tasteless.  This is the kind of food that was considered gourmet back in the 60s I suppose, but they seriously need to update things. I've been to throwback type places that at least serve good food. The concierge told me, politely, that they would only send their "over 60" clientele there, and then she said, "But I'm practically a senior citizen myself and I don't like it AT ALL."  This is a place you can definitely afford to miss.

XenbB-ZsDKIsWF2K9CzdRg.text: Great ribs and broasted chicken (tastes like fried chicken...not really sure what makes it "broasted"). Service is really excellent and the place is a lot of fun, especially if you like baseball. Good for large groups and it's a bit loud and crazy so that makes it good for kids too.

6K0OhttynjfCqMCY-DMK3w.text: Another favorite place of ours. My father in-law turned us onto this place.  The filet rare with char crust and mashed potatoes as my side. For dessert we always get the creme brulee. It has a small piece of chocolate in the bottom. Yummy!

E6L5qfsDkdZvuO_vnT3NMg.text: I had the broasted chicken, which was MARVELOUS.  Tender, juicy, not too much crunch but enough, not greasy at all.  This chicken is among the best fried bird I have ever tasted.  It was by far the star of the show.  The sides were not bad, but were merely unremarkable. The creamy coleslaw was just bland, the salad was forgettable, the fried onion strings were certainly decent but not the best I've had.  The service was stellar, and a couple of times "manager-looking" people strode by and asked me how everything was going.  Servers who were not even mine spoke to me in a friendly manner.  Nice experience. Go check it out.

Iv6cpX7bgDCg22kHLkRa_A.text: I hadn't been back in years but it was the only restaurant open on Christmas in Scottsdale.  They draw a strong appeal for sports fanatics and they have baseball, football, etc. paraphernalia on every inch of every wall & ceiling.   We opted for the bar area so we could watch the NFL xmas game that evening.  Our server was nice and she was good.   The best thing I liked was the bread w/ pate.  I love pate so this was a treat for me.  I ordered the Cobb Salad to share - it was a good portion.  The server was kind to bring me 2 salad dressing options.  My other half had the BBQ Ribs w/ Coleslaw and Mashed Potatoes.  He thought it was decent but I didn't have a bite of either.    It's definitely on the pricer side for what you get but hey I can't complain - I was able to eat dinner on Christmas!

cV8t9mFFsUSbzuZ4RrUTTQ.text: Excellent Service, excellent food. My husband had the prime rib, it was seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection. I had the original baby back ribs and it was awesome! Love the ambience too! Oh and the Creme brulee!!!!!

k6HFhO5UO0g75vUZWbXL1Q.text: Great meal.  Server was nice but made us feel rushed..The Skirt Steak the best! Don get your staff some help would make the experience more enjoyable.

VCjiaPauYlZRILkEDUuMEw.text: Why is this place still here?  Dust off the nostalgia and baseball memorabilia, cuz that's the ONLY reason you should eat here.  The service is pedestrian, the place is stuffy and the food just meh.    And the wine list!  For a steak house, I'd expect something more than 10 grocery store selections listed on the back of the menu.  Yes, the BACK of the food menu!  Let's see...I'll take the Kendall Jackson Cab for $40.  If you're going to bend me over on wine prices, at least let me pick something that isn't on sale at Basha's!    With so many better food options in Scottsdale, why is this place still here?

PLQMWbARMttDf--4HHmCCw.text: We have been going to Don & Charlie's for many years.  We had dinner there last week.  For us, the restaurant was very quiet.  Mid week in January is a great time to go.  We had reservations and arrived on time.  Only a minimal wait of 10-15 minutes.  Much better than normal.  The good news was that we had time to look at the memorabilia in the entry way without huge crowds to maneuver around.  So much fun stuff to see.   Our waitress and the rest of the staff were very helpful.  No one was pushy.  My wife and I split an entree and they were very good about splitting the potato on 2 plates. Plenty of food for us.  (we took home leftovers).  This meal we had the ribs.  As always, the food was good old American food.  Not too special, but tasty and filling. Drinks and wine are about normal for Scottsdale.  You go here for the atmosphere.  If you're a baseball fan, this is pretty darn good.

Swafo4rPaZB5LIfAZHtv6g.text: I knew it was going to be good when our group arrived on a Saturday afternoon at 435pm only to find we were early and no one was around. But by 5pm opening time there were quickly 10 others at the door waiting to get in and I thought how did they sneak by?!? Well we were actually waiting in the lot at our car so no biggie.  Great recommendation from a good friend from Mayo Scottsdale. Great sporting decor, warm ambience. Came again with kids (2 two year olds, an eleven year old and one thirteen year old) and a few adults.  Ribs, chicken, fish (Mahi mahi), potatoes, fries, broccoli all made with care with quality ingredients and quite tasty. A little expensive but I think it was worth it given the quality of food and the excellent service. Even the childs portions were a good value given the portions. I ordered prime ribs which isn't on the menu but is indeed the prime ribs after the steak portion has been cut off. You have to get there early to get this and only by request since again, it isn't on the menu. Cool.

9AyCQ06ylJrKxchE-IRbqQ.text: We stopped here from out of town and decided to give this restaurant a try on Friday, 11/29.  Love the decor  and atmosphere along with the bar.  We had a couple of drinks in the bar before being sat at our dining room table. The bartender, provided prompt service and was very cordial. She validated our first time at Don & Charlies, and gave a brief overview of the restaurant and its history.  When we were called to our table, we had a young man named Jeff as our server.  He provided us with good tips on our interested appetite selections. I had the prime rib which was excellent tasting and very tender along with cole slaw.  My husband had the blue royal burger and our friend had the shrimp de jonghe with cole slaw.  Overall the food was delicious and our server took care of us. Next time in town, we would like to visit Don & Charlies again, and recommend it to others.

NkYFC1suVqd0LQsp1txNPg.text: The bartender, Shelley,  ROCKS; she draws her clients in, treats them like old friends and truly makes this place shine!  I would recommend Don & Charlie's just for drinks at happy hour.  The bar regulars are a dashing group and it's a great place to go if you find yourself wanting a drink and happen to be on your own -- not weird at all to show up at the D&C's bar alone and Shelley will serve you dinner with all the white linen and formal touches you'd expect, right there at the bar.   The food is top notch (primerib!) and the atmosphere is upscale in an understated way -- and the memorabilia collection is stellar.  Our server was fun and caught on that we wanted to treat our guests (my parents) special that night and she was spot on taking care of Mom and making their evening memorable.

ZeAXfWa-pnsvGRoiMeIIfA.text: Don& Charlie's is not only a great restaurant for beef and ribs, but a sports museum of sports memorabilia. The homemade mayo Cole slaw is still great. Great service. It is sad to learn that this restaurant will close next year as a hotel will be built on the site of the restaurant. Hopefully Don will decide to re-open the restaurant in the new hotel.

NjASqoCbUceON-grTj2SLw.text: Wonderful setting. Sports, sports, sports. So at first you might think bar food or a cheap cut of steak but don and Charles hangs in there with Ruth Chris any day. Appetizers are unique (frog legs) desserts are out of this world. One of the most well rounded meals and experiences you can get in the valley, and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg. Book in advance in the spring, can be a who's who of the baseball world during spring training.

ZCxucsdtfkhfcQ2-gH4nwg.text: What a nice place to eat.  Tablecloths and cloth napkins!  An actual hostess who seats you. A man whose job it is to go around and say hello to diners, thank them for coming, and ask if there's anything he can do to make the meal even better.  A waitress who not only brings you your coke, but puts a lemon in the side and fills a carafe with more in case you want seconds. How about manners?  It even rubs off on the busboys who ask politely if they can clear your dishes and who refill your water without you even having to ask.  My wife and I thought we died and went to restaurant heaven.  Or is this the way it was in the 70's but we have all become so attached to our cell phones that we didn't notice that no one gives a sh_t anymore?  I had the cheapest thing on the menu.  Pulled chicken BBQ sandwich with onion rings.  I was full after three bites but I had to finish.  It was best I ever had.  Cole slaw on the side...a kind of cole slaw I haven't had in decades.  Awesome!  The wife had BBQ chicken dinner ($20).  So much food she will have two lunches from the leftover. Mmmmmm.  She said it was really, really good.  We also had a side of broccoli which was served with some kind of dressing on the side to dip it in.  Wow!  That was soooo good.  The baked potato that came with my wife's meal was HUGE....forget about that Wendy's potato you/ve grown accustomed to...this is a real potato.  Crazy good.  Mine came with French fries - there were so many fries they were literally falling off the plate.  This place gets 5 stars.  No doubt.  I loved it and I'll totally be back. Baseball buffs should come here......the place is loaded with baseballs and baseball bats to look at...its like a museum.  Very fun.  Don't miss out.  Go here.  You won't be sorry.

GXTKQpEEQiCiPvA7Zqeagw.text: I have been here approx 5 times with extended family, since the extended family wanted to. The chopped liver is good. The chicken has been dry and the ribs are average. It has the old school atmosphere and has been here forever, but... My complaint is that the extended family wanted to order to go for a large party of 30. After 1 1/2 days of no return call from catering I finally get ahold of someone only to be told they cannot handle our order since they have a large party at the restaurant during that hour or two. Really? This place is huge and I'm trying to order 2 days in advance. Business elsewhere and hopefully my extended family will stop requesting this place.  There are so many options out there.

f6SRPwtPd4qyVfyoB5AUyQ.text: What a quaint place to enjoy a quiet escape from the sometimes extra noisy old town shenanigans. Great place to enjoy a drink with an appetizer or something sweet!

mBTBrSoxXu2mBQV9mhvVrQ.text: So I said okay I'll have stolen all the entries are fantastic. Try the baby back ribs for the fish of the day. You can't go wrong with anything you order off the menu. Don't forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Celebrating 2 birthdays with the family.

twmwU1y77vzQ65FMlbIHqg.text: Quality food, quality service. Have been here twice now and am taken aback by the amazing atmosphere this restaurant has. The food is delicious, I highly recommends their ribs! Make sure to make reservations to avoid a wait.

nCE20Z-95Oi2Ww5__gTu8Q.text: Amazing meal, steaks cooked perfectly and plenty of food. I tried the Scottsdale cooler to drink which was pretty good, and we both had the Parmesan crusted New York steak. Our server was fantastic as well

HJiL0BYL52P_igog2LQY8Q.text: One of the best meals I've had in awhile. Don & Charlie's is a must for any sports memorabilia fan. The place is iconic.  Food is phenomenal and well priced.   We shared it all- Caesar, wedge, ribs, prime rib, rib eye, au gratin, baked, and twice baked  The rub on the rib eye was killer- it competes and outpaces the big steak houses around town.   Martinis were top notch and service was just right.   Turtle pie for dessert pushed us all over the edge- doesn't look like much but it's dense and packs a good punch- full of flavor and the perfect finish.

T3ALaWWd4QFsukLLJhZnhg.text: Was the place to go, now that they foolishly let Shelly go a big loss and the gang and I won't be hanging out there any more

Fhga0LOMLf1r4GYd0oxwOw.text: This place is a classic. One of a kind, fun, and very old school in a good way. Great signature steaks of course, and the place has a unique style with lots and lots of character. If you're a sports fan you'll love all of the impressive sports memorabilia and collectibles on display too.

0yvJwLeQVBfu_p5Zk_YW6A.text: Very good filet mignon .     Atmosphere is very sporty. the whole restaurant is covered in sports memorabilia I was told it was a very upscale restaurant but there was old folks in there in shorts and tank tops I was told I needed to dress up that is not the case the twice-baked potato that everybody Raves about is a very basic twice baked potato the Caesar salad I ordered was a bit soggy the filet mignon was perfect very good my waiter was very nice not a place I would go out of the way for though.    Its good to go check out once but i wouldnt become a regular at these prices.

qh7cc6CjF1_bghjpYPNCSg.text: First timer at Don and Charlies. Went with a rowdy bunch after a long day at the pool. Being that most were from the Chicago mid west area it was fitting to go here. They were very accomodating by putting us in the back room which allowed to enjoy ourselves freely with out disturbing other patrons. The staff right off the bat was amazing one of our servers had been there since the beginning and she was a blast to have as well as the other server. They both put up with our antics and played along with the mood. The food was delish. I shared the liver and wow! Yummy. Not a liver guy but this was good.  Most everyone had the steaks and were all raving about the cuts and flavor. All in all had a great time there as did our entire group. The memorabilia was a great added addition to as every piece could strike up a conversation.  Cant wait to go back again!

mv2juJfnKHhxf07BLRSt0Q.text: Fun place to go. Obviously ALOT of repeat locals as placed was packed and staff and customers seemed to know each other in many cases. Food was ok not over the top but fine. Lots of memorabilia which adds greatly to the atmosphere. Kind of an old school hangout for the rat pack gang. . .   I would return as the staff was attentive and made you feel at home. I can grill just of good of steak at home so don't frequent steakhouses too much because why pay $35 for a NY Strip that I can do myself for $12 :-). But the sides were good and the company great.

jj-7EU2zhJAfY0H_kOW6xQ.text: I used to love this place. As well as all my sorority sisters and friends. Came here at 8:45pm on Sunday night. "Kayla", hostess, said kitchen closes soon so she couldn't seat us. Say you close at 8:45 then instead of wasting our time driving there to get turned away; horrible service. Lost lots of customers right there.

hcYQHaendsBCJRadbbH1Jw.text: Had dinner here for my sisters birthday. We ordered ribs and the twice baked potato. Both were good, the BBQ sauce is awesome! The banana cream pie is a reason to return in itself, SO DELICIOUS! Charlie was our server, she is OUTSTANDING! She made our first experience so special and really went out of her way. Haven't had service like that anywhere in a while. So we will be back to see her and for some pie!

ODZZXluQ_YdpchJc36gB_Q.text: Very good! Great atmosphere and a classic menu. Amazing memorabilia to take in, and even some sports stars in-house if you're lucky.  Leah was our server, perfectly attentive without hovering. Great service. We had filet and the filet duet along with some calamari and sides.  Everything was delicious and we'll definitely be back again!

4uYiPpb5nv-ZtA5qcNcHQQ.text: Love this place. Food is great and so is the memorabilia. Make reservation or come as soon as the open for seating in the bar. I prefer the bar as there is more to look at. Burgers and steaks are great. Good beer and wine selection. Good cocktails. Excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ws4S9B5_i1Gu6CixcYNm-w.text: Kelly our waitress was Amazing!!! The atmosphere of this place is perfect for baseball fans and the food is tasty!!!! The spinach dip is to die for :) we definitely will add this to our fave places in Scottsdale!

hzizexLEMJs2WoPN1TRwmw.text: In for dinner last night with family.  Prime rib fantastic, creamy coleslaw awesome, steak fries great and of course the golden sundae to top it off.   If you like ribs, prime rib, sports memorabilia  and a good atmosphere for dinner this is the place for you.  Well worth the 30 min drive for us.

mnfxCl1-bENL3q2eoWhOmg.text: Ok so I must have been in a bad mood when I wrote my previous review because this place is one of my favorites. It's where my sister and I decided to have our Grad party and were met with zero hesitation from my parents.  I love this place the atmosphere is fantastic with all the sports collectibles, it doesn't happen to be terribly loud for dinner unlike a lot of places. Let's not forget they start you out with some of the best chopped liver I have ever had.  My favorite here is the prime rib as it is always perfectly cooked and seasoned and nice and juicy. I am also a big fan of the cesar salad here, for some reason it is better than most.  Oh and found out the steak sandwich is really a medium steak served with 2 pieces of bread on the side. My buddy ordered it at my grad party and we both expected some slices of steak between some bread. What he got was a full steak and 2 pieces of garlic break.   I have no idea what made me post the last review and not throw out the one random night they were a bit off on a busy holiday. This is on of my favorites in the valley and my first choice when I want a steak. Been here tons of times and hope to go back tons more.

EohmuwqUtsHCd1ctMr6_6A.text: Wow.  How the might have fallen...asleep.  The menu is as big as Cheescake Factory.  The servers indifferent.  Expectant.   Went there for the first time in a long time.  Just seemed "the same" or "tired".    Question: who do these guys know that the bathrooms could have ever been that small and be in code?  One stall and one urinal for the mens?  Place must seat 200 or more...?  Just sayin.  The food was ok, but sort of reminded me of Dillon's...and THAT'S NO COMPLIMENT.   I don't think I'd go back.  Which is sort of sad.

n544Pi9A14oe6lEluyH9tQ.text: I worked at Don and Charlie's for about 7 months before heading back to San Diego and I miss it already! The owner was such a great man to work for, and runs his restaurant really well. He also treats his employees extremely well. I have nothing bad to say about D n C. The food is awesome which is how I ended up getting a job there because my family all loved the food so much and took me there a few times before I started working there. The service we received was always great before I worked there and for the most part I loved my co workers. I wish I could move D n C's over to San Diego!   If you want a great meal order the prime rib, the filet topped w blue cheese or parm cheese, or get the famous baby back ribs (charred dons way), also the Seattle style salmon is KILLER order the twice baked pot or the au gratins. Our expresso martini and the peach cosmo were to die for.   If you want a funny server ask for Hershey he's the best and will have the table laughing hysterically. If you want an experienced server ask for Patrick or Mary they are both very attentive. If you want an overall good server who has it all ask for Jennifer or Sam.  Austin the manager is awesome, Don is impressive, and the food is great period.  As far as the liver goes people get so mad that its not free anymore, but think of this...what other restaurant just gives you free stuff besides bread?! In my eyes it was a smart move. I will continue going back to D n C's to eat every time I am in town.  D n C I will miss you and maybe will see ya next spring training season :)

Nz6Z7KYButDqodBH4mRPgA.text: This is my all time favorite and birthday every year restaurant. They have the best coleslaw, coconut shrimp, and ribs. The brick ice cream is insanely good. I love this place

GAz4bCR9BHEKQC85KlVCbQ.text: LOVE this place.  We have gone there for my brother-in-law's birthday dinner for many years.  We loved it so much this year we are going back for my husband's birthday tonight and I can't wait!  I don't understand some of the negative reviews as we have never had a bad experience.  We eat at a lot of fine dining restaurants and this place has a charm all its own, that you don't find in new restaurants. It is an older restaurant that has been around a long time, but I love the 'old' Chicago style feel of the place, and the way the food is served. Cole slaw (creamy!) out first is part of that charm, and the way they prepare their ribs as well.  Service has always been impeccable with friendly, attentive staff.  All the potato dishes are excellent!  We usually all get baby back ribs but occasionally we order fish, steak, prime rib, all of which never disappoint.    The only disappointment we found during our last visit was that the liver dish that was usually brought out complimentary is now a charged item.  This happens from time to time with a lot of restaurants we visit so I can understand.  Other than that, this place is excellent.

XKRz6jjyTNpC63UUdvMasg.text: Amazing! This place was my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale! This place is a must go if you are a sports fan. The food was delicious and our service was superb! Our waiter Patrick took the time to talk to us about the sports memorabilia on the walls and tell us stories about the place.

_3cDZwxDuMoZmbDTIJ-5Vg.text: The food and services were top notch!! The prime rib was fantastic, trout was fresh and the skirt steak was definitely Chicago style!!

WQ3AZGQuDMdBMWHbHkMdwg.text: They're really slipping now.  With dinner, you get cole slaw - you can "upgrade" to soup or salad for 2.50 more.  Really?  I've never heard of cole slaw being a pre-meal before.  I got the French Onion Soup, its actually better at Mimi's.  They put way too much cheese, the bread is pathetic and there's hardly any onions in it.  The prime rib comes with horseradish - very weak and cut with butter.  Never heard of that before either.  Luckily I had some sour cream with my baked potato and I asked for some raw horseradish so I can concoct my own.  Wasn't the best, but way better than the butter!    The barbeque chicken was ok.  I've had better at diners.  They didn't really season the bird, just threw some barbeque sauce on it.  At least it wasn't terribly dry...  I don't think I'm coming back to this one.  Nooooo..

fz3UdolqY4MRNvUlZagTEg.text: Don & Charlie's is fantastic as always and on Local Dines (localdines.com/phoenix?r...). A $40 for $20 gift certificate. Can't complain.

iSOSr4AKny4eccapGIRH3Q.text: Wow! Talk about a pleasant surprise. My fiance and I are out of towners and we chose to stop at Don & Charlie's on a random whim. Not only was every inch decked in awesome old sports memorabilia, but the environment and food were over the top amazing! What a relief to enjoy a mom&pop type of restaurant packed to the gills on a Thursday night. I got the more classic Cobb salad with salmon and it was the best salad I ever had... My fiance who is a meat snob (cough cough) ordered pork chops and he was more than pleased. We were also very impressed by their home made apple sauce. This is the only place I've ever been that has gotten me excited enough to write a Yelp review of my own. We will return and we will highly recommend to all. Our two dishes were $55 together, which is just barely pricier than normal for a casual night out, but it was certainly worthy of it. Thanks for a great meal!

Vkv7doMorlF2Z5LQBcewXw.text: I used to think this place was five star.  Its still really nice, but getting a bit stagnant.  Definitely try it out, as it has a good variety of choices.  I had a shrimp cocktail and crusted halibut the other night.  The service was great.  Food fine.  And enjoy the baseball memorabilia.  But its not top notch.

pkdxUuKMZuazdSsraX5ktQ.text: I too was a "Groupon customer" however not with a bad experience. I unfortunately was stupid enough to begin a very strict diet before using my groupon but decide to struggle through a meal with out being able to splurge on everything that would tempt me. My boyfriend and I went (we go out to eat way too often but seem to overlook the classic spots like D&C's and always seem to go to the 'new' places ) . I did survive my meal. And as bland of a diet I had to stick to, I still had a good meal. My boyfriend LOVED everything he had. The owner Don brought him out some cheesy bread appetizer that he raved about (that I was not allowed to taste LOL). I was able to eat the shrimp cocktail with horseradish. Yummy cocktail sauce. Very good side salad (yes...I know...boring to the rest of you but you have no idea how scrumptious good lettuce can be when thats pretty much all your are allowed to eat!)  More importantly, I had no problem getting a reservation once I planned accordingly (considering my days off are Sunday/Monday and I work late most nights) I really wish I could remember our waiters name. He was attentive, helpful, accommodating and friendly. I had explained to him my ridiculous diet restrictions and he kept coming back to make sure everything was working out ok. And yes he knew we had a Groupon.  I cant wait to be able to order anything I want on the menu and will go back.  Furthermore, as a local business manager who has run Groupons, I am aware of the mad rush especially toward the expiration, and what clients expect and what the businesses sacrifice when running a groupon. I thankfully was not treated like a "groupon customer" and am sorry for the poor reviews. I too called for a reservation at some point and heard the recording they would be closed Mondays. Never once did I get from the recording they were closed for the summer.

7_DNx8lVeHm2KCY67jthKg.text: Love this place! When you walk in this place it feels like walking back in time. I used to live right around the corner and I've never had a bad or even a mediocre experience. The waiters and waitresses are professional, the baked mac and cheese is out of this world...as is the cole slaw (either way you get it).  If you're considering going...don't hesitate or else you'll regret it!

TjP492LvPmtCsyVoD20D2Q.text: *************Their Newest RIP-OFF*************                *******Remember the FREE Chopped Liver Plate*********                        ------------------IT'S NOW $4.95----------------  "Our Famous Chopped Liver Platter, sweet bell pepper strips, carrot slaw, diced onions and chopped egg................4.95"  Whats next ?????? ...........Bread Basket For $4.95  I've got about $50 bucks........left on a giftcard. ........and then Don .........its ADIOS........The old D&C will be missed. The Owners business sense ....... is in bad shape ......same as the parking lot. Don ........ you've got a lot of Chutzpah......and its not good.  This is my 3rd review for D & C .........see the other two below

bzJleCvk8dqkllwyowAlxQ.text: I used to LOVE this place when I lived in Arizona...finally got a chance to go back with a bunch of girlfriends a few weeks ago. The food is as good as I remember. I personally prefer the baby back ribs while some of my friends preferred the charred version. Don't forget about the sides either! I think the best way to experience Don and Charlie's is to go with a group so that you can literally order everything on the menu.   Our server that night was Hershey and he is awesome! I think he's moving to California which is too bad for Don and Charlie's. He was one of the best servers I've ever had - friendly, attentive, fabulous!

y_Kw0tr8kuyhVkqudKg0CQ.text: The service was excellent and my hostess was very nice and helpful. My wife and I ordered the Baby Back Ribs and the Broasted Chicken. Both are very delicious! I wasn't expecting the Broasted Chicken could be so awesome, it wasn't greasy at all, and you could still taste the flavor of the meat even it's fried.  I also love the atmosphere of this place, with all the sport decorations on the wall, which is very different from any restaurants we've been to. I would recommend  this place to anyone who loves steak/BBQ!!

oNQrLzfr88LFaA2tFgkOlA.text: Our 74 yr old neighbor lady "Lavonne" recommended this restaurant to us! Lavonne is a born and raised "Arizonan" (not to many of those around). She has never steered us wrong and has gave us many great restaurant recommendations and, this restaurant is I believe the best she has ever recommended to us.   Energized atmosphere, great food, excellent service and price is just fine for a steak restaurant.  The cheesy garlic bread is the best I have ever had. We will go back here just like Lavonne and her late husband again and again and again - and next time we will bring Lavonne who has not been back since her husband died 4yrs ago!

MZOpqpB-Qi-0LjjOHQC2HA.text: Food was not good at all.  Steak was very bland and others in the group didnt even eat their salad or chicken plate.  Ribs were terrible and tough as can be.  I have no idea why this place is happening other than I just had a bad nights luck at dinner.  The only thing that is impeccable was our waitress and manager that dealt with our complaints very well.  A++ for them.  I very rarely complain about food but I had to this time.  Next time I'm in Scottsdale I would like to try them again as I'm hoping it was just an off night.

NC4kq4zPgRzgINxnMNuBbg.text: Was excited to try this place since I saw from their website that it had tons of sports memorobilia, and that the owner was from Chicago (where we are from).  And, it was within walking distance too.  Walked over there for dinner - it was, of course, ridiculously crowded.  Problem #1 - the hostess was completely clueless and overwhelmed.  We asked how long the wait would be, she said she was unsure.  We asked if we could put our name in, she again said she didn't know.  In the meantime, they're calling other parties names for seating, so we ask again.  The hostess gets a confused look on her face and ignores us.  So.... we just sat ourselves in the bar dining area.   Fifteen minutes later, a server decides to come over and ask us if we'd been helped.  She takes our drink order.  Two other servers come by and ask if we would like to order drinks, and we tell them we'd already had our drink order taken.  Throughout the course of our meal, I think four servers served us.  No clue who our actual server was.    I think this was in part because there was an ASU sports group (head coach?) in the restaurant sitting a few tables over.  It was amusing to watch the cheeseball of an owner spend the whole evening name-dropping and schmoozing with them.  Too bad it was at the expense of the other customers.    The food we ordered was actually good.  Kind of surprised that the burgers didn't come with fries, especially for over $10.  After we were done eating, it literally took almost a half hour for us to get our bill.  One of our four servers actually caught on and brought a bill and apologized for the sketchy service, but assumed we understood since the table behind us was "more important.  It is the new ASU head coach, you know."    We admired the memorobila collection as we walked out, listened to the owner do some more name-dropping about how he knew Bud Selig in the lobby, and left.  Despite the good food and impressive sports collection, we probably won't be back.  Too bad - was hoping for better.

u6AVMd-Jl6a8Tkb4wzAdzA.text: This isn't the best steakhouse in town, but it's a good one.  Things I like: + The Creme Brulee- quite possibly the best in the Valley. + Their seafood appetizers (Shrimp Cocktail, Calamari, etc)- delicious. + The Wedge Salad with their creamy garlic dressing- amazing! + The service- outstanding; took care of every need/concern. Top notch.  Things that are not so great: (-) The steaks- they're decent, but not phenomenal. I've got other go-to places for a Filet Mignon or Prime Rib, but it definitely won't be here again. (-) The tables- they really pack people into this place. Feels like everyone is at one big table, so close you wouldn't have to strain to get into other table's conversations...in fact, you have to strain NOT to get into other table's conversations.  Overall, I'll be back, but not for a steak...and never on a weekend. I'd like to try their burgers. And I'll certainly be having that wedge salad and creme brulee again.

_fyVFH2lQcnftP4qWNchRQ.text: Sorry this iconic place is closing. Staff is excellent and many have been there for decades. Char on meat can't be duplicated. Crusty outside juicy inside. Scampi is awesome

GFCYvxqG-1LQybGqhJuCVg.text: Our second time here.  The first experience was not awesome, but the owner wrote a nice note and offered a free dinner.  We did not take him up on the offer (though gracious), but called one month in advance for our party of 6. We were seated immediately at a nice round table and our server was lovely.  The food was fine- not exceptional but good.  The prime rib in particular was stellar.  My complaint and reason for the 3 stars was my nemesis-- this large white vent that blew 60 degree air conditioning directly into our table 6 feet away.  There was an empty table next to us which they could have moved us to (and sat empty well into our meal). Instead l, I spent 90 minutes with air blasting into my face and food every 10 minutes for 3-4 minutes. For such a nice successful restaurant, you would think  they could do better. This is Scottsdale.  How about some central air people?!

gAAXaGCFRZGhS_nB01YgiA.text: This place has the best ribs in AZ. It's a Chicago themed spot with some pretty legit sports memorabilia. I definitely always order the Charred Baby Back and twice/double baked potato because it's so delicious and filling. Service is pretty good. I would recommend reservations as this place gets pretty busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Tbe-pGBo5kWjEPSqCLno6w.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in the valley. Great drinks great service I'm sorry to hear they will be closing.

tfuAsf9-den4GupPU6Y_6g.text: 4.5 stars for Don & Charlie's.  This is your traditional steakhouse. With every inch of their walls adorned with Baseball memorabilia. Staff help is very attentive.   Food is excellent. I ordered the trout and it was moist on the inside with a nice coating on the outside. My husband said he never enjoyed a rib eye steak that was prepared so well and juicy with so much flavor as theirs.   One of my son's enjoyed their prime rib and ate his entire plate. My other son had the ribs and said it was good and was glad he got to take that home to his dorm for left overs.   We also got to try the liver Pate, and spinach dip.   There is a set menu for hearty eaters. We had 4 on our table that came with a choice of appetizer, salad, entree, and dessert for $44.00.   A strong Yay to recommend Don & Charlie's for Dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Diners with great Service!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Set menu is filling so share the appetizer
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So Satisfied!

fyGps79yIGUtSEe477gyGw.text: I loved my waitress KAMI she was was very sweet as well as the other team members ....but KAMI really stood out I loved her personality it was a wonderful experience I would definitely come back again

Z5LOo6f04Ciwdgg6fb--rw.text: I went there with my wife for our anniversary,it was by far the best time we have had in a long time, the food was out of this world and the service was top notch, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for great barbeque as well as a fun place to go.

r4awnhDG15M3GChdaWH0xg.text: One of my very favorite restaurants. Never have had a bad meal and service is always on point. I love their ribs, creamy Cole slaw, and au gratin potatoes...

V4sK4AvWuYyl2aejVXgpGA.text: Read about this place on open table. Amazing sports memorabilia in the entire place.  Cool to walk into all that cool stuff.   Went on Saturday night. About 7p. July 22.   Hostess never made eye contact or looked up from her book for myself or the three people behind me which was odd.   Waitress was great and very helpful on menu items.   Food was steakhouse fare and was cooked as ordered. Awesome cold beers.   Horrible horrible experience with the valet.  Gave him my ticket to get vehicle - 6$ valet charge. But he would not let me pay before he got the car. I knew his scam. I walk to drivers seat and give him money and he wanted to keep the $10. I asked for change and he got pissed I would not tip 80%. When he handed me the $4, I gave him 2$ (more than 20%) and he said NOTHING. No thanks. No, here is your change. Nothing.   What a dbag.   A 'tip' is on service and this guy gave none. I am kicking myself o did not take the tip back.   Made the experience a bad one. Won't go back to this restaurant.

rZNwSVdFrVRwXO_P1ip-Ng.text: I have been to Don &a Charlie's multiple times...  I've always had great service when sitting in the dinning area!!  However I just had a completely different experience while at the bar. Both bartenders were rude and I heard them make multiple snarky comments.  I was with a friend and he asked if they had Jalapenos and the one bartender said to the other "Noooo Julio G's is across the way they have some". And started laughing.  Both had a very cocky attitudes and just from this experience I don't even want to come back!  I was in the service industry for a long time.....  One of the worst experiences I've ever had!! Especially for a well known restaurant.  I was here on 3.4.18

y9ymJno3ud2NSyMDsfeVeQ.text: The restaurant would have rec'd higher stars, but as soon as we arrived and let the check-in know there would only be 4 instead of 6 that was on the original reservation, she was very snarky and made a politely rude comment.   We were in from out of town and went on Open Table 2 hours prior to find a place that was rated high and had open reservations. We chose this restaurant after looking at other options. When we got in at 615, there were about 6 open tables and it remained that way until around 730/745pm when it did start to fill up, most tables were set up for 4 people, so not sure why the snarky comment up front.   Postives: very cool sports decor, food was good- we had the ribs and bbq chicken sandwich- the sauce was great. I liked the option of doing the 1/2 and 1/2 on their 2 types of cole slaw, both were good. Waitress was friendly and checked on us regularly. Overall it was a good experience, but first impression will always linger.

t2VMXM3GWM6kM4w-TjYAjg.text: Not a bad bite in the house!   Charming old time atmosphere that takes you back to the good old days and provides great sports memorabilia.   ALL the food is delicious! I haven't had anything in the menu that I did not thoroughly enjoy. It isn't diet food, but it's worth it.   The staff is friendly and accommodating to whatever you want.   Prices are reasonable and portion sizes are huge! You won't leave hungry.   Highly recommended.

6TzCR5wTMdmXw6WJGvHpfA.text: This is a must if you visit old town Scottsdale. I would strongly sitting in the Bar area. Everything was great. Had the chopped steak and skirt steak. And the deli coleslaw. The sports stuff is awesome as well.  We love this place.

fUnXGL-5bajqHGwytGILSQ.text: A really cool spot, fast service and awesome food. Servers are GREAT! Love the baseball memorabilia too. The bread is amazing! When really busy things can get over/under cooked but usually are really good!

pRFuOlkHYFw0tpGDiokZ-Q.text: Don and Charlie's  Iconic!  Sports Memorial throughout the restaurant with many prized items such as the Babe Ruth autographed baseball. There are autographed baseballs, basketballs, footballs, bats, helmets, photos, cards, etc. This place could rival any collection of sports memorabilia in the country. I am a huge collector and one time the manager pulled me in the office to see a few items that were purchased which was the official lineup cards for all 7 games of the 2001 World Series.   As for the food, great prime rib and baby back ribs. The calamari is top notch as is the potatoes au gratin.  3 different size prime rib cuts and ask for it to be medium rare or it will be a little dry plus they will supply as much au jus as you need. Tip of the day, if you have a young one order the kids meal prime rib because it is a generous cut at a portion of the adult size.   The ribs are also a staple here where I would suggest if you come here with a guest split the prime rib and full rack of ribs.  The restaurant has been a part of Restaurant Week and is a decent deal.  Love this restaurant and will come back to celebrate another occasion.

EDMymuRWRMKquDisZCydDw.text: Been coming here for 20 years at least.  Always order the same thing.  Start with the Chopped Liver! Then a salad. Then Au Gratin Potatoes with Filet. And always tell the server to prepare your meat of choice the way they recommend.  Great service always!

Huek1EAn_3rAkIlwzqxkaQ.text: This place is THE haven for sports fans in Arizona. The food here is incredible, drinks are strong and the ambiance feels like being in your local Chicago bar. All the sports memorabilia is so cool since my mom usually personally knows a bunch of Cubs' signatures on the walls.   The ribs here are to die for and since I was a kid their mashed potatoes have been one of my favorite foods!!

QWbTQshX53VkaJZjkgunzw.text: Ok simply fantastic. Burgers are 12-13$ with fries 16$ Schnitzel and chicken tender and fantastic  All dinners come with a potato dish. Twice baked and au-gratin are delicious.  Prime rib huge and fatty just like my friends love it.  Twin steaks are mean and topped with two types of baked cheese  Bread basket omg!!!  Crisp bagel chips and lite rye grain bread. BUTTER BUTTER MORE BUTTER YUM!

PQFxW4_W--fkxUOEXLeGYQ.text: Everything on the menu is good. I have eaten here several times and can recommend the ribs (get them southwest style), the broasted chicken is really juicy  (think fried chicken) or the ribeye was one of the best I have had (charred on the outside perfectly medium on the inside). My mom likes the big tender coconut shrimp. I also recommend trying the coleslaw as 50/50 which is half creamy style and half deli style perfect when mixed together. The wait staff here is a joy the have wait on you with very impressive service anticipating your every wish.  Either special occasion or casual weekday dinner you won't be  let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 50/50 slaw, half creamy half deli style (I added the pepper)
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Southwest style baby back ribs
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. tender and juicy broasted chicken (you get 1/2 a bird!)

0UboCNtR_mmwr2uPgyYqtQ.text: Wow !!!  Don't miss this sports treasure. I spent 20mins looking at most of the the baseballs , pictures of past player's, memorabilia from all sports.  I had the Chicago style ribs they where like I was eating them in Chicago. That how close they where to them.  Hint. There not open on Mondays.  Plus they open at 5 pm. Be there before the crowd start  around 4:45.  Better yet call for a reservation.  I didn't but was ok siting by the bar.  Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. On a wall. Hand painted

4G7fMsEbm20R-Y1g6d1UxA.text: The bread was sub-par as the bagel was crisp and overly salty. The butter was frozen and un-spreadable.   The calamari was OK not the best and not memorable.   Service-The waitress was polite, but not as interested in us as we did not order an inordinate amount of booze. The busser touched my father's fork on the head of it instead of the handle. Yuck.  The steaks were OK but I've had better at Texas Road House to be quite honest. The additional char on the steaks is worth it, and makes a definite difference as my dad had his prepared this way and I did not.  The gold brick dessert was pretty good, but the chocolate was very frozen.

gunBVDXvpuftgMwgjJQIoA.text: Great atmosphere! Great service! I really enjoyed looking at all the sports memorabilia. The food was OK. Some of the food was good mostly the side dishes such as mashed potatos and salad.  I would definitely go back for after work drinks and horderve's and or entertain friends.

fAEs_DQazW6IxZ_m3Dzokg.text: Don and Charlies, a Scottsdale gem that has been serving up midwestern (ala Chicago) food that hits mostly on all cylinders. While the food was THE standout star, the service and ambiance prevent it from earning a 5 star mark. Here's why:  Service: We were greeted in a warm and friendly manner. However, despite having reservations they proceeded to make us wait 5-10min. Fine, we can look at all the baseballs.. did I mention they had a babe ruth signed one? The waitress was nice and even brought us some free cheesy bread. She made us feel like we were regulars, even though it was our first time dining there. The only downside, she was absent for a good chunk of the meal, only popping up here and there to deliver condiments and other things (granted their busy, but you should take extra special care of a first time diner) and can someone fill up my water glass?? You get thirsty eating bagel chips!  Food: Wife and I had the Prime Rib, which were excellent in terms of quality and price. The Prime Rib was Prime Grade beef and it showed. Now, I've eaten at some of the best Prime Rib Spots here in the valley (Durants/Stockyards come to mind) and in Las Vegas, but this place is now up there. Not Lawry's/House of Prime Rib good, but no one in AZ is in their league. They said they had the best Prime Rib in town, one would have to agree...   Salad: Deli style coleslaw. Vinegar and Sweet. Bring more now.   Bread: Warm and soft. Especially the comped cheesy bread. That stuff I could eat all day.   Dessert: Banana Cream Pie, ehh... I've had better.. Come to think.. You want good banana cream pie? Head to Emeril's Delmonico..  Atmosphere: Nothing fancy, but clean and orderly. Nice baseball memorabilia on the wall. Only one problem. Its soooooo loud. Not obnoxious (well, except this one girl who sang happy birthday out-loud.. to the whole restaurant.. and she was a patron), but I had speak a tone that is not conducive to a trying to eat and digest a full pound of Prime Rib. Can they have less tables and charge like 5-10 more per entree? That would solve that. Or maybe we should go at like 7:30pm when all those grey hair had left....

cfzKmCtjGow7tcoSmKh_ig.text: At one time I would have gave Don & Charlies 4 or 5 stars. My two favorite things about Don & Charlies are now gone.  1.) They used to give chopped liver with every meal as an appetizer and it was amazing. Now, they no longer give it and instead charge for it as a starter. Also, something about the recipe has changed. It isn't bad or anything, but it sure doesn't taste homemade anymore.  2.) my favorite entree - what I used to come there for weekly - the trout, is no longer on the menu.   At one time I used to love this place, but now it seems just OK.

5tOgTpWh-gjT9pbbD_ZjEA.text: First time here: good food and great experience! The ribs are amazing and the sides are just as great! The service was exceptional, our waitress was Charlie, and she would be a sole reason to return-she made the whole experience!

82icx8ISyr08rsRqaRJEfQ.text: We had a wonderful evening that was made 10x better by our server, Chelsea.  Whatever you are paying her it is not nearly enough.  Friendly, informative and professional.  We'll be back again and we will ask specifically for her.

ItktydoNLldeljLzFiqB_w.text: Our family came for dinner and was really impressed with the service and the food. Our water glasses were never empty and we loved the fact that the kids food came out before the adults. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. Hot fudge sundaes were a hit as well!

FpiUu4xKFdNX5aIV13B3lw.text: We have been coming here for over 20 years.   One time, we flew in to town, had ribs here and flew home.   It is that good.    Tonight, we had dinner on the new patio.  This adds the last little touch to what was already an amazing place.     If you come here for the first time, do yourself a favor and order the ribs.    They are life altering.   I am not kidding you.

7hqZiV6RtYTTLJDWLTbCBg.text: Had the filet mignon with the special charred topping.  It was over done, not tender and no flavor.  Husband had a steak also over done, tough and no flavor.  Very disappointed.

CDDpopmlr86W1Fju2ZbRfw.text: It's a tradition for my stepfather to go to Don & Charlie's every time he comes to Scottsdale for Giants Spring Training.  I moved to AZ June 2013, so I got to go here as well as witnessing my first spring training as a resident of Scottsdale.  ANYWAY!  The food here is excellent.  I had a few whiskey sours by the time I got here and forgot what I ordered, but I'm sure any steak is phenomenal.  Mine was.  Also make sure you get a baked potato with your steak and a good salad to go with it.  It's a very classy joint, especially if you're a sports fanatic like me.

pvwxz3TPGJaRXaTk_rE2mA.text: Visited Don and Charlie's on the recommendation of a friend. House salad with balsamic vinaigrette was great. I don't understand it, but the baked potato was the best I've ever had. I opted for the ribeye prepared medium rare. The crust wasn't quite like Jeff Ruby's, but I would put the steak in the top 10 I've had. Decent local brews available and a good size wine list.  I'd definitely visit again.

nkJ1_K-9fleY1jjTit3Kvg.text: After living here for 30 years I was finally talked into eating here by some out of town friends. It's not a cheap place, but you are paying for central Scottsdale and walls of memorabilia. Lots of COOL Sports Memorabilia. As for the food, it was good. Nothing stunning, but good average food. Since they are "FAMOUS" for their ribs, I had to have them. They came sauce on and it's a good sauce. The Southwestern Sauce is the best, since it's spicier. I would prefer sauce off, with the nice char they had on them. The flavor was very good, though even having them sauced didn't compensate enough for the dry meat. Just a tiny bit over done, but still one of the better tasting ribs I've had in a new place for me. I'd say maybe the 5th best ribs I've eaten in the valley. They should vacuum seal them after smoking to keep them moist till they put them on the grill for a nice char. They do cost about $8 more than I think they are worth for a full rack. Their slaw and baked potato are top notch. Loved the potato. The best I've had in years with a wonderful herb crust. As for the other dishes at the table, The Salmon was happily enjoyed along with a big steak. The Cobb salad next to me looked fantastic. So were the deserts enjoyed by other people. I'm glad I was full. It's a neat place for a once a year meal, but not the type of place I'd eat at regularly since the food isn't much different than most similar chain restaurants.

Z9G4vRGf6J_9BCNPwXj3ug.text: this place might have been good at some point, but not any longer.  if you like iceburg lettuce salads and deep fried fish this is yr place. the steaks are tough. good service. nice old school atmosphere, but what matters is the food and it seems to be low quality and unhealthy. feel so yucky as i leave w empty pockets go somewhere else.

cYTQ1m2untj7slADF2opTg.text: Went to Don & Charlies for the first time a couple of weeks ago. Very good food! Everything we ordered was just perfect. I thought I had a big sports collection before I saw this place. We ate in the bar area because we did not have reservations. I was disappointed at first but to be honest, it was much better than the main dinning room which is packed wall to wall with tables and as noisy as one could imagine. The bar area was much more quiet and a better dining experience. I will always try to eat in the bar area. Only open from 5 to 9:30 so go early.

CQtQwWFs4jWzfCWURMeD_w.text: OK, they have a ton of sports' memorabilia.  As for food, maybe 3 out of four of us just picked the wrong entree.  One porkchop for $24?  Meatless ribs.  I am sure there are 20 other great barbecue places, without, unfortunately, 500 signed baseballs.

aj___sxA0NNSKN6skK28Aw.text: Love this place! Great food and great service. Robbie is an amazing server! He was very observant and continuously checked back on us to make sure we didn't need anything. He gave great recommendations on meals and made our experience wonderful. It was our first time here and we will be back because of him.

Vxch03TiqjSsKNNsGR38EA.text: Great place 1st time had the ribs and gold brick...  And my waitress was exceptional ...think her name was Amy...yeah it was Amy

vl1cHifXHYzk0OULJFwTug.text: Had a great dinner this past week at Don & Charlie's and actually got to meet one of the owners. So cool.  Anyways, the food was really good. My favorite was the chopped liver appetizer (only regret is I ate it so fast and wanted more - it was that GOOD) and the filet mignon I had for dinner. The Caesar salad had a little too much dressing on it so next time will ask for a little lighter but nothing near drowning in dressing worthy of being sent back.  The atmosphere is really comfortable and not like a stuffy steakhouse I have seen at other higher end locations.  Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls. If in the downtown Scottsdale area and craving good steak, ribs, etc. Definitely check out Don & Charlie's. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yelp Elite Event at Don &amp; Charlie&#39;s

7HGtEcaGxpolCKsEU8GawA.text: Not a lot to say about this quality restaurant.  For many years they've consistently served great Chicago fare.  The sports memorabilia is incredible and impressive.  The only complaint I have with this restaurant is that the service is hit and miss.  Lucky for them their food makes up for poor service.  This place is a definite must try.

UoSl0QqzJXYfXJUc2W7c1A.text: The number is averaging of food vs ambiance. Our food was pretty good though the price keeps increasing. The government is part of the problem. I had broasted chicken for the first time which was great.  I added a wedge salad which might have been overpriced. My wife had salmon which seemed high for $24 but adding au gratin potatoes added $4. My well vodka martini at $12.50 plus a couple of glasses of Sauvignon Blanc added another $30.   I am not sure what things should cost these days. Adding tax and a fair tip then paying and tipping the valet brought this to $119 for a simple dinner for two. Service was great. Neighboring tables were loud and obnoxious.

ilUIjG3Rm2Ip364bzG_orQ.text: Never thought I would be writing this one especially after going here for twenty years. Getting a bad meal does happen but all four of us at the same time. What has happened to this place???. The server was not very good to say the least. Didn't seem to understand different meat temps(i think she was a vegetarian). Filet ordered med rare came out med, prime rib ordered med rare came or med I asked if they had any VERY rare prime rib before ordering, was told I can order it for you, asked if she could check to see if they had any VERY rare before ordering as I know very well that they run out if it early, and would order something else if they were out,  she insisted she could "order it rare" I repeated very rare and she insisted she could deliver, sure enough it came out med, not even rare, looked identical to the other one we had ordered med rare that was med. She said she would get me another, again I said if you don't have any VERY rare I will order something else. She brought me out another aside from being a very poor cut it was med rare. She was getting closer but still not rare let alone VERY rare. I asked if she knew what VERY rare was., she said would you like it "black and blue" seriously, prime rib prepared black and blue!! I said forget it I'll have the NY strip cooked VERY rare. She asked if I wanted it black and blue, I said no, but VERY rare. When it finally came out it was rare, still not VERY rare. But at least it was rare and it was a dry steak, not very juicy as was the filet one of us had that was also overcooked.  Overall the quality of the food served  was well below what I had come to expect after 20+ years of frequenting the place. When the waitress brought out the check she made a point of saying she took the prime rib that I sent back( because it was overcooked & she was to either stubborn or ignorant to see if they had any VERY rare) off the check(like she was doing me a favor) and replaced it with the NY strip that I ordered for an additional $8.   There were more issues with the service but enough said, just a very poor experience at what WAS my favorite place in Scottsdale to get a great steak and always recommended it for the food not just the memorabilia. I guess that's all changed now.

fJfy_7spvQvCIg_P7_c5kg.text: If you are a sports fan, you need to come here.  I am not a huge sports fan but I was nonetheless taken in with the amount of memorabilia, which covered the walls, ceilings and doors from the entrance throughout the entire restaurant.    Great energy in restaurant, but also intimate.  Friendly service, and good menu choices.  I tried both the rib eye and fillet steaks, charred ("Don's style").  Both steaks were perfectly cooked and tasted better than expected.

dLx3nBhG_QdnVdwcSo_k3w.text: Wow, we expected top quality for $40 + pp.  Instead, my sis had red wine spilled on her by waitress (they covered up the stained tablecloth with a napkin instead of moving us), the calamari was over breaded and tasteless, the meat, fish and salad was tasteless, the decor was dusty.  Waitress had a nice smile, but this 60s era supper club style place needs to get back to having great food properly cooked.  No amount of sports memoribilia can hide that.

odsNwVaLQUaUdplFPZVBpQ.text: Good food and really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Great place to go to with a large group of friends.

DsqlWn-0ffnfk4HmKhacVQ.text: What a cool restaurant.  If you are into baseball you have to visit this place..  They are known for their Burnt Ribs.  I think my rack just didn't have enough fat on them to maintain moisture.  A little original sauce and it was on point..  Will be back but be sure to bring your check book on this one.

_N-N99sdQ9UaefYGQWKObg.text: I was lucky to have another delicious dinner at Don & Charlie's during my last work trip to Scottsdale. I don't eat red meat but they have excellent fish and seafood dishes. Hearty, tasty food and wonderful ambience. Love it.

VTPEubXbfNmvNfIQXcHmcg.text: This is a steak house the way real steak houses used to be.   Definitely for the more mature crowd...as we are....pushing 50! Loud, dark, excellent service, wonderful food. We came with friends, and would probably not come alone, as it does get loud with crowded tables....definitely would not bring kids.  Some yelpers have said that when they arrive, even with a ressie, they have to wait. We must have been lucky....we were seated immediately for our Saturday night 6:45 ressie. I'm not sure you could get into this place with out one. Oh! And they have valet parking for $7.00( a bit steep)...but there wasn't a spot to be found.  I was very impressed with the food quality...as we started off with a huge plate of onion skins, courtesy of yelp. At the table they give you sliced bagel crisps and rye bread.  I ordered the prime rib 12 oz medium rare with a side Caesar salad, mayo cole slaw,  and baked potato. Unfortunately they ran out of baked potatoes so I got potatoes au gratin. My steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I see why everyone loves the coleslaw....one of our guests said that he hadn't eaten a steak this good in a very long time.  Don and Charlie's isn't for everyone, it's not trendy or gourmet....it's just solid good steaks and ribs, older crowd atmosphere, with excellent service you should expect from a great restaurant.

IaCxYJnUFndaqnitjV6Tnw.text: BEST PRIME RIB I ever had. In Peoria for Spring Training this place was recommended by a friend in San Diego, thanks for the heads up Chuck. Worth a visit just for the baseball "museum".   Not inexpensive but worth every penny. Service was top notch, we ate outside on the patio could not have been better in any way.

9I5Ve3sJMKYcLR4M4g4Sqg.text: We went here last Friday night 1/10/14.   Had a reservation for 4 people at 8pm. Got there a few minutes early, ordered a drink in the bar.  A few minutes later our name was called. The place was packed, that is a testament to their customer following as the dining room is rather large.    It was our first time here.   I loved the complimentary crunchy, thin toasted bagels and rye bread.    We Ordered the artichoke dip (free for checking in with YELP) and It was good.    I had the 8oz charred filet, it was really good! I ate the whole thing!  It was served with a salad and a ginormous twice baked potato! I couldn't eat half of it, but it reheats very well wrapped in tin foil in the toaster oven. FYI.   Ryan ordered prime rib, Peggy and Haynes both ordered ribs with cold slaw.   We all enjoyed our dinner very much.   Good selection of wine and cocktails as well.   Very old school supper club kinda vibe mixed in with all that sports memorabilia.   We will definitely go back.  The management and waitstaff were very attentive and personable.   The ONLY gripe I have is that I wish people weren't dressed so casual.  We were all dressed up as it was Friday night and this isn't an inexpensive restaurant.   I felt sorta overdressed compared to the other customers, but not for the restaurant, if that makes sense.   I am guessing they have many local regulars who feel comfortable going " up the road" in their uggs and sweats or jeans and sweatshirts  for a nice steak.   But that complaint really has nothing to do with the restaurant and my dining experience.  I guess I feel the need to bring it up because it took me by surprise how some of the customers were so under dressed. More like a "Chilis and dollar movie night" rather than a $300 meal in a nice steakhouse kinda night. But anywho......   We really enjoyed the food, the waitstaff and management and we will be back..  Oh!! The creme brulee was wonderful! Banana cream pie was really good. The chocolate cake, huge and pretty good.   We will be back..  Excuse my choppy sentence review. But you get the drift. :)

IAHnW1_UGwFfdVoM1D1bfQ.text: Old and tired with food to match.  Feeling nostalgic, then by all means, go there.  Want good food, try somewhere else.

rLT0o3AEyYtgA3Jo4TrkLw.text: Service, dinner, wine and dessert were all excellent.  Our server (a former owner of a Greek restaurant, as he mentioned) was very attentive and during the meal's only misstep--when a friend's steak came out medium rare, and he was hoping for it to be rare--our server and management were very accommodating in bringing out a corrected portion.  Calamari and the cheese bread were great; we got a $70 bottle of wine which was excellent, and my steak (8 oz. filet) was succulent and perfectly cooked at medium rare.  Desserts were fine; the cheesecake was the star of the three that we had (cheesecake, chocolate cake, key lime pie).  I have had better servings of everything elsewhere, but all of the chow was solid.  My only knock is the space; while I'm sure it's fine for some, the low ceilings, tight restroom, and small tables (our table for six is a four-top in most cities I visit) make it much less than ideal for someone 6'1"...and worse for someone who's 6'7", like one of the guys I went with.  All of this is to say that if you are a meat-eater under 5'10", you are all good!

LAy_Sq1TIqtuAQDf5BcsTA.text: The food is good and the service is even better and Don & Charlie's; I've been here with just adults and other times with a group including a child and the staff really excels at giving the adults a wonderful dining experience while making the little ones feel just as welcome.

rnzU0J1Pzf9trr_tYX-qMw.text: So I recently went here with a friend and have been wanting to check this place for some time.    Ambiance-So this is a huge sports memorabilia shrine.  Your head will be on a swivel looking around at it all.  I'd say the place is casual, even though they say proper attire required.    Food-I ordered the signature ribs...and sorry to say..but I don't get it.  They say up front it's not meat falling off the bone type of ribs but I figured I'd give them a shot anyway since they hype it up so much...and say they've won awards..but I don't get it.  I barely got 1 bite per rib and had to really get after it to get any meat.  Uh, not award winning in my opinion so...I'd say order something else if you go here.    Service-A lot of retirees go there right at like 5:30-6 and they have blue plate specials and it got packed quick so service was a bit slow but understandable when you have that kind of a rush.    Overall-So if you want to grab a beer and enjoy the memorabilia and possibly see a famous baseball player during Spring Training I'd definitely check this place out.  I'll give it another shot with some of their other food selections next time but overall this place is legendary but the food in my opinion is average.

E0IF3qys6QSs6_HTy-B3-w.text: Had a wonderful dinner last Saturday. The place is always packed but with a reservation we were seated and served promptly. Excellent service. Looking forward to our next visit.

5T77knJNmEY-wE5NHWl4aw.text: Excellent restaurant. Steaks are as good as I have ever had. 20 oz. Ribeye was perfect. Great baseball memorabilia in this place. You will not be disappointed

dBECDDpyjL9Y8gvY9aX-Ig.text: Came here while on a short vacation with my family. My dad has eaten here before but wanted us kids to try it, as we all love a great steak & appreciate sports. I'll try & keep this review short & to the point. At first I was a little overwhelmed by all the people waiting to be seated, but then seeing how every inch of the place was filled with absolutely amazing sports memorabilia, you become lost in the greatness. That was just the first good part of the night. The best & most important part was CHARLIE (sorry if I misspelled your name ). When I tell you she gave the ABSOLUTE BEST service I have literally ever received in my life, I 100% genuinely mean that. She was SO attentive, kind, fun, caring & helpful to a table full of first timers & even my 4 year old. Watching her interact with other tables she waited on, I could tell she loved her job & was so outstanding at it. Nick (who bussed our table) always made sure we had water in our glasses & dishes cleared when needed. He was so polite & was totally on top of things. I can not tell you how incredibly happy I was with everything over all. I almost forgot to mention how great all our food was. Nice sized portions,  cooked to perfection. Makes me want to drive the 6 hours just to experience this wonderful place again. I would recommend this to anyone.

Zo91hDcSXrygV5ca-Kik1Q.text: The food and service is GOOD!  Their martinis are SUPERB!  Coleslaw and most entrees will not disappoint!  You get lots of food at a reasonable price. You will not leave this place hungry!  This is a landmark!  If you have to wait for a table enjoy the bar as they make great drinks!

v0HNQszaq-tH9Do9QNAhIg.text: I have been there at least 3 times and it's awesome especially if you like sports memorabilia.  It's a mainstay of the spring training teams in phx and it's obviously a favorite.  Yelp coupons for free appetizers if you check in there.  ] It gets very busy, no draft beer there.   Bar is small and it has it's regulars. Sometimes the bartender forgets the non regulars.   It's known for prime rib and "broasted" chicken.  Pressure cooked chicken.  I get it every time and I love it.   Ample choice of sides which leaves no room for dessert.  It's a great experience.

ZkiZlk-Y7YgpEXpuZO3ETA.text: A must for anyone who loves sports and steak! This historic place show cases some of the most amazing sports memorabilia that you have to see.   The food is also top notch. A classic chop house from Chicago that include huge portions. I've been here at least a dozen times but always get the bone-in ribeye. Its always cooked just right with a nice "char". I've tasted the prime rib, ribs, and filet - all solid choices.   The service is equally exceptional - from the bartenders to the wait staff, the host\ess to the buss boys - I've was always treated with warm welcomes. I have two small boys, and the wait staff and busboys made sure they were comfortable.  This is my favorite place to go whenever I'm in Scottsdale.

1je3wDQPu0uRoWaIWKLtXg.text: Again....this place never disapoints!  Steak perfect...prawns amazing. ..and our server..Cooper...is most amazing!   Thank you for a special day!  :)

7IaF1ecRqE_dGrGpxK_ghQ.text: Hours are not accurate on Yelp. They are not open until dinner. I called and a gentleman answered and said they were open and we can come down. When we got there the front doors were locked. When I called back a lady answered and said that they are not open for lunch only dinner. As baseball fan visiting from So Cal this was very disappointing. That the yelp info was incorrect as well as their staff giving miss information.

1cECK1xtqFnFp5mRzZ1Tgg.text: Came on a busy Friday night and the ASU football team was dining here, backing up all the food orders.  Despite the fact that we waited a long time for our food and stayed 2.5 hours there, the servers were actually great.  Our server was only 4-days into her training and she was very attentive.  Bread selection before dinner was unique with assorted bagel crisps and some strong anise (I think) flavored bread.  We ordered the chopped liver appetizer and it was decent given it was my first time trying it.  My parmesan crusted New York strip steak was medium rare as requested and tasted great.  The Parmesan crust was not very prominent and didn't add much so wasn't necessary in my opinion.  The sides (potatoes au gratin, onion rings, mushrooms) were okay but nothing special.  Dessert was my favorite course.  We shared their triple layer chocolate cake and chocolate sundae.  Cake was soft and chocolatey of course.  The sundae was very frozen vanilla ice cream in a chilled glass with dark fudge and fresh whipped cream on the side.  The sundae was delicious but could have used more toppings.
