"Where are the nuts?!" my aunt said. We also got envious of our neighbors' amazing looking giant banana cream pie and turtle brownie.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Triple layer choc cake
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate sundae yum!

DR6Ghahsk2wWtQPYuoEMiw.text: Don and Charlie's....your food was AMAZING! Everything we ordered was delicious! My only gripe was the wait time and how long we actually waited for our meals to be served. Other than that, just about a 5-star rating.  We didn't have reservations so we walked in and the hostess said about an hour and 15 minutes. Tables and customers were turning around left and right, which was a good sign. We waited about 40 minutes.   Service was awesome, our waitress (Claire), was super nice, checked on us often and was pleasant. After we ordered and got our appetizer (delicious calamari), we ended up waiting a very long time for our main course to be served. Claire checked on us a few times and apologized.   My rib eye steak (rare +) was cooked to perfection! The Shrimp Marinara was AWESOME, loved my potato au gratin and salad was good. Overall a great dining experience. A must dine if you're in the area for a SF Giants spring training game or just stopping by. Reservations recommended. Full bar, $5 valet parking and tons of sports memorabilia! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loved my rib eye (bone-in) and potato au gratin!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Marinara....SO GOOD!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chopped salad.

7OMYdYa4xZbjtChvFx0HkQ.text: Long time popular casual Arizona favorite restaurant. Still one of the best local restaurants in Phoenix. Menu has stayed consistent for a very long time.  Covered from wall to ceiling with remarkable sports memorabilia capturing the history of Chicago sports as well as Arizona spring baseball training games. Chicago based, part of the great Lettuce entertain you family of restaurants. Always Delicious food, great service.   Great broasted chicken, creamy cole slaw and perfectly cooked large salt-crusted loaded baked potato.  Caesar took excellent care of us as the entire staff is very attentive and friendly.  Check this restaurant out as you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sports memorabilia
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Broasted chicken
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creamy cole slaw

qppxEHxp_70kJMZoo7v6rA.text: This place is an icon but will be closing and/or moving in 2019. The baked potato is great and the pork chop is amazing. Don't miss the skoog pie for dessert

0Z2agUtm_mt_bACW8N9isg.text: Had a great time at Don & Charlie's.... from the food to the service to the atmosphere. Awesome. My waitress suggested a great wine when I told her my preference, and was prompt with every part of my meal. She was great! I sat in the bar to watch the game while I had dinner.   Steak was perfectly cooked, mashed red skinned potatoes were delicious and side salad with balsamic vinaigrette was good. I wasn't really a fan of the coleslaw. It was pretty bland compared to everything else, and being from the Midwest.... coleslaw was never something I served with steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Rp9grSzC5Do2PieWf9QhzA.text: Classic steakhouse with delicious food! My one year old even at the chopped liver! Great prime rib and great martinis

O2dD-yz7JkgCOiaQBy9QMA.text: What a thrill to go to this iconic eatery. We tried to go a few years back and it was too crowded so we passed. Not this time.  I made reservations on open table online for 8 pm. And even at 7:30 the front was wall to wall as was the entrance and the bar and the dining room all confirming that so many have experienced the pleasure of the company here. The staff is top notch. From the hostess to the bartender to our amazing server our experience was great! I had the Chicken limone which was excellent. Served with wilted spinach and mushrooms.I added the potato au gratin and was a great meal. The presentation of the full bone short rib was likewise amazing.  But my only wish is to be granted the pleasure of spending about an hour in the place to explore examine and enjoy the mementos before opening someday. Wow, the stuff I saw made me want to interrupt the patrons to see what is on the wall behind every table.  I heard rumors of the days being numbered for this place. I sincerely hope that it stays open forever!  Thanks to all of you at Don and Charlies!!! Until next time.

XSlqAWw6SmmXlj9xT2P4QQ.text: Amazing restaurant with a lot of sports collectibles and great food and great service.  I ordered the ba

e9LbxC7pJR5lkiDUTn4K-w.text: If it weren't for the charming waitress I would have given this imposter one star. I would rate this restaurant as a bit lower then an ordinary diner. A sub par skirt steak .  Small everyday baked potato. Luke warm coffee, and they try to rush you, so as to turn the table. Bus boys try to remove the food before you have finished. Even the doggie bag, and why I even asked for one I'll never know, was left open, and contained the  steak and the shell of the potato. The kicker was they charged a valet fee of 6 dollars to have the honor of eating this garbage. In closing these are the good things.

y7fZCP1e5UFm9SAx1uAhXw.text: Three of us visited DC March 1 for a birthday.  Amazing as always. All of the baseball memorabilia you can't possibly see on one visit.  The sad thing is they have announced that they will be closing there doors in May of 2019.  Our entire town is heartbroken. It's a part of Old Town Scottsdale history since 1981.  If you get a chance please check it before it's gone.

u1-ddSi2IEwovDea9kwbiw.text: I am proud to have Don and Charlie's be a regular place to go with family and friends whether it's for a happy hour, early weekday dinner after work, or a special occasion. There is something for everyone on the menu though I think there's more options for meat eaters in the family. My personal favorites are the rib and BBQ chicken combos and a nice steak in the restaurant or a burger and fries in the bar area. I am rarely lucky enough to get beef ribs (which are first-come, first serve but run out very quickly due to popularity). The service is great, and I especially enjoy the gold brick sundae for dessert! You can make reservations through Open Table or their own website, and there are many ways to get a discount and birthday rewards whether it is through the Lettuce Entertain You Restaurant program (leye.com/frequent-diner-...) or Don and Charlie's e-mail or text clubs (donandcharlies.com). I definitely recommend this Staple of Phoenix restaurant to everyone though plan accordingly with parking. There is valet parking, limited parking at the restaurant, and additional street parking nearby.

T2mRoah43Mx3F9W42XbJbg.text: This is definitely the best steakhouse I've been to in Scottsdale and beyond.  Great atmosphere, the quality of our food was superb and perfectly cooked.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  A great place to eat with friends.  Thanks Don for a memorable meal!!!

DCKiNNPW8iC9fFH45vUBjg.text: We had a nice dinner with some friends last night at Don and Charlie's. The food was good, the service was good and the atmosphere was interesting. The place has no sign but google maps will take you right to it so trust it.

3dXTjZlw4xUMJO7aZR0v0g.text: OK food but mostly you come for the atmosphere and all the sports memorabilia. Our waiter Robert was amazing made the entire experience so much better than the food. My shrimp scampi was delish and others enjoyed the  ribs but no one enjoyed the old favorite Chicken Schnitzel (they changed the recipe and wasn't as good as it used to be. The cheesy potatoes as good as always. Will be cautious when ordering next time but will for sure ask again to be in Roberts section he was one of the best waiters I've had anywhere.

Y9p2df-y2nfS9ucN1A4geA.text: Supperclub nostalgia meets good comfort food. Came for the ribs and left satisfied! Each of us ate the ribs Don's way which had that perfect char - yum! They are "chewy" style (not fall-off-the-bone) which is what we prefer. No extra sauce needed, though it was nice to try the Southwest version which added a little jalapeno kick. The french onion soup is excellent (worth sharing so you've got room for protein), the onion straws are light, flavorful and not greasy (great for sharing between 2-4 too). The baked potatoes are delish with that salt-crusted skin. We had great service too - all dishes were nicely timed and we never felt rushed.  Note, their Moscow Mules do not come in a copper cup (thanks to the losers who feel it's ok to steal from restaurants! :( )

vjtRxmMGOn2Zj_iLoJz2Iw.text: This place is a MUST GO for so many reasons!!! 1. The collection of sports memorabilia is unbelievable and includes a box of signed baseballs by dozens of hall of famers. 2. The food is dynamite! Their broasted chicken is literally the best "fried" chicken I've ever had (sorry Mom).  3. The service is absolutely spectacular! They are attentive, quick and my personal favorite is Robby who is hilarious and so accommodating! 4. Lastly, the banana cream pie...OMG!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Cream Pie made in house daily!

mMy4i266ZjvnaytWeacYZw.text: I always Love to go to Don & Charles ! Best Coconut Shrimp and New York Strip ! I like dining in the Bar area with a Nice Booth ! Been going for 32 years ! 10 years as a Vacationer and 20 as s Resident . Great service from food Server Krista

B4TpkPvCydSmiP8y2wo-MA.text: Superb !   Do not miss this gem!!  Great for the gang especially if there are sports fans in your group!   Go for the chopped liver appy !!  The ribs are exquisite !  Goood portions.  Great value!  Awesome service.....

e3-YKFoDSLAMdjR5jmpHNA.text: What a wonderful Rosh Hashonah Meal tonight. It doesn't get any better than that with all the trimmings.

UBe5AmW33d8ObGo7IeGmXg.text: The ribs and twice baked potato are amazing . Everything from The service to the food is perfect .  The ambiance is very fun and casual with sports memorabilia everywhere .  Love this spot.

GrTK9oyQy-GF-gskrums1g.text: Great food can be found anywhere. Great service is one in a million these days. This place gets an A+ in the most awful service I have ever received and if you have/had a Groupon for this place like I did, don't even bother going. You'll be treated worse than a bothersome fly on a hot and humid day.  It's simple. Businesses put  their name out by working with daily coupon sites like Groupon, LivingSocial, etc., to garner new and potential repeat customers. Instead, after going there with my handy coupon, I can't help but drive by this place on the way home and think nothing but the horrible experience I received.   I went with my boyfriend and bought the Groupon because I was impressed due to online reviews and decided to splurge on a good ole' prime rib. We sit down, am impressed with the old school decor, and then the server from Azkaban appears. We tell her that we'd like to order off the special evening menu where it's a little cheaper and tell her joyfully that we found this place through Groupon and that it's our first time. Wrong thing to do. I don't know if it's because past Groupon-ers don't tip well or something, but I could swear her smile immediately turned 180 degrees in an instant.   It took our food (the chicken and prime rib) almost 33 minutes to come out. All we did was nom ... and nom ... and nom on the watery coleslaw and gritty liver (which isn't to blame since I was never a liver fan). Not once did our server come by our table. We watched her run into the kitchen and either not come back out for a while or attend to other tables. It was another server that came out and gave us our food so we let our frustration go since it wasn't her fault and there's no use in calling her out for nothing. We asked if she knew where our server was, and she said she would look for her. 10 minutes later, nothing, yet it was the new server who kept coming back, asking if everything was alright like a normal server should.   Then it was time for the check and we just wanted to get out of there since we were basically ignored. 17 minutes pass, no check came even though our  table had been cleared. Our server was still MIA so we asked a random server to give us our check. He said he would tell our server to bring it back and we told him straight up that we didn't even want to see her face so another random server brought it back.  We had a table of 4 sitting next to us who even leaned over and asked us why we were being so calm when our non-existent server was treating us like crap. We didn't even want to bother waiting another 20 minutes just to talk to a manager since apparently the only way the servers here communicate is by playing Telephone so we just left after paying. The table beside us told us that they were going to complain for us since we wanted to leave, but whether they did or not I didn't even care at that point.   To be honest, I can't even remember what the food tasted like, which isn't quite fair in a review. I went here a couple of months ago, but I have never had an experience where service overrode the taste of food. I'm pretty sure prisoners in a cafeteria get more attention than I did.  Maybe it wasn't even the Groupon. Who knows. All I know is that we ran out of there like Usain Bolt and tell anyone who asks about our worst dining experience that this is the place to experience it.

f3wuqtecc_dNsO484AZ9Hw.text: We at here just over a week ago, on a Sunday night during Spring Training.  We made a last minute reservation, and didn't have to wait too long, even though the restaurant was packed.  The memorabilia is FABULOUS!  And definitely gives you something to do while you wait.  I ordered the Parmesan Crusted New York and requested it "Don's Way", which is charred.  I also ordered a side of broccoli and a salad.  The salad was fabulous.  I don't know why it was so good, but it just tasted great!  The New York Steak was the best steak I have ever had.  The charred parmesan crust was amazing!  I would highly recommend ordering your meat "Don's Way"!!!  The broccoli was just broccoli, which is what I expected.  The steak was also served with grilled onions and mushrooms.  Sooo good!  The only downside to our night was our service.  The waitress took forever to bring us our food, drink orders, etc.  She was just awful.  I would definitely go back to Don & Charlies, even though we had bad service.

RjFrDRJYjRyOUF18TTJ6Iw.text: Went with my out of town family on December 23rd (9 people total) and had a 7:00 reservation. We have been eating here since 1986 whenever family comes to visit. We have always had a great experience but not this time and when I sent an email directly to the company they have never responded to me. We were sat in the room off the bar and we were next to a make shift partition wall and right outside the kitchen door. So to say the ambiance was terrible in an understatement. The server was very nice and helpful. Unfortunately, 2 of the dishes that she spoke VERY highly of were already sold out. It was 7:00 PM and they open around 5:00 PM and they were already sold out of 2 MENU items, not specials.  This is not acceptable. Since we were right outside the kitchen we got to hear all the kitchen noise and chatter also.  Plus we had to keep waiting on the server for refills and other things we needed. Not what I would call "fine dining" experience. Overall it was a poor experience and my family expressed their disappointment as well so we will not be going back which is sad since we have been eating there for 30 years. I originally went to the Don and Charlies website to express my disappointment because I did not want to go right to Yelp with a bad review but they never responded to me so I guess THEY REALLY DO NOT CARE.

eYGgI5n7ACbkl4EpE4W0-w.text: Came here for date night with my Husby and we both ordered steaks. Had their wine and my husband had a cocktail. Its definitely an older scene, we were seated in the booth area at the bar. Its a cool place, with a cool ambiance. Lots of sports memorabilia which is fun. The service is alright, our waitress wasn't too helpful and our steaks came out over cooked and cold. We didn't want to complain as it still tasted ok but I don't think we will be back again. Overall everything was a ok but not amazing. Good for older people, not young couples.

0sQXOYNefkApA3WKcmBa3A.text: Went here last night with a friend to use up a gift card. Not a single complaint! The waitress rattled off the specials efficiently and was very attentive. I ordered the chicken schnitzel and was surprised by the huge portion (two large pieces). I also ordered the caesar salad which was prepared perfectly. I checked in on yelp and got a free onion ring appetizer large enough to feed ten people. So, guess what I'm having for lunch in a few minutes? woohoo. I'll be back.

XUDV1kylCkkIb3oxMstw8A.text: Other than catching spring training baseball games, Don & Charlie's is a close number 2 on my to-do list when visiting Scottsdale, AZ.  This establishment should be on every visitor's must do list.  The memorabilia is unsurpassed, the food excellent and the service attentive.   In the lounge area the bar is staffed by veteran bartender Shelly, the single most professional and personable bartender that I have ever encountered.  I travel to Phoenix and Scottsdale for business about 5-6 times per year plus I take in spring training.  After my first visit to Don & Charlies, I walked in and sat down and Shelly looked and me and said hello to me by first name after nearly one year and only my first visit; somehow she remembered me from the previous year.  After sitting down for awhile, it was apparent that Shelly knew all the customers and introduced folks to each other.    On another visit with my wife and in-laws for spring training, she asked me for my business card.  About two weeks later I received a very nice note handwritten thanking me for coming to the restaurant and mentioning my wife and in-laws.  Shelly is by far the best bartender I have had the honor of being served by.   I stopped in two nights ago for dinner and a glass of water and the next day I had an e-mail message thanking me and wishing me a happy Thanksgiving.  That is service that is unsurpassed.  I would recommend Shelly and Don & Charlie's to all baseball fans who travel to Scottsdale for spring training and to those just visiting during the off-season.  One word of caution, during the season, they take reservations one-month in advance unless you try to sit and eat in the bar.

2B-NukM9gI38_jDrOk2p6g.text: I was wondering why this place is only open from 5-9?  Well, I found out why...the majority of customers were senior citizens.   The food was just OK.  Salads, Ok, nothing special.   The halibut special was decent, but the mango sauce was way too sweet and overpowering.  The ribs had good flavor, but not a lot of meat.  Their au gratin potatoes were bland and the twice baked potato was burned on top and the insides were overpowered with bacon and onion flavor. Service was great, and creme brule for desert was delicious. Don't need to come back...

l1k0D49vvfwvpHtXOFCYnQ.text: Ribs are great!  Shelly the bartender is probably the best server I've ever had.  But......do you have to charge $5.00 to valet and $4.00 for augratin potatoes?

gVlAX6SZNQ7GcgDlo3JCeg.text: I've been to this place twice and just can't seem to spend enough time looking at all the sports memorabilia.  The food is 4/5.  If you're a sports fan (any sports), go check this place out.

qYfPp5chjfncrkf03B0rZw.text: This is the second time I have been there this year and it did not disappoint. We had 4 adults and 2 kids. We ordered the kids food with our drinks and it came out with our soups and salad so the kids had plenty of time to eat. The server was very nice and patient with the kids too. The only thing I was disappointed in was that I remembered them having onion strings but today they had rings. Not nearly as good as the strings. Other than that the New York steak, fried chicken, shrimp scampi (Chicago style) and ribs were all great. If you are going to go make a reservation.

jorpVJrx2eedNARE53WVIA.text: This probably my all time favorite American restaurant.  Went here frequently when I lived in AZ.  Now it is my must go restaurant when I am in Phoenix.  I live in 'So Cal and still think about Don & Charlie's.  Stand outs were the chopped liver appetizer, prime rib, potatoes au gratin.  Can't wait to come back even if prices are higher now than before!

1f7XYkJcIt9saN8zYUTOUA.text: What a special evening at my first time at don and Charlie's. First, we had one of the most friendly and helpful servers I have experienced in quite some time. Her name was Pam and she was excellent in explaining, suggesting ideas, and quick service. The onion strings appetizer is piled high on the plate and was hot and crisp. Our cocktails were exceptional and they have a great variety for all at the table. I enjoyed my coconut shrimp entree and it was more than I could eat since their salads are wonderful with lots of homemade dressings to try and chilled well and delicious. I tried my daughters prime rib and hands down we all agreed best prime rib anywhere! Since it was my birthday I was served a house sundae that is similar to eating a Klondike bar. Yummy ending to our meal and plus I got to blow out a candle! Fun evening and positively going back again soon!!

QB_yqEKdTDYscc3IJvd4ew.text: Was here for Spring Training.  Have ben here a few times in the past. HAD to come again.  Did not get there right when they opened so had to wait in lounge...so it is a little noisier, but that is ok.  I ordered the 16 oz Prime Rib...medium rare....added a salad and red mashed potatoes.  EXCELLENT as always.    Oh and I ordered the Creme brulee !!  SOOOO good.  I was full!!   This is one of my favorite restaurants.  I love the sports memorabilia and I wish you could come in when NOT busy and look at all of it.   I would pay to do so!

X688S9f911wagazny1YN6w.text: Stopped here for a bite and bev while visiting AZ for SpringTraining. This place GOES OFF and is super busy - even on weekday nights during Spring Training. Worth it though as the atmosphere is baseball themed (almost Scottsdale's own HOF) and the food is great as well. A must stop if in town for baseball.

KbnZTBpF3esvKfzfsi0-0g.text: I went during spring training! They have a wonderful atmosphere! The wait is enjoyable because they is lots of sports memorabilia to look at! Plus, the food was amazing and service was great! Highly recommended (especially for sports fans)!

W6q5PnB45YOTBOnbHGFcGg.text: This place rocks!  If your adventurous, try the liverwurst platter.  If I am near Scottsdale, I will be eating here without question.  Bartender is very friendly and makes you feel at home if it's your first or 10th visit.  The ribs are not to my liking but I prefer fall off the bone.  If you like to chew off the bone ribs, give them a shot.  A MUST try is the creamy coleslaw and boasted chicken.  I am not a baseball fan but if you are the memorabilia will rock your world.

ZZJWF-x8H5rmLHtq0_GWLw.text: A must try for all steak lovers and sports lovers. Make reservations because it is very busy

XyYFzh0KEjTRI06EocPvOw.text: I'm giving Don & Charlies 5 stars because it is an all around solid steakhouse. Everything I've tried here has been really good, from the shrimp cocktail, to their salads, and of course their big, juicy, tender steaks. But it isn't just good food, management,  servers, and even their valet guys understand what good service is. The owner/managing partner I  met was super sweet, and seemed very down to earth, in fact this whole restaurant is very cool and unpretentious. The prices are not low, but well worth a splurge. Well done Don & Charlies!

SWw90LiupMMD_jy0BKDzxg.text: The steak was amazing!!! If you like more than one side with your meal be prepared to order one more. Service was good. The inside could be remodeled to give it a fresh look.

8RpFZEt9iwieeejDMR2i1w.text: so I'll break this out in 2 parts. went here for a birthday dinner. had the family here from all over the us. we had 7 in our party. 6 were there on time..one was running 10 minutes late because of traffic. the women at the front ( old lady with fake red hair) wouldn't seat then 6 till the 7th showed. 3 of the 6 that were there are 85+ years old...2 with walkers. I understand the if only 1 of 7 were there ..but 6 of 7...with very old people..and you make them stand around and wait for the 7th is a terrible policy...and she was rude. the food was good...but the one rude lady with the fake red hair left a bad taste for the rest of the evening. we'll pick other place  to spend $1500 for dinner...if I was in charge i' d have a chat with this women about customer service

xx_QwbLY45u66COGI1aJQw.text: We went to Don and Charlie's on a very busySunday evening.  We had seven o'clock reservations and when we checked in there was no way we were going to be seated any time soon.  The waiting area is filled with all sorts of sports memorabilia which was interesting to look at while waiting.  We were seated in the dining room after a 20 minute wait.  It was like sitting in a bee hive.  I was unable to talk to my dining companion because of the noise.  Our waitress took our order promptly. It was obvious she was used to this environment and did a super job taking care of us.  I had the filet duo which was cooked to my liking and it was delicious.  The cheesy au gratin potatoes for an up charge were ok,nothing really special.  In summary the meal was good, nothing out of the ordinary to rave about.  The biggest drawback is the noise.

UyFe8NsvsS-t1athv53M3w.text: I've been here 4 times and it's always excellent. I highly recommend it if you're here for spring training...or any time  Bone-in ribeye was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone-in Ribeye with twice baked

-xarZFHcZ0kvEg0O-16pQA.text: A great iconic steak house.  Prime steaks ribs, cocktails.   The best.  Jerseys,  autographed baseball's, and posters everywhere.  Awesome.

gy16BLiZTdy_t7j4_bEnHA.text: My experience at Don and Charlie's was great. My family started with the spinach  and artichoke dip . . . YUM! I loved the macaroni and cheese while my mom had chicken Caesar salad, my dad had barbecue chicken, and my cousin had a full rack of ribs. The portions were hefty and everyone was happy. The best part of the meal was the ice cream and homemade hot fudge. So amazing!!

vnkrV5wA_2_R99o2GfSJ5w.text: Decided to take my wife here for her birthday and was completely satisfied with all aspects of our experience. We booked our reservation and was met promptly at the door and sat in our seats within one minute. Bread brought to the table and our waiter introduced himself and asked us for our drink orders and recommended a good wine based on our intended dinner choices. Robby has not only a great personality but was also great at suggesting a dinner that was not listed. I chose that suggestion and my wife chose the prime rib and both were outstanding! At the end of the meal, he also brought my wife a complimentary creme brulee for dessert and it too was delicious :-).

z5Oj86FDYbQK4NCZd99wUQ.text: I ate last night at don and Charlie's and I'm still throwing up not sure which part of the meal is the cause possible food poisoning I have never felt this sick scared of possibly poor hygiene in the kitchen

fMR4DNZBk-ORtWhV_CPjOA.text: Wow! What a disappointment! I remember going to Don & Charlie's for an elite event a few years ago and especially loving the creme brulee because there was a rich chocolate layer that gave you the sense the entire dish was built on a hershey's bar!   We came to Don & Charlies last week as a part of our Steak Out (search for the best steak in the Valley) --I recommended it with dessert in mind! -- and within 3 bites, we could confidently say this was not it!   My tomato soup was good but that's about the only nice thing I can say about this visit!  Overall, the experience failed to meet expectations.  My fillet was barely seasoned and was cooked to medium well, despite being ordered medium. We discussed sharing our disappointment with the waitress but we noticed others weren't sending food back, so we figured it was common practice for the kitchen.  The cheesy bread appetizer (complimentary with check in) took forever to arrive, so by the time it did I had had my fill of bread from the standard issue basket.  There was nothing notable about the creamed spinach.  The chocolate at the bottom of my creme brulee more closely resembled a faint layer of chocolate pudding than the rich, chocolatey hershey's bar I remembered.  Sadly, I'm in no rush to go back.

N65N6LGq8oOgiygw4KhBXg.text: Don & Charlie's is a MUST for any sports lover. I finally got around to taking my fiance here on his birthday, and I'm glad to say he liked it as much as I thought he would. Very very cool place with good food. Best lemon drop in town! I need to come back more often for cocktails and appetizers. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Memorabilia
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak &#34;sandwich&#34;

Qbt_QdGMWRStk5eoIgjIPg.text: We had a great dinner at Don & Charlie's.  But even more fantastic was our waiter, Robbie. Besides being very attentive and friendly, he had the best sense of humor of any food server we've ever had at any restaurant.  He also took the time to answer our questions regarding sports, which is the theme of the restaurant.  Great service and great food!

1Y8taCtHqbk4Blywo6afRg.text: A classic that I wish I had known about years ago. In Phoenix for a family event and had a great dinner for 8 of us on a Saturday night. Everything you'd want in a classic steakhouse plus some amazing memorabilia. Service was prompt and attentive. Filet was cooked to perfection. Nice wine list and reasonably priced.

TMBIFFeIThExBeN4cpVdlQ.text: I always enjoy visiting Don & Charlie's when I am in town  They have a great menu and the service is outstanding   Shelly the Bartender is a #10 on my list.

PXjggYz_UuozOL-hrexEWA.text: Great meal and service! I had the ribeye, and my dinner companion had the prime rib, and we both loved our meals. The specialty char crust finish is amazing, and I recommend any of their items with char crust. Baked potato was wonderful with char crust skin, salad was nice and fresh, and my friend loved the French onion soup. Service was attentive and thoughtful. I'll definitely return when back in Scottsdale.

O87ouk-kizAQBByceFXsCQ.text: Dined with 9 colleagues for a team dinner. My boss had been raving about this place for at least 2 weeks. The minute we sat down she said she will be having the Chicken Limone.   We ordered the Liver which was great. 3 Spinach and Artichoke Dips which left us speechless and Fried Strings.   When it came time to order the entrees our server said "We are out of Chicken Limone." My boss immediately told her that is why we're here. She came back with the manager who honestly explained that his chef went on vacation and he wasn't happy with how the current chef made the Chicken Limone so he didn't want to offer it. We thanked him for his transparency and because of that my boss said she would like to try it anyway and it was great. He promised he would watch him cook it.   We will be back.

jItknj84sAMXdiRT-MqVlQ.text: Mediocre and cold food (too much AC), snarky servers, amazing memorabilia.  No wonder they are going out of business.  Way over-priced

CVuhuV8d7Re6NKRFqxPF7Q.text: So I was lucky enough to snipe a bar seat on a busy night, and boy am I glad I did. Jamie and company were great. Unreal service, great drinks and excellent food. Filet mignon was cooked perfectly, you get complementary cheese bread and the real winner, in my book, is the deli style cole slaw.  Not enough could be said about Jamie's service. Guy was on point and very personable. Really enjoyed my time at the bar here

lUd2p2YMhvwAp2JvNuvrjg.text: Most excellent Ribs... Chopped Salad & chopped liver only added to this wonderful dinner .. Recommended by my love and she was truly correct.   A must try for anyone wanting to know what True Chicago style Ribs & Steaks are all about

uxHAJoICTebNh7XJOpPl_Q.text: Amazing food and even better service! We came in and didn't have a reservation. The staff was kind and diligent in trying to get us in the bar area to watch the World Series.  The food was incredible. We're all stuffed and happy! Can't ask for better than that!

sC6VvM9Zn1bjOI_d9X3DHg.text: The best thing about this place was the service.  Very nice waiter but the food was over priced.  We had the artichoke dip appetizer ... it was only OK.  and coconut shrimp and au gratin potatoes which were really good. But not worth the crazy price.

n7RyYuZIaWBPdnVp0HPmOA.text: You don't have to be a sports fan to be blown away by the memorabilia and what's more most of it is signed.  The fascinating thing is this is no sports bar.  I took clients out and wanted to try something different and boy did I score.  Sam took care of us and did an amazing job.  My one client said he wished his beer was colder.  15 minutes later he had an ice cold beer and fresh frosted mug every time.  The prime rib was tender and full of flavour. One of the orders was undercooked.  Fixed no problem.  Very polite and efficient.  The steak was to much for my boss to finish and he's not one to waste a great piece of red meat.  Small table and low ceilings made it very easy to chat and all 6 able to be a part of the conversation. 2 soft talkers in the group so that's a big deal.  Yea there were a couple bumps but they were fixed quickly and politely.  The whole group enjoyed the evening.

h9IaMJxaxHoVLvmeRSyWmw.text: Don and Charlie's is certainly an astounding place to visit to see all of the sports memorabilia. It does have its drawbacks. Every season my family arrives to go to spring training they insist on Don and Charlie's.   Drawbacks include the noise. It is almost deafening. There is 1 chair  to sit when waiting a long time for a table despite reservations. The food is the most salty food ( I had trout almandine and blanched spinach in olive oil and garlic with their signature baked potato ) that I have eaten in world travel. I think this restaurant could do well to cut the salting down by 90% and still surpass the minimum daily requirements. Go and see the memorabilia. Don't go just to eat unless you have no issues with so much salt that it affects negatively on the food's favor. This is the last time I eat at this restaurant. I will just go with my family, have a drink and gawk at the collection.

0jgLf25iwyjTDpBiCB_bTA.text: If you're visiting the Phoenix area from out of town, this is one of the places that should be on your dining list.  Don and Charlie's is a cool chophouse in downtown Scottsdale that has a huge collection of autographed baseballs behind walls of glass. You'll often see Major League Baseball players and personalities dining here during Spring Training in March.   They have great steaks, pasta, and some of the best bbq ribs that you will find.   The food at Don and Charlie's will remind you of the great chop houses in Chicago such as Harry Caray's, The Chicago Chop House, and Gene and Georgetti. This should come as no surprise as one of the founders of Don and Charlie's grew up in Chicago.   The winners at Don and Charlie's are the calamari as an appetizer, the cheesy au gratin potatoes as a side, the bbq ribs as an entree, and the creme brulee as a dessert.   They also have an extensive wine list and a beer from every Arizona Spring Training team's city.  Great food, good atmosphere, and just an all around fun dining experience give Don and Charlie's five stars.

z531RxXixJJhZx0CAoU6jw.text: The service is good; the restaurant is overloaded with baseball memorabilia; the bathroom is small; the parking is just as small; child menu is okay; my drink was watered down; the ribs were okay; the chopped steak was a little better, but for the price, there are plenty of better places.

oXdjJV-wFGRee4lYDcoqKw.text: This was a very interesting place. It's full of sports memorabilia, nearly covering every wall and ceiling. The server was very professional and knowledgable. The prime rib was delicious but too fatty for my liking. Twice baked potato was excellent along with the cheesy toast app. I recommend it if you're a sports fan.

rxqv660KgbM9iyaFppjYbQ.text: Great Chicago type restaurant without over doing it. You feel like you grew up with Don in your neighborhood and played ball down the street at an open field. The food is first rate and the sports memorabilia is unreal. Sam was our waiter and he was extremely attentive and prompt. I haven't been to Carson's Ribs in 20 years and the food took me right back.

99ubN-g2i0D5WaRwd716VQ.text: If you love spring training baseball, this is THE place to go.    It is the fancy chop house in the heart of trendy Scottsdale where baseball fans, media and players alike go to eat.  I've been twice, and saw Bob Uecker in the hizzouse once.  The food was good, not great.  The decor, awesome - all personalized sports memorabilia from players that actually went there.    A must do for any jock-sniffer like me during Cactus League Baseball.

gebzfGwS_GdzItzCsOIOog.text: There are many high-end fancy steakhouses in Scottsdale, all of which serve great food. Then there is Don & Charlie's, a mostly come-as-you are place with GREAT food and amazing service. The sport memorabilia testifies to the owner's love of baseball, etc., and the food  and service testifies to his love of quality and his customers. Go here. You will love it. Try the ribs as well as the steak!!!

msLVN-OLoTBwoDNO7z9qdA.text: Favorite place now that I permanently live here now. Best food ever.  The bake potato are to die for. Creme Bbrulee is a must for desert. I love the sport theme. Not one thing I didn't like. Eating and dinning in bar area is fun people watching lol. Staff is friendly.

ZZFoWOZ7jmh5u-q0jih2HA.text: Absolutely amazing. The food is incredible, service is impeccable. Pricey but so well worth it. The ribs done Dons way we're amazing. The cole slaw was awesome. Especially the deli style. I promise you won't have a bad meal here. It's that good. Plus the memorabilia is so fun to look at. Enjoy this place is outstanding...

o1crXjNVVYNmO9n4WfhSbg.text: I've been going here for many years, they've been taking care of me better than almost any restaurant in the Valley...this 5 star review is long overdue. What a classic spot, definitely old school- thank you for bringing a small piece of Chicago to Phoenix. Probably not for everyone, but this is one those timeless establishments that at least bring me back to a time when things were simpler. I love everything about Don & Charlie's, you guys rock, thank you.  You need to get the ribs if it's your first time, the burger is worth talking about, broasted chicken, steaks, fries, potatoes and cole slaw. I prefer the bar room, more casual, you can catch a game, but if it's your first time or a more special night, then the dining room is cool too. Famous sports memorabilia everywhere.

BVhZYGGklaQoFId40ZeRjA.text: Went here with my brother and his date, and was looking forward to the ribs.  The place was crowded and noisy.  Service was painfully slow, and less than perfunctory.  It took a half-hour and 3 requests to get a straw.  I had the half-rack of ribs, and was underwhelmed, to say the least.  They were tough and dry, and the meat was very skimpy, barely enough to keep the bones together.  My brother also had ribs, we were served a 1-ounce container of sauce for the two of us.  Fries were tasteless and cold when served.  Seeing how long it took to get a straw, I felt complaining was pointless.  This place seems to be living on it's rep.

nKN7T18m9aVOKZACz69RTQ.text: If you like sports and you like steaks... then you have just found heaven.  This is a Scottsdale landmark, and something of a sporting museum unto itself.  The restaurant has a dark, classy, old-school feel. The food is wonderful, one of the better steaks I have ever tasted.  Don is a really nice guy, if you're lucky he might just join your table for a few minutes to make sure you and your guests are happy.

0oVN-Hi74ct39gDHNEMtgw.text: I ate here this week with my husband. It had a great atmosphere, great food and our server Leah did a fantastic job! She was attentive, but not too much, fun, and made our dining experience delightful :) We try a different restaurant at least once a month, and add our favorites to our "go-to" list to dine...and we will definitely come back to Don and Charlie's and ask for Leah's section! Thanks Don and Charlie's :)

ML91pKqWGqk0_wnyvbhTnA.text: A must stop for spring training fans. Always make it a point to come here on our yearly trip.  They're known for their ribs but i havent had anything on the menu i didt like. Love the ambiance with all the sports memorabilia everywhere.

p4lgtfzAER-QR17GATxY7A.text: Don & Charlie's is one of those restaurants that is a nice addition to add to your "favorite list."  We are from out of state, but when visiting we always find an evening for dinner at Don & Charlie's.  The ambience is the best. The restaurant is moderately lit, with lovely dark wood walls, the tables are covered with white tableclothes. Every empty wall space, including the ceiling (well what used to be empty) is covered with a piece of baseball history (there is a smattering of football items too) The lobby provides the best view of some of the prized pieces of memorbillia.  Our service was terrific from start to finish.  The hostess greeted us promptly, and was very cordial.  She showed us to our table and gave us our menus. . We were only seated 30 seconds when we had ice water and a plate of bread. Our waiter came to the table within two minutes dressed in black slacks, a white dress shirt, black bowtie and a bibbed, long, black apron.  He welcomed us, told us about a special, and took our drink order. Just one negative here, the bread was stale and sort of tasteless and the butter was frozen so solid we were unable to use it.  I was envious of the folks seated across from us. It was their first visit and they received the complimentary cheese bread. I wish now that we had said we were first-timers too.....lol  We had the creamy cole slaw to start.  I love cole slaw and this rated in the top 5 in taste, but the very fine grate made it soupy. I would prefer a coarser grate of the cabbage.  We all ordered different entrees. I had the prime rib, cooked to perfection served with the best raw horseradish I've ever tasted.  The entree came with your choice of potato and I opted for the red potato, mashed (very good, but the serving was twice what I could eat). The prime rib was excellent, I'm not sure I've ever tasted better.  The two others in the group ordered nut encrusted halibut and coconut shrimp and they too gave rave reviews.    The waiter checked on us often, our water glass was always full, and we had our check within minutes of passing on dessert.  If they hadn't served the stale bread, this would have been four stars.

gh8k2bzuWssbaoHOr3xbtw.text: I'm a fan of D&C's. Not the best steakhouse I've ever been to, but it's fairly laid back and a good place to catch a game and throw back a rack of ribs.  The ribs are worth the trip!

4l2Yer6RJJrau6ynNVqzsQ.text: An expensively unpleasant dining experience  I have dined from street vendors to top of the line 5 star restaurants. I can be very appreciative but I also expect to get a good return on my monetary output. Six friends and family members and myself were going to the Botanical gardens and decided to make an evening of the occasion by dine out. Not being familiar with the area we used my Open Table account to search for a restaurant to seat 7 at 6:00 pm on Saturday,April 16th in the Garden's vicinity. Availability was limited so I was pleased to find an opening at 5:45 at Don and Charlie's. They had a good rating, good reviews, good menu, ambiance, sounds great right? Wrong. From the onset the experience was unpleasant. The main group of 5 arrived before myself and husband but they were informed the party wouldn't be seated until all guest had arrived. I received a text from my sister telling me there was no available self parking and to use the valet (a surcharge of $5 not including a gratuity). When seated we were lead back into a back room while having to squeeze past the chairs of other guest and maneuver past servers. Our waitress came by twice and belted out in a loud, albeit necessary because of the volume of the surrounding noise, voice that she would be right back to take our drink order. The waitress finally returned and using the same loud voice took our drink order. A good 45 min had elapsed by thus time. When she returned with the drinks she was going to leave without taking our food order, it was only due to our insistence that she took our orders. When delivered the order was incorrect, the quality of the food, in my case, prime rib was tasteless and coated with butter, the presentation-there was none. It was difficult to enjoy the meal while being jostled by other guest, waitresses and bus staff; it was difficult to hear and impossible to have a group conversation, rather than maneuver around the crowd, the staff reached so far over the table it was invasive. I would definitely question whether or not the legal fire department approved seating capacity of the restaurant is being exceeded. Had there been a fire I can guarantee that they would not be able to evacuate in an orderly or expedited manner - Definitely not worth the price tag.  Oh yes, The highly touted sports memorabilia would be difficult to see at best given the crowded conditions and the poor lighting but I guess if you are a sports idiot it could be a positive aspect of this miserable restaurant.

8SDYwzH1xEA1RtB46w74gw.text: I was invited theree last month and it hasnt changed.  Much better places to eat, lousy parking, zero atmosphere, and too many grannies serving.  I far prefer more atmosphere such at BLT, J&G, Bourbon Steak, City Hall, Elements and Ruth Chris.  Much better meat and wine selection and in many cases a far better experience and the service is impeccable and fine Reidel stemware.

JEFC1jJpH4q7aoFCXYBGYQ.text: Visited Don & Charlie for two consecutive Saturdays for dinner, the first visit was 4.5 stars and the second visit was only an average 3-star, rounding up and down? Hmmm  FIrst visit -  Very impressed by this museum-alike restaurant with all collections of baseball, hall of fame, jerseys, baseball bats, or you name it, all about sports! The manager or a guy in nice shirt got us a free cheese bread on the bar while we were waiting for our table as it was our first time, the cheese bread tasted almost like the Chicago-styled deep dish cheese pizza. Our order of medium rare prime rib and the BBQ pork ribs arrived pretty quickly after order is placed and the food was delicious.  Second visit - We come back with a group of 6 the next Saturday, reservation was made for 7pm and just about 10 mins wait and we were seated. Waitress was an older lady who took care of us very well when took our ordering, however, one of the broccoli sides (and it happened to be mine) came out way over-cooked, you can so easily by the almost yellow-ish color when there was a comparison to a well-cooked one, and the taste was just...(don't even want to describe). When asked for a replacement, I was told that it has to be re-ordered, not sure what that means, but sure, i'll wait for another one...5 mins later, 10 mins later and.... until we finished our dinner, the broccoli still did not show up... the waitress had a few other tables and seems very busy, she came only once to check and left right after, I didn't even get a chance to 'chase' my broccoli...I guess it was good that 'extra order of broccoli' did not show up on the bill... And it took way to long for her to understand how to split the bill even when we wrote it down by credit card and amount... So be sure to tell your waiter or waitress to split your bill before it arrives!  p.s. This is a popular restaurant, parking seems to be filled very quickly, you might need to park along the street side or the bank's parking lot across the street...

frR5wYH_H8fwnjpvSGCiKA.text: We had dinner there this past Sunday. The food is OK. One order was a steak filet. It was very dry. The other order was the ribs. We have had better. Not great food, just OK. Portions are large. Wine list is limited but adequate with acceptable prices. Service was excellent. Wait person was Kelsie. The baseball & overall sports collection is outstanding. It was about 2/3 full with several empty tables. If we go back it will not be for the food it will be to see the collection.

J7b0njBu1pqXHlEUyFGe9Q.text: My wife and I celebrated Valentine's on Thursday 2/13, always avoid 2/14, all restaurants way too crowded.  Anyhow, Don and Charlie's was crowded but fortunately, I had made reservations.  They hit the mark right on, we were seated right on time.  Because this was our first visit, Pam, our exceptional waitress, comped us the parmesan bread and it is delicious...next time we visit, I will gladly pay for the scrumptious bread.  The menu is vairied, lots of beef and ribs, seafood and more.  I won't go into what we ate because I humbly believe that whatever you order will be delicious and plentiful.  The atmosphere is a little noisy but that's OK, the vibe makes for the dining experience.  You could go crazy looking at all the sports memorabelia, if you are sports fan, any sport, you will find something to ooh and ahh over.  I have to repeat, Pam our waitress was terrific.  They were unusually busy that night because of a large take-out order that came as a surprise to the restaurant and the wait for our main dish was a little long.  Pam made sure we were informed that all was in order and to be candid, it was nice having a little time between our salads and the main dish.  I understand that a diner or two could have a less than perfect visit to any restaurant but I don't understand how anyone could rate Don and Charlie's anything less than 5 stars.  I can't wait to go back.  Thanks to Pam, you helped make my Valentine's weekend.

xThKHEKqi0m_7qrG00J29w.text: I went back here last night with my mom as last time we went my mom asked for half of her burger in a doggie bag and when she got home it wasn't in the bag, so my mom called and talked with Chris who is the manager (?), and he was so sweet and told her to come back and he'd give her another burger on the house. So we went, we got the coconut shrimp, which aren't like I remember them from when I was a kid, but I liked them and I normally don't like shrimp at all. I ordered a double baked (droool.... this is the best item at this restaurant.... all bacon -y and delicious and a house salad which was just ok, but what do you expect, it's a house salad. We also got a slice of chocolate cake that comes with fudge.... the fudge... mmmmmmmm sooooo good! That was definitely a good choice. Chris really went the extra mile to give us really good customer service and we really appreciate that. I guess that is what makes this restaurant stand out.

NjWoH-F0zbY9Yd9kUFCBkw.text: Really good barbeque and steaks in an old school setting decorated with baseball memorabilia. The service was tight also which is always a big plus. The food is definitely artery clogging, so i'd reccomend it only once-in-awhile.   They have some great price points in here modest wine list. Oaky cabernet sauvignon for beef and go for a zinfandel for the barbeque. For the prices, you can't go wrong!

q9sliphLfo_FNySfDXyEXg.text: My husband had been to Don & Charlie's 8 years ago and it was a "must go" for this Spring Training trip. We arrived at opening and there were at least 50 people waiting on a warm St. Patrick's Day, which looked like a good sign. In retrospect, we needed the Luck 'O The Irish to turn this "so so" meal into an exceptional dining experience.  The food was good -- coconut prawns, french onion soup, prime rib -- and the service was warm, pleasant and fast. Actually, too fast. We felt rushed to get through each course so they could clear the table for the hoards of people waiting to get in.  It wasn't anything to write home about, but worth another shot.

lj_1AH2A9EjIYC3av-HvoA.text: I've been to Don and Charlies a number of times starting when I was very young up to a few days ago while in town visiting. Excellent Establishment, very consistent and the ribs are ALWAYS the best in town.   The place is always packed and the memorabilia on the walls gets better each year!   They are very generous and start you with some amazing warm rye bread with chopped liver. Every meal comes with soup, cole slaw then let you choose a potato to go along with your main course. The rib/chicken combo was out of this world and although a tad pricey is a home run! The place has a great vibe and was filled with sports goodies that anyone would love.

crwaoNl8AFVb6Kmo-NKNUA.text: Came here on Christmas eve because of all the hype. The price is an upsale restaurant, but the food is mediocre and the atmosphere is like a musty old sports bar. I didnt think anything was great about the place. Reminded me of a cafeteria. There are far better restaurants in the valley for the price.

t96auEsbWHJohiO9pK0LsQ.text: Wow. Simply delicious. My family came here because we were hoping to catch a glimpse of a baseball player, and also because we heard the memorabilia in here was second to none. For one, they're not kidding when they say if you're a fan of sports you'll love this place. There is signed stuff on every square inch of the walls, even the posts that hold the place together. As for the food, it was scrumdidiliumptious. I ordered the New York Parmesan Steak, my sister tried the Skirt Steak, and my dad ordered the BBQ Chicken & Ribs. We were all in love, and we all amazingly finished our portions. We all ordered the mashed potatoes on the side, and they were so creamy and homemade, they were awesome. I wish I had them now... For dessert, I got the "half" Hot Fudge Sundae, and it was big. I didn't finish it. My dad ordered the Banana Creme Pie and said it was some of the best he's ever had. So for the food, I loved it! Can't wait to go back. Prices weren't outrageous, just you're average nice dinner price. The server was very friendly and accommodated to everything we needed. Wish I could stay in that place for hours just to look at all of the signed memorabilia. I mean, Babe Ruth, Hank Aaron, Willie Mays? Come on!

eNLc8aEGRJ-_CPJ3gU1lJA.text: Went for Ribs - they were good (not great).  You can tell it is a successful place and because of that importance I got the feeling they were doing me a favor.  I will not rush back but will go back at some point.

NgIKlKpK5u_-nbIJ8_7JTg.text: The steak was really good, our waitress was awesome, despite the huge crowd waiting for a table I didn't feel overly rushed.  You could spend hours looking at the memorabilia that covers every available surface.  If this place could talk I bet it would have some awesome stories.  I'll certainly make it a point to come here again next time I'm in town.

mLe3LhYq1PsYinL6O1g0Rw.text: I have been coming to Don and Charlies for six or so years now and have never had a bad experience. I like it here a lot. The ambiance is just different at D&C, it's upscale but it doesn't take itself too seriously. You could easily spend hundreds on some of the best steaks and ribs you've ever had, but you'll never feel out of place or judged. The sports memorabilia all over the walls is cool even for a guy like me who doesn't care much, it's still rad to look around and think of all the history.     The food at D&C is plain killer. You can't go wrong starting with the simple but tasty onion strings or the baked artichoke dip, while neither is a creative masterpiece, they are done right. I'm also a sucker for a wedge salad and they have a good one with house made creamy garlic dressing. Now, I can totally recommend the coconut fried shrimp, they are tender and bursting with flavor, and the marmalade sauce adds a wonderful tang to it, but you come to D&C for the steak and ribs. I have tried most of the ribs and can only say get them. All of them. Just order one of everything, you will eat every bite of the tangy, juicy and tender but not too tender meat. If you aren't a big rib fan, then you only have one other choice, my favorite thing on the menu, the regular cut prime rib... it is perfect. Freaking perfect. Put it on your bucket list and add a twice baked potato. Period.    Don and Charlies is a red blooded American restaurant, meat, booze and sports are everywhere, and it's a blast. Throw in the amazing food and nothing but the classiest service and I dare you not to have a fantastic evening.

of-FKrxrIpAjDt_BcgpVYw.text: I go to Giants Spring Training every year in Scottsdale, AZ and this year we decided to try Don & Charlie's.  I give it 4 stars because the decor is off the hook!  It's the best collection of sports memorabilia in a restaurant that I have seen, and it's all been personally signed/retrieved by the owner (except for one item, I think it was the Bonds baseball).  I would have given it 5 stars, but when I ordered my Petite steak, they came back 15 mins later to tell me they ran out and that i could order a very rare steak as an option (which i dont like) or I can have them butterfly a Filet Mignon.  I chose the latter and I wasn't impressed.  However everything else was excellent, especially the twice baked potatos.  They gave me a free dessert for screwing my steak up.  But , yeah.  Go for the decor, make a reservation, and enjoy yourself.

D-NBogf0vVFt-_Tv2FeIDQ.text: We were there for spring training, and all the Oakland A's Boosters told us to go to Don & Charlie's if we wanted to see ballplayers slurp their soup.  So we did.  Thank goodness we made reservations, and also that we made them early (5:30 pm).  It was right after a game, and already packed.  We cooled our heels in the awesome bar.  Nobody was in there yet.  The bartender, very friendly, told us to just wait an hour and the bar itself will be packed, too (but we hoped we'd be eating by then).  But the bar has all the baseball memorabilia....wow.  We were finally seated at a corner table, and struck up a conversation first with a local sitting next to us, charmingly complaining about all the tourists running him out of *his restaurant.  And then we started talking to Scott Eyre, seated on the other side of us, a pitcher at that time for the San Francisco Giants.  He had brought his nephew and his friends to dinner.  He was very gracious and we had a marvelous time watching him down a humongous sundae ("aw, I'll just run a few more laps tomorrow").  And the food was good, too.  5 stars for the ambiance, the baseball references, the players in sight, decent service and awesome food.

na6nTA5O04MYP4_-n2aZ3Q.text: Great bbq ribs and prime rib. Attentive service. Terrific baseball memorabilia everywhere you look.

LgaPsosgAnyNst8X--xnIA.text: Went here for the first time for xmas dinner.  Atmosphere was very chill.  Almost felt mafiosa style at times. It is a mellow setting and very relaxing with unique music.  They also have TONS of sports related everything to keep you're eyes busy while you're enjoying your meal.    Our server was awesome, we got our food very fast and everything was excellent.  I recommend getting the 12oz filet.  It was right up there with other top shelf steak houses in the area and reasonably priced.  We will definitely be going back to Don and Charlies.

1IkAfWuQ7Wrq0EYjThVkxQ.text: I'm from Chicago and a friend recommended this place. In a word WOW.   We made reservations so had no problem being seated. Christine our waitress was incredibly attentive, and knowledgeable and suggested items due to my food allergies.   I loved all the memorabilia, felt like I was back home the minute I walked through the door.   Both my friend and I had steaks. We agreed it was probably the best steak we've had in a long time. Cooked to perfection everything from beginning to end was delicious. Portions are large and I could not finish my meal.   I will definitely be back next time I'm in Scottsdale.

u7jxOfnc0RUSdvtnNgV57Q.text: My favorite restaurant in the country. I have been coming here for over 15 years and my wife and I recently had our rehearsal dinner here. The food was great as always and the service was immaculate. The manager and wait staff went out of their way to make sure     everything went great. I highly recommend this place to anyone. I am from Kansas City and I think Don and Charlie's has THE BEST RIBS ON THE PLANET.

bvrJJZb9AcBsnxATQ7eyJg.text: After eating the night before at the Pink Pony and having a below average meal there, Don and Charlie's was quite nice. First of all, the sports memorabilia is INCREDIBLE!!!  So many things covering the walls, ceiling, beams, etc.  And not just baseball-every sport is represented which is really cool. The restaurant gets full especially during spring break time so we were lucky to score a dinner reservation just 1 day in advance for 8:15pm. Tables are definitely crammed in which is one of the only negatives. It does get quite loud in there as well with so many people. But the food was very good (I had the Parmesan crusted New York strip which was delicious!!) and the service was very attentive.

jU3IKlrmDsudFuqaKPJzUw.text: I haven't been here in sooo long so we decided to give it a whirl since we were in the mood for steak. We arrived about 630 on a Sat night and were seated immediately in the bar, which was totally fine. We got a nice booth and our hostess (Molly) gave us a little history on the booth we were seated in. The reason we know her name was the hostess at the desk in front called her over an intercom about 15 times during our dinner "Molly...can you please come to the front"!. That was annoying while we were trying to dine and talk during our dinner. It was kind of cheesy considering the prices of their steaks. We actually thought the prices were too high for steak. The atmosphere didn't lend to the amount that was being charged. 40 dollar filet with no sides. No salad. No veggie. No.....! We decided on burgers, a ceaser salad and Mac n cheese. All were pretty darn good. I had the hickory burger with bbq, cheese and bacon. That's literally the best bacon I've ever had. My friend had the green chile burger and loved the heat of the chiles and pepperjack. Mac n cheese was delicious and creamy. The burgers come with coleslaw (deli or creamy), and we both had deli and it was very pungent and vinegary. We topped it all of with banana cream pie which was fresh and had lots of whipped cream on top. Definitely big enough to share. Our service was spot on and Keasha was efficient and friendly.  Oh yeah, you get a bread and butter plate that's pretty forgettable. They should save their money and not even serve it. We had a great overall experience and I would go back just for that bacon.

cOgfuewQD8zwJ-bGaALPdg.text: I really love this place, and have eaten here twice lately. It's a great atmosphere and is almost always busy. You need a reservation to eat here during spring training, for sure, but the rest of the year it's pretty easy to get a table.  I always get the same thing when I come here; cuda cut prime rib cooked medium rare and it's always fantastic. The crust on top is fabulous and its juicy and tender. My sister had the triple crusted filet's on the waitresses recommendation and she said they were cooked perfect. I upgraded to the twice baked potato and the top was crunchy with a soft inside and good flavor. The service has been spot on during my visits, attentive and quick, but not rushed by any means, plus the extra side waiters make sure to keep the water filled and the plates cleared when needed.  We decided on their delicious banana pie for dessert, but had them wrap it up since we were full from our dinner and they graciously did. The piece of pie we got was so big we split it and still had more than enough for each of us! I wouldn't say Don & Charlies is casual, but it's definitely not as buttoned up as City Hall, another favorite. If you're in the mood for a good steak and service in a fun atmosphere Don & Charlies delivers.

9vgjkQ3-QcntyEyRPQvOYQ.text: WOW what can I say... our friends have eaten here for years and we finally got to eat at Don and Charlie's for the first time in all the years that we have been coming to Spring Training.    We had an excellent dinner i was in the mood for fish and had the Macademia crusted Halibut.... WONDERFUL!!!!! My hubby had the prime rib and finished off every last juicy bite... the scalloped potatoes were the BEST I have ever had at any restaurant.  Must make this one of our usual stops during our yearly visit to Az.

0cybglqAZFY5MEXwOS6GUA.text: This place was amazing. My brother and his wife took us here for a delicious steak dinner and to show is all the baseball memorabilia they have everywhere. It is really too bad that it will be closing on April 10 and all of the memorabilia will be going into storage along with a historic establishment disappearing.

1FeGtYhVxD7BJkWq1GeNKw.text: We went to Don and Charlie's for probably the last time yesterday. This very special restaurant is closing very soon. With it's rich history and all the sporting memorabilia, calling it a restaurant doesn't do it justice. My wife had the pecan crusted trout  that she loves. There are not many places that serve trout and certainly none as good as this. I thought I would have something different and decided on the flank steak with "burnt" carmelized onions.  It was fantastic. I also had the chopped liver appetizer and we really enjoyed the creme brulee for desert with its layer off hard chocolate on the bottom. As always everything was fantastic and our server Margaret was exceptional. Thank you Don and Charlie's for all the fabulous meals and strolls down memory lane with that amazing collection of autographed baseballs. Good luck and we will All will miss you.

rT-y1dEFKW3qoONeUlEpdQ.text: I've been meaning to go back ever since the Elite event a few years back. Finally did. The food was still good but not great like it had been. A party of 4 and I think one thing had to be remade and a couple of meats were close enough to keep but not spot on. A few things got forgotten entirely. They did not have enough servers for the packed house on a Thursday night, service was really slow. I know it is part of the atmosphere, but I would prefer a little more light.

rRC1c-CTdZgJnIZ97DytVg.text: I'll give two stars because and only because our server and staff were really good. The food.... very mediocre and bland. Wife's steak was hard and chewy, my mac n chz wasn't very cheesy, banana creme pie was average, the bread was gross. I will say, though, my filet duo was OK but not anywhere worth the money.  We don't understand, for the price, why everyone gives it such a great rating.  We compared this place to that of an Outback Steakhouse. Hate to be harsh but it's True. We will not return on account of the food.

ew4GQ_OSwBQTj9ndNq_Ybg.text: More than just a dinner, it's a journey to hallowed sports ground...the amount of sports memorabilia is mind boggling!  A Mecca for sports fans!  After eating here a few times, I've settled on the original Chicago style Ribs and the Wedge Salad.  The Ribs are excellent!  The service is excellent and Don is a gracious host...oh and the cocktails are great and bartenders are happy to generously pour your favorite drink.  It will be a sad day when it closes in April.

yclBagkmxRDrhPG66lDt4g.text: If your in town and love sports and good food, dont even think twice make it a stop with your stay really cool place!

H6lXTb6K66qp4PKy6eRu8g.text: Excellent, iconic old-school American bistro. The ribs, burgers and salmon with teriyaki glaze are outstanding.  I cannot believe the place will close in May 2019. Visit while you still can. I sure hope it is revived in another location!!

I18QzxXUl5E160pGFD3fNA.text: Too bad, Mr Don Carson and his restaurant has lost it.  Last night, 6:30 reservation, seated after 7, one in party in wheel chair.  Don trolling restaurant, he knows/knew my guest in wheel chair.  I have photo of us from earlier visit.  Asked him to stop by on his tour around dining room, he finally did, we shook hands, then he was more than condescending, and said to me I talked with his partner of many years, had no idea what he was talking, said he had no interest in talking to us.  Rudeness and /it dementia, dunno which or both.  Will never return here, I do not need to be minimized by an owner to whom we paid north of $100.  Shame on Don Carson to treat a long time customer as he did!

F8gQqBBAaTpOD60EsyNBBA.text: Food is good, but overpriced.  The ambiance is great if you like Sports all autographed from everyone.  The key lime pie was awful,the crust not cooked, the filling was not real it was a pudding texture & awful

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TOK6kPmMa8hJZaFIYyLQhg.text: I recently visited D&C's and during the meal I thought the food was good, but certainly not worth the price. I am Only posting this because during the dinner portion a pea sized piece of glass had chipped off of the bowl and been absorbed into the chocolate sauce. Unfortunately I only realized this after chewing, cutting and bleeding out of my mouth. The manager to his credit did come over and apologize and took my information down, but nothing more came out of it. Overall the experience was certainly not worth my time or money.

aqSzpuicDSiBB3JoNO05hw.text: I've been a patron here since 1999. Great steaks, great service, great drinks. I'll be heartbroken if this place ever closes. So many great memories here. There is no chance there is another place like this nor will there ever be a place that can duplicate what this place has become. If I could invest in D&Cs, I would. Long live one of the food & beverage industry greats!

seO5pBGn9IUNnvy_3i3kQw.text: Great food and reminds me of being back in Chicago! Definitely will go again. Cole slaw, prime rib and steak very good!

cqSL3lwCg7ppc1ZGorHIPg.text: 'm pleasantly surprised! Had a run of sub-par restaurants lately!  But NOT here!  First class service and good recommendations. The most tender I !     But the star of the night was clearly the ribeye steak! Cooked medium with a crazy awesome "char" on it! We also ordered baby back ribs... while they were good they weren't even in the.same galaxy as the ribeye! Tender, aromatic and visually appealing! Absolutely NO need for steak sauce! The flavor on your palette was just crazy good!  Man this place was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aQ5imaQTr0PbLbXufM6igQ.text: Old landmark with old sport memorabilia's, service was excellent , food was okay but fun place to get together .

zPEkH_rnLYsI1DuFE77OEQ.text: Aimee Jordan Hector and the 'crew' make dining at the bar enjoyable.   As Aimee will attest, I am only a MEDIUM build with a RARE appetite for the Carson cut prime rib and filets. (so there is no confusion) .   Always the place to go for a sports fan, a Chicago fan and great food fan.  Thanks for all the good times.

jqWuhZ-Kr8vnwvx2h1QJjA.text: The atmosphere at Don & Charlie's is unique in a good way! Top notch food in not your traditional mastros, steak 44 vibe. Went here for a work meeting and the rack of ribs were a huge hit. Will definitely go back for those delicious ribs!

ezVPX6w4u1pZFGcWn5IpTQ.text: The iconic Don & Charlie's is closing soon, and rightfully so, as the service has gone in the tank.  We have loved this restaurant over the years and have eaten there once or twice a month regularly.  Last night's experience left us agape!  We had a party of six with reservations a few weeks in advance with a request of a round table in the back of the dining room if possible (it tends to be quieter there).  When I checked in, the hostess asked if our entire party was there yet, & I replied no, so she said to tell her when we were all there, which we did.  Soon after, they said our table was ready, so we were escorted to a table in the back like we requested.  There was also a vacant 6 person table beside us.  Looking at the wine list to order both red & white wines, I commented to my friend that it was a very good price for the white wine we both love, and ordered it.  (My husband ordered the red).  We were munching on the bagel crisps, waiting for the wine to arrive, when a gentleman came to our table & asked us our name.  He said we were seated at the wrong table if our name wasn't so & so and we would have to move and had no choice.  We were all perplexed, as THEY had seated us there & knew our name?!    Soooo, we all got up (we aren't young) & waited in the front at another 6 place table while they set it up.  Our "new" waitress, Taylor, was delightful so we tried to let it go & have a good time.  When our bill came, our white wine that was a good price we thought, was $10.00 higher, which they did adjust after bringing it to their attention.  Being a business owner, I am so disappointed with the way the seating situation was handled.  We certainly were inconvenienced by their error and they made us feel like it was our fault as we traisped back to the front to be reseated.  No apology was given.  We cancelled our reservations we had made for next week.  I guess it is time for this iconic restaurant to close.    There for the LAST TIME!!  SF

-TAlHVoi45jDoU02MER2CQ.text: Love this restaurant especially being from Chicago. Anna our server was fantastic ... I asked about a wine and she looked it up online! She was so pleasant, attentive and had great suggestions. Don's ribs were amazing ... exactly the way I love them and no one cooks them that way anymore. Half slab perfect for me. Steak fries were hot and fresh. Hubby had French onion soup and gave it an 8 out of 10 ... the French restaurant in Kierland got a 6 out of 10!  The only slight negatives ... got loud when crowded, husband's chair was in the isle and people kept bumping in to him, and creamy coleslaw wasn't my favorite. I'd try other one next time. Overall, we had great time and would highly recommend.

v5UKoYpH7POvxS88V-ghdQ.text: Fantastic dinner, great service. Our server, Jeff was outstanding!  We had a party of 11 guests.  He was extremely attentive to our table.  The atmosphere  is casual and friendly.  It's very loud inside, it's also dark and crowded.  These are NOT complaints, just observations.

147tOjl3fFRoFvbittH9IA.text: My family came to Arizona shortly after I attended college at ASU in 1979, we started eating at Don & Charlie's shortly after it opened.  We have never had a disappointing experience.  The ribs are awesome, the steaks are very high quality. The chicken liver is fabulous. Friday we dined and had the steak sandwich and fried shrimp.  The steak sandwich came with cheesy bread, and we couldn't finish it, probably a 16 ounce steak. The shrimp were large and delicious. The place has great food, great atmosphere and Don is always there with a smile and a kind greeting.  Highly recommend Don & Charlie's.

DtXhESzU-xgLxvK9-3sOjQ.text: The staff was very friendly - and the waitress we had you could tell have worked there forever, probably since they opened. The restaurant has potential and could be cute since they have a ton of sports memorabilia, but it just felt old - and not in a good way, like old, dirty and run-down. Cheap fried food, dry ribs that do NOT fall off bone, and the filet was overcooked and dry as well. Would definitely not recommend.

LpTBvLJiYQv8JLQkutmCEA.text: I was planning my boyfriend's birthday dinner with his family and reviewed all the "best" steak places in the area! Don & Charlie's definitely stood out because of the reviews on the food. My boyfriend is very particular with his food, it had to be great! I made a reservation for a party of 6-8 for this place on opentable.com and the whole process was great! I asked if they accommodate for a birthday (i.e.: I had a cake and would like to have it served at the end of our dinner) and they were so great about it! I called to confirm some last questions I had about serving fee (which there isn't) and wait times and the hostess was very helpful! She confirmed my reservation on opentable.com and we were set! The food all tasted amazing! Everyone at the table loved their entree. Our server Sam was so great to us! He even recommended my boyfriend order the filet mignon with the char-crust seasoning and he LOVED it! Others at our table ordered the chicken, salmon, and I got the primavera pasta. Everything tasted absolutely delicious and it was the perfect location to bring someone with their family for their birthday. Thanks Don & Charlie's for having such a great staff and amazing food!

itb2LYuiygTisd1FX_XKKA.text: Good food. Staff was very nice, has a lot of photos n the entry of sport celebrities. The waiting area is extremely small for a very busy restaurant. I am a bread person, did not like the bagel crackers they served. had to send steak back not done. Great service. Place is really nice. Make sure you have reservations. Very casual dress code. Very mature cliental, not a place for young adults. Over all not bad, I would go back for a second try.

nu6iyl4KuETaYYDTDueRdQ.text: This low rating is mostly for the extremely unpleasant experience with the owner, not so much for the food or service by the staff. I would have given a minus 5 for the owner, if that was a choice, and a 4 or 5 for the food and service. No customer who's spent close to $300 should have been treated the way we were treated by this rude person.  We were in Arizona for Spring Training and heard about this great restaurant with amazing collection of sports memorabilia, so we made a reservation and went to this place after all day of meeting players and going to a baseball game. Everything was awesome and our 2 families with 4 adults and 4 children were having a good time. All of the staff were courteous and good at what they were doing.   Midway through our meal, we noticed that there were some Colorado Rockies coaches and players eating right next to our table. We didn't want to bother them, so we were just eating and chatting. We saw a couple kids going over to them and asked for autographs. Again, we didn't want to be rude and interrupt their pleasant meal, so we were just minding our own business.
