I'm a longtime, card-carrying (although "there's an app for that") Lettuce Entertain You Frequent Diner Member, so any chance to add points to my ever-growing balance, I'm all for it. The fact that I already love Don & Charlie's makes it even better.  The food is great; it's classic American, but very well executed. The service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is lively and nostalgic. If you're a sports fan, it has tons of sports memorabilia. Like every inch of this place is covered with it.  It has that perfectly relaxed old-school vibe. For Chicagoans (and there's certainly no shortage of those in PHX/Scottsdale), this is a little slice of home.

ql4GbaNCFTjBsOzRvHafRA.text: Our first visit last year was very good.  We enjoyed it immensely, to the point of recommending Don & Charlie's to all our friends and family who visit Scottsdale for Spring Training or otherwise.  Sadly, our most recent experience was downright tragic.  The following is not meant to dissuade anyone from visiting this restaurant.  It is only being provided to recount a bad experience that was not worthy of them.  If you prefer not to read on, know that we were finally taken care of by the manager (read on for more on this) who agreed that this was a True "redo" on their part.  On our way to the restaurant, we called them as we were going to be 5-10 minutes late for our reservation and didn't want them to think we were skipping out on our plans.  When we called, we were told that they didn't have the reservation we had made three weeks prior.  Luckily, though, we managed to get a table around 6:45.  Off to the bar!    At 7:00, our party was called and we headed to the hostess.  We were seated and perused the menu as we finished our drinks from the bar.  Our server stopped by to say, "Be right back."  Our bread and toasted bagel slices came, we read the menu, our server stopped again to say, "Be right back." A third time, he stopped to say he would be right back. Twenty minutes later, he came back; no name, no apology for the wait; just, "can I get a drink order?"  I replied, "sure, but this has got to get better.  Please help us have a better experience ..." I recounted our wait (not his fault, of course, but he did not communicate with us honestly or with any sense of care).  He barked back, "It's very busy tonight, sir. We are backed up as you can see ... what do you want me to do?!" At that point, I wanted him to get the manager.  A very pleasant young man appeared right away, saying he was the manager, visiting from another establishment.  He reiterated that they were busy tonight, which we all knew.  I asked him, "why not tell us that up front instead of making us wait to get a table AND then making us wait for a server?" He apologized again just saying how busy it was and asked if he could take our order.  The wine and food came out quickly and was cooked as we had requested.  We all ordered steaks, salads, and sides which were solid.  No problem at all with the food.  Dessert was offered and we asked for chocolate cake.  The manager brought out the cake and a Key Lime Pie.  He graciously offered the desserts on the house to make up for the earlier wait. Nicely done, we thought.  The bill came.  We slid two credit cards into the bill portfolio and waited.  Without a word, the server picked up the portfolio and came back in record time.  Unfortunately, only one card came back with him with the entire meal charged on it.  We asked him where the other card went.  He said that he only saw one and walked away.  We pulled out our cell phones and started looking for the card on the floor; no luck.  The hostess noticed us looking around and helped us look; again, no luck.  He had obviously flung the card out of the portfolio and onto the floor.  We asked for the manager, again.  We told him about the missing credit card.  He reaches into his back pocket and asks, "Is this it?"  Thankfully, it was.  He'd found it on the floor and was taking it to the hostess.    We all thought, "let's just back out the charge on the other card and re-run the bill 50/50." Not so fast, though.  The server came out, insisting, "that's just not how it works!" The thing is, we all have significant experience in the restaurant business.  We know how it works. He just didn't want to be bothered - before, now or again with us - We just wanted the credit slip on the original charge and we would be on our way.  The server persisted, "I can't do that ..." Perhaps that was True. He either didn't know how or did not want to.  He became flustered and defensive, which was understandable considering his performance with our party that night.  As we were arguing with him, and just as he stormed off, the REAL manager came over to ask just what was going on at our table.  By this time, other guests were trying not to get too involved, but would later tell us they noticed what a hassle we went through ...  The (real) manager heard enough.  He rolled his eyes and agreed that something was just not right. He canceled/credited the entire bill and then charged us (basically) for the wine.  We'll take it.  Again, we knew this was a busy place.  We expected to wait.  But, how this experience went down and how we were treated by that server leaves us with a terrible taste that cannot be improved by the food.   For us, at least, please don't apologize for being busy.  If it's going to take extra time, tell us.  We will empathize if you're honest with us and we will surely complain if you're not.

x3-mwFLljd9j_6pk6jHf8A.text: I'm a member of the Lettuce Entertain you restaurant chain's rewards program and frequent their restaurants throughout the country.  The quality of the food and ambiance at Don & Charlie's didn't measure up to their other locations.   The service was friendly and terrific. We liked the sports memorabilia on the walls. What we weren't impressed with was the food. The New York Strip steak was just OK, while the coconut shrimp was average. I enjoyed a glass of the house Pinot Noir and the banana cream pie was fresh, delicious and truly made at the restaurant daily. The twice baked potato is also worth the upgrade. In addition to the mediocre food, the place is long in the tooth, tight, has low ceilings and needs to be refreshed.

Pk1ok_SCJ56i1tnht8benA.text: I am so sad to hear this place has sold.  I come here every year for spring training.  It was recommended to me from one of the Giants scouts.   I ordered the steak a la selig and it was perfect.  We sat alongside the Oakland athletics non-roster invitees and met the Don himself.  Our bartender was beyond amazing and made by far the most impressionable margarita ever!

h2xJA6fhS3sZrgZeUNTEEw.text: Despite the mixed reviews they have, my brother chose this place to celebrate his birthday.  Thanks for the good choice Bro! We started with some pretty tasty cocktails and the chicken liver app. Our outstanding waitress kept everything filled up, including bread basket. Overall, food pretty good. I had a $28 "steak sandwich". Really a NY strip with a piece of cheese bread. Came with great creamy cole slaw and a pile of French fries. I asked for med.rare, received it charred and medium plus. It was still good though. Desserts were okay, nothing to make a special trip for.  Best part was the friendly service by all, and comfortable pace and atmosphere of the meal.

IHpVPyjYuFGCon4COu3Rzg.text: Their service was what you would expect from a nice steakhouse.   I had the Rib eye, ordered it medium, it was on the thin side so it was a bit over cooked.  I had their rub on it.. mainly pepper and salt, really good!  The others in my party had Filet Mignon they said it was great!  I ordered the deli slaw, my wife had the creamy slaw, hands down, deli has it!  They roll the baked potatoes in kosher salt.  The best you can imagine.  So you ask why 4 and not 5 stars?  It is sooooo loud, I thought I was at the church I last went too!  Loud Music.  Seriously, it was near impossible to have a conversation in the dining room

1R2xodf3atp-AFymn49ZIQ.text: To start off this was probably the best steak i have ever had. it was so perfectly cooked and the crust on... i wish it was a side! I ordered the 14 oz NY with veggies and it was all perfect.  The service was service you would find at a 5 star restaurant. Our waitress was so great and they constantly kept refilling my water which was huge for me because i was traveling with only flying in and out of AZ.   The decor here was so coool! it was sports bar meets steak house with all the best vibes. nxt time i am in AZ this is going to be my #1 spot!

v0UihBIm-ca9jXWKjkjvnQ.text: First time here nice atmosphere and fun memorabilia the most I have ever seen had the Filet mignon and my daughter had an different cut we both asked for them medium well both came very well done but still goodI heard that they are closing next year glad I got to try it!

b0NPv8Eo5raiSXcWTW53OA.text: We've been coming to Don & Charlie's for the better of 20 years and while some people had said the restaurant had seen it's better days, we had to go back for the nostalgia factor. And that's the only reason I would recommend going back...  The food was every bit of eh. The cole slaw as the starter was like watching cabbage do the backstroke in mayo. The chicken schnitzel was like eating a piece of dry, cold chicken covered in matzoh. (Pro tip: if you're going to order the chicken schnitzel order it with extra sauce!) And we didn't even make it to dessert because it took so long to get dinner, one of our younger family members had reached her bedtime. And rightfully so.   It's a shame to see such a cool place have such a fall from grace but we won't be returning back on our next trip! If it's even still there...

nwesQPGTm32X0cxy8Hn8nA.text: I am sad to hear they are closing permanently. I have been going there for decades. The food and ambiance is great. I can only guess that the children sold off the property to a condo company. It is sad to see them leave us with just a bunch of restaurants without history.

1OSPNAC3H_qBvtrSs5sCYQ.text: Don and Charlie's is a really cool landmark of Scottsdale for baseball fans. There aren't many places in the world you can see autographed Babe Ruth, Ted Williams, and Mickey Mantle baseballs all next to each other. The entrance is lined with signed baseballs and memorabilia covers the walls and ceilings of the entire restaurant. During spring training you MUST make reservations to get in.   Overall the food is mediocre for the price. It is pretty expensive. My wife ordered a medium rare steak that was cooked to medium. She mentioned it and was quickly given a new one cooked correctly, and they even comped her order. That was some great service! We also had some Moscow mules, but they were very weak - id stay away from cocktails here. The employees are very friendly and we had a great waitress serving us and making the right amount of conversation. The largest group the restaurant will take is 8 and they won't seat you until everyone is present.   If you can, you should come here and see the amazing baseball history before it closes. Our waitress said it would close in May 2019.

IpNKgagoBVVr7ES3hVGv6w.text: There was a time when this place was our Go-To destination for steaks in Downtown Scottsdale.  A lot has changed this since. There are so many other options now; but Don & Charlie's still holds a place in our heart for being a good standard of delicious BBQ meats in the area.  We were celebrating another amazing Year-End and were looking forward to what 2017 had in store for our business; and we opted to dine here after being absent all these years.  For a weeknight, this place was still humming, and parking could've been dreadful; if it weren't for the availability of valet parking - which we always take advantage of when offered.  We were famished and didn't really waste any time ordering. Bring on the meat - as we emphatically stated!  For starters, we had the Tomato Bisque soup. This soup had an amazing consistency about it. It wasn't too tart, but not too watered down either. It could not have been any more perfect than this.  For the main course, we had the BBQ Chicken, the BBQ Beef Bone, and the Parmesan Crusted Sirloin. All fine examples of the large portions that you receive in this establishment.  And that is where I think we trail off in terms of opinions as far as the food here is concerned. Don & Charlie's always prided itself in the immensity of their portions. Their advertisements, and even word of mouth, regarding their portion sizes comes to mind.  The flavor of the food just doesn't quite distinguish themselves as much as they used to. The Chicken was light and moist, but the flavor was on the bland side. The Beef Bone was saturated in BBQ Sauce, but tasted overdone and the flavors were only skin deep.  The Sirloin was just okay, and the onion rings were soggy.  Don't get me wrong, it was still a good meal - and definitely still a good value. However, it just doesn't liven up the palate and senses like it used to.   However, the Creme Brulee with the Chocolate Center is still one of the best that we have tasted here in the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creme Brulee with Chocolate Center
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Parmesan Crusted Sirloin
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BBQ Chicken

qaABLm0b_xIRiqzYcNUBPw.text: I have lived in Scottsdale since 1978. I admit I have not been to Don & Charlies for years. I returned tonight. In the restaurant are a lot of signed baseballs from the best players ever. The restaurant itself looks just like it did 30 years ago. The service with the server and wait staff is exceptional. The food is over priced. A 10 oz prime rib is $39.99...really?It came cold, cooked to order. Expensive. The ribs were $24.99 for a half slab. They were hard to cut and just average. The Creme Brule was was excellent. This place may be great to take the tourist money but I won't be back. This is only my opinion but this place is stuck in the 70's.

KsAv0NuT0mXgoEfHaYwU7Q.text: I eat here all the time best in az I've been comeing here for years great location right in the heart of Scottsdale

HeilI_f8eL_uSAXmA-BEBw.text: haven't been in awhile, but it's time to go back as my brother recently reminded me. great for birthday celebrations, love the bbq chicken, skirt steak and liver pate. amazing baked potatoes and twice baked potato. fresh salads, balsamic dressing delicious. like the cloth tablecloths it is kind of pampering. gold brick sundae is a must if you have room

rTV_gJGQNWJBCvK3IHGfeg.text: Shame on me for not writing a review sooner.  Dined here with three other friends during our Spring Training trip at the end of March. We had to make reservations about 2 months prior as well.  We arrived for our 6:30pm reservations and the place was packed! The bar was flowing, both dining areas were filled with people and the entry area was bustling.   As we waited for our table, Muhammed Ali walked in with his wife and family members. That was a huge highlight. This place is rich with sports memorbillia and players often eat here after a game. Only odd thing was our waitress told us after that the Brewers Manager was also dining in the next room and that we could walk over there if wanted to. I am a super fan of baseball, but even I know the limits of someone's personal space.   We each ordered a few appetizers, bottle of wine and some salads before our entrees. I ordered the 10 oz ribeye and it was delicous. We ordered a side of mac and cheese and it had lots of flavor.  This place is fun because of the sporting atmosphere, fans, players, coaches, etc. and it's walkable from Downtown Scottsdale.   I'd definitely go back here again next year. For all the ladies, this place is a must visit for some great eye candy.

NFnFFvV0x6-rQelDNXkXOw.text: OK if you are a baseball fan, this place is a museum with good food.  From the moment you walk in you are surrounded by baseball and other memorabilia.. bats, balls, pictures, overwhelming for my daughter.. famous for its baby back ribs, which I thoroughly enjoyed.  Half rack was $18.95.. daughter had a burger, $11.95.. service xlnt. For me this is the best baseball themed restaurant anywhere.  We saw ex-Giants and current Reds manager Dusty Baker in the lobby.. nuts.. love this place. Place packed during March for baseball spring training in summer pretty dead..

7aqbdu36qZePmJVBA8iteA.text: Steaks and baseball. Baseball and steaks. That is what Don and Charlie's is known for. We were down in Arizona for Spring Training and had gone looking for great baseball eating places to go to after the games. We first went to Pink Pony and were disappointed. Then someone told us that D and C's was the new hotspot so we went there and was it ever great.  It was packed inside and the walls were filled with amazing baseball items and photos. Luckily, we were seated in the VIP corner booth right in the center of all the action. Then the Mom of the owner came up and started speaking to us, she was so nice and friendly, and eventually she sat down with us and spent much of the time of our meal with us in spite of all of the hubbub going on around us.  We got steaks and they were big and delicious. The potatoes were huge, the horseradish fresh and spicy hot. The entire night was terrific and the next time we return to Phoenix, we will probably go to D and C's every night because we know the food will be excellent and the service perfect.

drlKSwlIHI_l4Vm0kJcjeA.text: Perfect restaurant for any sports fan as the walls are lined with sports memorabilia. I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The atmosphere is pleasant, the food is excellent (especially the char-crust ribeye) and the staff is very friendly and courteous. This place is a must see for any sports fan when you visit the valley of the sun.

wO2o1fbyjoJ2YwZgR5-oNw.text: Comfortable environment and excellent food. Great for families or date night. The food is a bit pricey, but the portions are very generous.

bhfHKgvkVbZ59x3PpivEAw.text: My golf group decided to take me out to dinner as a reward for having them down to Scottsdale for our winter golf trip.  One of the guys wanted to go to Don and Charlie's so that's where we ended up. We got there fairly early on a Friday night, and were able to get right in.  We were seated in a large booth and given menu's but then seemed to lose our waitress.  It was busy at the time, so we weren't upset, but we wanted to order drinks.  We finally flagged the woman that sat us, and she located a server that took our order.  She then brought us our drinks, but was so busy with other tables, that she seemed to forget us for a while.   Apparently they had a special on their prime rib that ended at 6:00 pm, and everyone wanted to order before the magic hour was reached.  But so did we - and she made it just in time. But was she ever frazzled and curt.  The prime rib was wonderful, the baked potato was delicious, and the drinks were great.  I don't eat red meat that often, but I love it, and the prime rib and steaks were cooked just right - and the fresh horseradish was an extra treat.   It should be noted that by the time we finished there was a line waiting to get in.  They were swamped, but they did not seem in any hurry to rush us out and free up our table.  As sports fans, we all wandered around looking at the sports memorabilia during the time we were eating, so it took us a little longer to finish than usual.  They were patient and we did not feel rushed at all.  The only thing that detracted from the experience was the general commotion and noise of the crowd, and people waiting to get in.  It made it difficult to talk, so of course, we raised our voices.  And that just added to the din.  But all in all, it was a great experience.

KmdGvNQgWuTzD-6ohljWgg.text: Great venue.  The food is good Italian steakhouse fare rivaling those in Chicago.  It's like you're outside Wrigley Field.  The tables in the front are a little crowded.  Both my son and myself kept rubbing elbows with diners at tables behind us.  It is like an Italian family.  When the room is full the sound level gets pretty high.

CExwT6spMIfTDQcH4OooEg.text: I felt as if I was eating at a hospital cafeteria. The food was cold with no flavor. Everything was terrible -I read the above reviews and was surprised.  The room is loud and crowded. The dinner service was just like Denny's. The price is debatable - too high for third rate awful food. Did i miss something? I asked for recomendations.....i ordered the dish my server said was very good . I had their chicken schnitzel , no flavor,  their potatoes, no flavor and the awful salad , a bowl of coleslaw -brown and vinagary. For the record I am a good cook, I use seasoning! I don't serve ice cold food.  Their prices, for you get, are outrageous , it really was cafeteria quality or airplane..........

jLkRvU9LezJmCD0czO2ZiA.text: Since work (if you consider covering spring training work!) brought my boyfriend and I to Scottsdale, it seemed appropriate that Don & Charlie's, this steak-filled, sports memorabilia mecca be on our list.   We had reservations for 7:45, but since we were starving, we thought we'd go at 7 to see if we could get a table a little early. No way, Jose Canseco (Sorry, I felt I had to make a baseball joke, albeit a bad one). Tt was packed - so there went that thought! (note to Yelpers, make a reservation) After the hostess told my boyfriend that he smelled "delicious", we decided to hit up the bar for a few drinks and admire the floor-to-ceiling memorabilia.   Time passed quickly and we were ushered to our table. We tentatively agreed to the chopped liver appetizer (complimentary) and while it didn't rock my world, it was free! We also ordered the shrimp cocktail, and for entrees, I ordered the mustard crusted salmon and he got the blue cheese crusted filet medallion tips. And because the experiences we've had at other steakhouses require you to order sides to share, we tacked on some mac n'cheese and sauteed mushrooms to our order. My eyes must've widened to the size of a 42 oz porterhouse when the waitress told us that our meal came with a few sides outside of the ones we ordered. Say what? Feeling a little overwhlemed, I downed my glass of wine and promptly ordered another. Nothing like a little alcohol-induced appetite to help you crush that much food.   The food came promptly and what ensued next was sheer enjoyment of a delicious meal of food. We honestly couldn't decide who had the better entree. But while it wass too tough to compare a fish to a steak, I still think mine sqeaked through as the True dinner champion. Definitely check this place out if you're in Scottsdale - especially if you're a sports fanatic. Just don't forget to make a reservation!

2Z9jFiSgMSYFeRDVujEXfQ.text: This restaurant has now risen to my TOP 3 ever!  EVERY single thing that I ate at Don & Charlies was A+  We ordered an appetizer of shrimp de Jonghe (sauteed in wine, topped with garlic bread crumbs) and it was perfect!  Best shrimp appetizer ever.  Then I ordered the rib & filet combo.  These ribs could rival anything you have ever had.  I did half char rubbed and half midwest sauce for the ribs.  The steak was cooked exactly as I asked which rules!  My buddy ordered the filet medallions and was super happy as well.  We ordered sides of potatoes au gratin and they were wonderful.  We also tried both cole slaw options and while we are not into cole slaw, this actually was super good!   I couldn't stop eating it.  Dessert was awesome - we just ordered simple hot fudge sundaes and the hot fudge is HOMEMADE - are you kidding me?!?!?!?!!  Amazing.  Drank the housemade lemonade as well and I loved it.  ANYTIME I am in Phoenix, I am headed here.  The memorabilia collection was so awesome and I plan to bring my friends and family here.  A+ location with A+ service.  We had Brittany as our waitress and she's awesome - so friendly and 100% on top of her game.  Amazing amazing amazing place.  You MUST visit!!!!!!

X6it4EPMDFMIVMyGRt4Grg.text: If you find yourself in downtown Scottsdale at lunchtime you might drop in at Don & Charlie's, the sports memorabilia paradise which incidentally serves really good steaks, chops and ribs. The main restaurant isn't open, but the lounge hosts The Burger Bar from 11:30 to 2:30 PM.   The menu is small. There are a few appetizers - guacamole (not the best in town) and a Cabo style shrimp cocktail ($6.95) which I've heard is quite good. A few salads - chicken   Caesar and Mediterranean with chicken, both $8.95. They looked tasty and were quite large. And a few uninspiring sounding sandwiches.  The real reason to come here is the burgers; big, juicy and cooked to order (even if the menu says differently). The basic burger is $7.95, and nine variations are listed (all $8.95), but you can create your own for the same price. Slaw is served alongside. But, get this, for $1.95 you can get a huge plate of delicious onion "strings". I don't know why they're called strings, which are often dry and overcooked. These are basically onion rings which have been cut open so they're not round (again, I have no idea why). Fries are the same price, or you can have half and half.  The other reason to go to The Burger Bar is the broasted chicken. This is half a chicken  deep-fried in a pressure cooker. According to the explanation on the menu, "pressure frying seals in the flavors and seals out the oil". Ken will attest to this. The chicken was nice and crispy, not greasy and not salty. And the price was right - $9.95 for a serving size that runs at least $16 almost anywhere else. A word of caution. The chicken isn't pre-cooked (thank heavens) so it takes 20 minutes to a half hour to reach your table.  There's a mini creme brulee ($1.95) for dessert. This lone little offering struck me as very funny.   While you're waiting for your chicken you can walk around and look for artifacts from you favorite team. It's a fun place and a most reasonable price for lunch.

Sb6Fl6zip7Onr3xlh4ZJWA.text: Food is overrated. Nothing special here. The sports memorabilia and ambience is great. Again, food is just ok but a cool place to look around.

WVf2p7oU_pOfitxXb3iz-Q.text: My uncle has been telling me for years that his picture hangs right next to Ernie Banks. Naturally I told him he was full of crap. So when my other uncle flew down from San Francisco for spring training, we decided to see if he was really telling the truth.   The chopped liver appetizer tray was really good considering I've never had it nor was I even remotely interested by the sound of it.  I had a salad which was good (how can you really mess up a salad.)  Now I ordered the prime rib rare with fresh horseradish and a baked potato.  It was singlehandedly the best piece of red meat I've ever eaten.  Cooked to perfection (as was my wife's and uncle's steaks) just melted in my mouth like butter.  I've been to Fleming's, the Keg, and various other steakhouses, and they don't come close to this.  The horseradish was incredibly fresh with a lot more kick to it than normal.  The service was excellent with a very friendly staff.  The manager was more than helpful in trying to help us locate the picture of my uncle and his baseball team from Chicago.  He narrowed down the area for us and after 3 minutes of searching, low and behold, there it was.  19 years later the picture is still there.  I will go back, and not to visit the picture, but for the great food that awaits me.

27zU9j3fjHphGrt7r3KVcw.text: The place to go during spring training after a game and see a baseball player (will be crowded for sure). the experience is just really neat though, the place is covered head to toe with sports memorabilia, definitely the place to go if you're a visiting sports fan in scottsdale

oyu8XWZl62hs83q-rI_RBg.text: Gotta go here during  Spring Training and if you are a baseball aficionado. Their baseball collection is second to none and if you hang out in the bar during training you are in a big suprise in terms of what you will see. Menu seems to be overpriced bbq fare overall. Not bad- yet not worth it either. Fun time to be had overall if you are here during baseball season-check it out!

KgPkYWx-DwRF7OVx66Oa9w.text: A favorite among major leaguers in town for a game.  Great steaks, potatos au gratin and creamed spinach.  The walls are lined with baseball memorabilia including autographed pictures and uniforms.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dPo6IlxBTawKDZ9ep8qjMA.text: I've been dining here for probably 10 years. The food and atmosphere are great. If you like sports and sports history or just like a top quality mean then this place is for you!!

W3rKppiB4b8njH2iCBrVpA.text: Their prime rib is the best!! The service is great, and I could spend hours looking at the memorabilia. Definitely worth the price!

TUO8la23S3e9i3xDVE2-0Q.text: Great atmosphere especially for sports fans.  The food was delicious too.  Best prime rib.

5gJ-0XVjB9Ae2ZvJjYtjig.text: We have been coming to the place for the past 6 years on our annual golf vacation, but were told that they no longer take reservations for parties larger than 8 people.  So much for loyal customers.....very disappointing, but I'm sure somewhere else will take a 12 person dinner & drinks tab.

mBO65TCaZxS6vpMa1_0sMw.text: We dined at your restaurant tonight. We dined at your restaurant many times in the past few years. I've dined at your restaurant dozens of times since I was a child, over 30 years or so. Things have gone downhill over the years. It seems as though you slowly raise the prices, and give you less and less items for the money. Yes I get it there is inflation, and you can't continue to give the same thing for the same price. But why are you the only restaurant I can think of, who constantly takes things away, and then charges more to add them back when it used to be included? Maybe you guys just were horrible at the beginning, and gave too much value? No, I don't think that was it. It's just that you are getting greedy.  There's no other way to put it.   But on to the dinner. Like many servers, our server clearly has been with your restaurant for many many years. And it shows. Not because she is so experienced, but because she seems to just be like a robot, rushing to take your order, not really hearing what you're saying, and not looking answer any extra questions. She simply want to move on, get the order in, get your food out, not stop by any extra times, get you out, and get the next warm bodies into the seat. What's frustrating is both the owner, & a manager are roaming around the dining room during our dinner, but neither one of them stop to ask him anything was. In fact I didn't even stop and talk to anyone in the dining room, not that I can't say it didn't happen, but I never saw it at all during our visit tonight.   You guys are an iconic restaurant in the valley, so you need to live up to your reputation, but instead you rest on your reputation and take advantage of your customers, many who spend up to $100 a person. I'm not saying you guys are in a good restaurant, I just think you need to remind your staff that the people who are dying in here are out to relax and enjoy the evening, and they should not be rushed through their meal, or be given any kind of attitude, or lack of customer service.   I hope you will stop and think, and remember it's the regulars who really build your business. If you slowly change everything, and disappoint, and don't respect them, you won't have much to show for it in the end now will you? Again, I think there's lots of good things about your restaurant , but I also think customer service is key, and this is not the first time I've not been impressed with it.   Your wait staff really needs to be reminded that they're lucky to have this position, and that regulars like us, as well as all customers, deserve better. Unless I see a change, my next visit may be my last.

R0U4yiHtjwh1MsNTijBOzg.text: Ok, everyone knows that this is a great place for barbecue - and it didn't disappoint!  BUT, the baked potato was awesome! The best I've had in a long time. Good baked potatoes seem to be a lost art. It was crunchy and salty on the outside and perfect inside. Maybe close to a pound. Service was great. The only minus might be average food presentation. Especially for the price.

n5p8PKvQmxGKLF9oYZhHIw.text: This place offers amazing food, while being surrounded by countless pieces of sports and entertainment memorabilia. You'll pay a bit more than most places, but I guarantee you will leave with a full belly and a smile on your face!

O-IbJx_K3iCIsRUXcDR5jg.text: If I was going to outer space for a year ...Don and Charlie's would be my last meal. Liver pate...and rye bread OUTSTANDING. Onion rings.....best I have ever had. Slaw (deli style) tart and sweet at the same time....Excellent Chopped sirloin...fabulous. Hot fudge sunday....OMG Price very very reasonable. Service IMPECABLE.  THE BEST SPOT IN THE VALLEY

6UuNyzSrsbDTILXoPnTdrQ.text: The Boy took me to Don and Charlie's for my yearly anniversary of NOT getting older and we really enjoyed our experience!  Don and Charlie's has a lot of charm as that neighborhood restaurant where you take your family or meet your buddies after golf.  The menu is easy to navigate and reminded me of home (yay Midwest!). We decided on an appetizer, the onion strings, which was delicious and MASSIVE.  The two of us barely made a dent in it.    The Boy felt like ribs and I was feeling steak so he ordered a full rack with the Southwest Sauce and I got the NY with Parmesan crust.  The Boy LOVED the ribs and raved about the Southwest sauce so much that he has mentioned it several times since the visit and even talked about going back and seeing if he could buy a pint.  I ordered the Deli style cole slaw, a must if you like vinegar and mustard but was just ok with the Parm Crusted steak.  It was good but I felt like the steak had enough flavor that it didn't need the parm coating.  Our server was delightful, attentive, and very helpful when navigating the menu.  She even surprised me with a piece of their delicious chocolate cake for my birthday!  I mean, ummm, my special occasion.  Everything about our visit was amazing and we look forward to coming back!  One tip, use valet due to the many clubs in the area as well as the new residents being built across the street.

n91lHqJlPysQa_2UYhqnHg.text: After hearing such great things about this place I finally had a chance to try it. Overall it was very average food and average service. I got a burger & wedge salad. The burger was nothing special (bun was dry). The wedge salad is the reason why they got another star - that I would order again & again. After ordering our food, the waitress promised to bring bread to the table but never did. As well it was very unprofessional when two waitresses started bickering & being petty towards each other in front of the customers.

mfZeZAK60KO8gcB_lb8ejw.text: Ordered pork baby back ribs with cole slaw and a wedge salad and baked potato which we shared.  The potato was served cut in half with a large rotten section on each half!! Surely they had to notice when they cut it to serve it! The wedge salad was lukewarm, and blue cheese dressing was "interesting" to say the least.  The ribs were overcooked and dry, the best part of the meal was the skin of the potato and The coleslaw. The draft beer was flat and we returned that.  Not sure what to expect if we had ordered one of the very expensive steaks... We will be not be going back.  Perhaps this restaurant is living solely on its reputation at this point. The sports memorabilia is fun to look at, but that's where the True enjoyment ends.

GLEb0WhFKvIWVtQbMfUKJQ.text: Nice Chicago sports themed restaurant in Scottsdale AZ. Food was so so, most of our steaks for our group were over cooked. The atmosphere of the place is great, pictures, baseballs, & autographs of famous sports legends.  Good spot for lunch, not necessarily for a high end steak dinner.

c6gQhZox8jaOf4t1j-WAaw.text: Party of 6 had reservations on Sunday night. The table reserved was cramped into the middle of restaurant and the noise from neighboring tables was so load we asked to be reseated. Waitress came back and said it would be 20-30 minutes even though we saw other tables empty. We decided to leave. Outside the restaurant as we were getting our car, a Man approached, who I assume was the manager, and said he could get us a table and we indicated no thanks since his staff should have been able to accommodate us if he could now. Very poor of restaurant. None of us will return.

zJ1T9eMbMijGvWYYiJm7Pw.text: I was here recently for the first time in several years.  The baseball memorabilia is fantastic.  Sitting in the bar is the way to go.  Chopped liver and great bread to start out.  I pretty much always get the prime rib.  It's really good with the creamy horseradish.  A salad and a baked potato is all you need for a complete food coma.  So good but I can't eat like this too often.

wRsm2IkWUZ85aaekaRFE6A.text: We were introduced to this place when they offered a Groupon last year. Friends had talked it up and we couldn't pass it up. Since then, we have come back several times. We've dined in the restaurant area and the bar area. If we want the full service treatment, we'll go in the restaurant....for quick eats, we go into the bar. You can get the same menu at the bar as the restaurant, but not vice versa. We've ordered the following: Chopped Liver Platter (Sweet Bell Pepper Strips, Carrot Slaw, Onions, Chopped Egg, 4.95 Spinach & Artichoke Dip, 9.95 Cheeseburger, $10.95 12 oz Filet, $37.95 1/2 & 1/2 Cole Slaw, $2.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/don-... Onion Strings, $4.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/don-... The Filet & Cheeseburger are amazing and are my favorite. I order one of these every visit. The Better Half loves the Chopped Liver Platter....it's not for me though. The Onion Strings are addictive...you've been warned. I love how they offer a Cole Slaw side dish that's 1/2 Creamy and 1/2 Deli style....they're both good, but I give the nod to the Deli style if I had to choose only 1. The service here is pretty good. The only complaint that I have is that they never have any Ribs when we're here. Our 1st trip, we came at 8:30 pm and the server told us that they were out of Ribs and that if we ever wanted to have them we'd have to come early like around 5:30 pm because they only order/prepare a limited amount....OK....so we came one day at 5:30 specifically to try the Ribs, guess what? They were out already....WTF?! Come on Don & Charlie....order enough to at least give us the opportunity to try this....I'm not going to play the game of come earlier next time. That's the only bad taste in my mouth (no pun intended) about this joint. Return Factor - 80%

kJBAWti4YHjFv3ZxhlAGIQ.text: Don and Charlie's is not a bad place to hang out. They have good food, a nice atmosphere, and lots for cool stuff on the wall. They are a solid 3 stars, and could be a 3.5 star is their food just wasn't so expensive. I don't mind paying higher prices when the food is on-par with the price, but Don and Charlie's is not a 4 or 5 star steakhouse, but their pricing says they are... It's hard to say what a 4 or 5 star steakhouse looks like because it's such a competitive space with some many variables such and inconsistent supply and staff to manage so that it is hard to be a solid 5 star to everyone every time.

DsIaBQG4IHb1r-wm2CbLyg.text: Very disappointing. Old place, old smells. Food was fair for a Lettuce Restaurant. Waitress kept pushing us on sides, apps, drinks. We just wanted a simple meal. Very annoying. Food was so average. Dessert was a scoop of tasteless vanilla ice cream with some sort of chocolate coating. The reviews were 4 out of 5. I don't get it. Terrible.

GigVB6PEVcPnu6D_OjF6ow.text: My favorite steak house in Scottsdale. Outstanding food and spectacular ambiance. This March will be my 25th+ time attending spring training and Don & Charlie's is one of the highlights. Prime rib and creamy coleslaw along with liver pate! Looking forward to my next visit in March.

RcXHfUPLm87Oq7oxV82R5g.text: We have gone to Don & Charlie's many times over the past four years.  The food is 5 stars as well as the baseball memorabilia collection that adorns it's walls and ceilings.  The reason for my 2 star review is as follows:  1.  Even with a reservation, you have to wait 30 minutes to get seated. 2.  They have increased their prices and decreased their portion sizes at the same time. 3.  The service is minimal, often having to remind your waiter/waitress to bring you what you had asked for. 4.  Prices are outrageous.  Dinner for two, with one drink each, has never been below $100.  We will be looking for other places to get a good steak from now on.

zG5q4BgMWkeyPDG93oRwPg.text: I really wanted to like this place. With the hype surrounding it I had high expectations. Upon arriving the lobby was absolutely packed. Possibly because Willy Mays was there signing his book and other souvenirs. That was pretty surreal.   Once seated I checked in and was pleased you get a free cheesy bread appetizer with checkin. Definitely a plus.   The bread it came with wasn't that attractive. Also the bus boy grabbed my appetizer plate without asking so I had to tell him I wasn't done.  10 minutes after ordering the waitress came back and said she lost our ticket. Really? Hm ok. Too bad I reordered the first thing I ordered which was called "mumsies stuffed chopped steak." I presumed it would be a stir fry but I clearly misunderstood because out came a pound slab of meatloaf. It was okay but I was miffed that I ordered just a hunk of ground beef with mashed potatoes on the side.   Also we finished our first round of drinks and she came back way later to check on us. The margarita was okay but we decided to keep it simple and get a bottle of wine to share instead.  I saw bench coach Ron wotus on the way in and clubhouse manager mike Murphy on the way out. Said hello to the latter. Anyway, the memorabilia was cool but the misleading menu and average wait staff brought the experience down for me. This place is a one and done for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Say hey kid. Willie mays

tCdnKJ1HVrzmdg_BkyVz_g.text: I was told this would be a great place to take my boyfriend on his birthday because he loves sports and was told the food was good. I was not impressed at all. We made a reservation and we were sat about 15 minutes late. Then when getting seated they asked who's birthday is it? (I put a note in the reservation what we were celebrating) and I said it was his! We sat down and were greeted by our server who seemed to be overwhelmed with her night. We were in no rush and took our time ordering and getting drinks to start off with. We ordered our food and when it came out it looked great! Then once I cut into my steak that I ordered medium rare, it was well done. Thankfully his steak that he ordered medium rare was cooked to perfection. I tried to have a couple bites of mine but it was just way over cooked. Our server never once came by to ask how everything was and just asked if I wanted a box at the end. You would think that if I was paying that much for a meal and took a couple bites they would ask if everything was okay. Then at the end we were never asked if we wanted to get dessert! And our server never acknowledged his birthday! Why ask if we are celebrating something and then never acknowledge it??

7qFhNOz7FawdzX8OuaT45A.text: Have come here for two special occasions, and both times, it's been wonderful! Food and the decor are awesome! Too bad it's not closer to us, but it's worth the drive.

w96dpluESRQ4mjckwsRdxg.text: Sadly this is the end for Don & Charlies - they closed last week. The site of this storied restaurant will soon become a high rise apartment building.  Our last meal was on par with our many previous visits - very good quality American food such as ribs; prime rib or steaks.  Our farewell choice was their ribs.  Now Don and Charlie's lives on in memory

xcWCEr82cbJPCW5z7c5LTg.text: This review is almost irrelevant since this place is closing   Sports lovers dream. We would have brought people back just for the environment. It is amazing to see all the sports memorabilia that's been acquired over the years.   Excellent calamari. Loved the bread basket options. The strip with the garlic parmesan on top was something I'll try to replicate. Cole slaw coming with the meal as a start salad was odd but the non creamy one really worked with the overall meal.

4aqLZn5UP6J1x12QUAa1ZA.text: Honestly, we are totally bummed this place is closing so soon. It will truly be missed. My girlfriend has been coming here since she was a kid and I was lucky enough to be invited along for the past year or so. Since my first experience (I had ribs which weren't bad but weren't 5 star worthy) the food quality has only gone up for me. The parmesan crusted New York strip was to die for. Best coleslaw I think I have ever had and the au gratin potatoes are always delicious.   Perhaps I just don't know where to go but it seems like old school places like this don't really exist much anymore. After all, I am old at heart. It was a non pretentious spot for family gatherings or date nights where you wanted to have a nice steak but not feel like you had to dress up in club attire. Reasonable prices for the quality and portion sizes too.   You'll be missed Don & Charlies. Our farewell dinner was as perfect as it could be. Perfect food and perfect service. I'm glad I got to visit you several times before the end. If you haven't made it back for a farewell, the time is NOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Au gratin potatoes

ezL3nXRMv0e_8eHmRXb29A.text: D&C is a classic sports memorabilia steakhouse.  As Spring Training is in the Greater Phoenix region, you have a good chance of running into athletes and this place, you'll see the most evidence of why.  It's a classic old looking dimly lit place but with all sorts of baseball and sports artifacts.  Photos of Muhammad Ali who visited here. Autographed Babe Ruth baseball. Classic bobbleheads (the Bob Ueker one was my favorite) Jerseys everywhere.  Trevor Story and Nolan Arenado's are displayed in the main dining area.  To me it was information overload and there was no real methodology as to how they were all laid out.  Just a ton of artifacts everywhere.  Service was perfect.  That's all that needs to be said about that.  Food was 3-3.5 star quality.  It's good but I've had better ribs and prime ribs (which were what I ate).  The ambience is a 4.5 if you love sports.  I love sports so I enjoyed it here.  It's a very social friendly place.  It's moderately loud but you can carry on a very good conversation amid a large round table holding 8 persons.  The fries here are outstanding.  I recommend the larger looking fries.  They were perfect.  5 star quality fries there.  The "Deli style" cole slaw side (3 stars) was too sweet in my opinion.  The creamy (4 starts) one tastes much better.  The ribs I didn't like (3 stars).  Too burnt and hard to eat.  They warned me in advance but I had to at least give them a try.  The prime rib is much better (4 stars)  The mashed potatoes ( 3 stars) taste pretty good with the prime rib's gravy poured on it.  But they're too dry.  For a decent dinner, you will have to pay around $40-$60 after tip.  Also, this place permanently shuts down early this coming April so this review won't be too useful considering you need a month in advance to make a reservation here.  Was an interesting experience.  I recommend it once because of the artifacts and the history of this place, but you'll find better steakhouses elsewhere without all the hype.

tZ-VHlQw-_UPAxy1d0kZTA.text: I am going to miss this place!  So many memories.  I wish there was a place to move it.  Maybe to the old Trader Vic's at the Valley Ho?    No matter what, that space will not be replicated and that is sad.  The ribs, the baked potato, the salads, and the Gold Brick Sundae are half of what makes the place great. The camaraderie of all the diners, the great staff, and wonderful memorabilia are part of the fabric of America's past time.  It is one of my must eat places in the world more than for the food, but for the experience.  If they come back, even if half as wonderful, I will say it isn't the same, but is and always be a place to go to.  I hope the boutique hotel will pay homage to the restaurant even if it isn't the same.  I have so many memories of this place and have met and sat next to so many famous people.  My favorite is having busted out of work and flown to down to 'Zona for a guys weekend of baseball and golf.  We were exhausted but when we got to the restaurant the doors burst open and it was the Giants broadcasting team of Kruk, Kuip, and Simmons. Kruk held the door open and said "Gentlemen, welcome to Baseball Heaven".  Thanks Don and Charlies, as Lon Simmons used to say, "Going, going, ........ Tell it goodbye." You established something great and memorable in this world that brought people joy.

_6UAiYjG-tX7HQhhAb2__w.text: Glad we discovered this old classic! Love the sports memorabilia with an emphasis on baseball and Chicago sports in particular. Very fun to swing by during Cactus League baseball spring training season to soak in the ambience, and one may run into an occasional baseball player.   Start with a nice cocktail at the accommodating bar before dinner.  Bagel chips and rye bread accompany the meal along with deli or fresh, crispy creamy cole slaw.  Don & Charlie's is known for their steaks, ribs and chicken.  The steak is aged and cooked to perfection. Son ordered garlic crusted which was amazingly flavorful, tender and juicy.  I ordered a half rack of ribs which were meaty and lean, but a little dried out and did not care for the accompanying bbq sauce.  Service was friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interesting history about Don &amp; Charlie&#39;s on the front page of the menu.
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My son and I loved the sports memorabilia; especially baseball!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Signed baseballs from hall of famers!

oHWKeaTgRv4NCjV-xTxCog.text: Sad to hear this place is closing in I guess a couple of months. In light of that, I will keep this short. If you happen to be a sports fan, get here if you can. Great food. Steaks, ribs, etc. The usual classic steak house sides. All solid with a good drink and wine menu. The thing for me is the memorabilia. I mean words cannot describe it. Wall to ceiling. Hall of fame stuff. Babe Ruth signed baseball sitting next to Ted William's. I mean awesome. Go for the love of the game and get a great meal while your at it. Sad to see this place go but glad I got in here just once. No other place like it in the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mTa1m40IAa897Z0kcSxreQ.text: One of the Best Prime Ribs Ever, the Cole Sale was very good and not to mention the sides are as advertised large and tasty.   The atmosphere of this place is unreal. They have anything sport related on the walls.   Sad to here they sold out.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

C5quhlbWxMXHQ3sASksqQg.text: Don & Charlie's has that genuine old Chicago feel.   Maybe it's all their collectibles in display cases as you come in, but it reminds me of my first trip to Gene & Georgetti's thirty plus years ago.   The five of us came here for our Easter dinner and for the most part we left impressed. The food was very good and cooked to perfection. Our server Jeff was incredible. I'm going to write that again, our server Jeff was incredible!  Steakhouse are not inexpensive dining, but Don & Charlie's prices are in-line with some of the others here in town, like Paul Martin's, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, etcetera. But what you are really getting at Don & Charlie's, besides a good tasting steak, is atmosphere. Don & Charlie's has atmosphere in spades.   I've taken a few photos and yes, the food was as good as it looks. Expect to pay $65 each, including dessert, one drink and taxes, but before gratuities.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6cPQrsLxNtSQcA8FyNRM5A.text: AFTER 21 YEARS I finally tried the salmon! It was the best piece of fish I have ever had! Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. After 21 years finally decided to try the salmon!  Best piece of fish I ever ate!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Braised short rib! TENDERNESS DEFINED!
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Closing soon! Come while u can!

yfCRsS9TZlM2e2N8_ofJrg.text: Very popular and a staple of Scottsdale, you can expect to run into one or more athletes over dinner.   Valet and street parking available.  Many sports memorabilia decorate every square inch of the restaurant. Large, busy bar and lots of seating for small and larger groups. Sufficient beer and wine selection. Steaks are cooked perfectly, and they are famous for their ribs. The New York steak was cooked right at medium rare and came with a crusty, wonderfully delicious crust. Salad and broccoli are a strong pass, the salads probably super high in calorie with their dense sauces and the broccoli being very bland and with a tangy sauce that didn't look appealing both visually or taste-wise. Potatoes, whether roasted or mash, seemed visually more tasty and a better option.  Not a five star because our server didn't seem too excited when we ordered desserts, and even mentioned it would be more preferrable to turn the table around for a new set of customers but would make an exception for us to order dessert.  There's a rumor the store is closing and being converted to a nursing facility or senior housing with the restaurant perhaps or not moving to another location. Hope that's not True as even if they simply relocated, it would not be the same. A jem and old school tradition that needs to stay.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New York so good
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Potatoes and cole slaw two ways
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

W_sQu-zk3n9-EoguGlVTlg.text: We drove pass by all the times but never have any social occasion to stop by. Once I heard the news about the closing, I knew it is time to stop by.  The food is so good and the atmosphere is the best!  I thought that this place is for a special dinner only but when I was there, I saw many families enjoy their weekend dinner together. It also has lots of sport memorabilia in there.  I love their creamy cold slaw and original breasted chicken. They are great pairing. We also got pecan crusted rainbow trout and deli style cold slaw. The fish is perfectly prepared. The portion were huge  so I had leftover to enjoy the next day.  We will definitely go back for steak and desserts!

1c_pMyO7gDr5cojdEKZiXw.text: OMG! "LAST SUPPER" Wow, we were lucky enough to score one of the last reservations for dinner. We reserved about 3 weeks ago. We had a 6:15 reservation at this great eatery. I cannot recall how many years we have been coming here. My daughter always wanted dinner at D&C's for her birthday, presents were not required as long as we took her to dinner here. We always order a full rack of baby back ribs because they are so good, meaty and tasty without having to be dripping with sauce.  There was a method to our madness on this night. We were going to order a rack to take home, alas our waitress, Maggie told us that they were not doing to go orders on the last nights. So....I asked if I could go ahead and order extra dinners and she said this was fine! So I ordered 2 racks of ribs and just got a doggie bag for the extra set. My wife ordered the 12oz Filet Mignon, medium rare. It came out looking so delicious, I begged for a bite, amazing! We also always get the creamed spinach which we also got as extra orders. I love their creamy coleslaw and got an extra order. Our table looked to be overflowing as platters we all over, it looked great. Don was walking around greeting everyone one this, one of the final nights at this great location. He is such a gentleman. We will miss this great establishment. Even though they are to open and scaled down version when the hotel is built, it will not be the same. Thanks to Don and Charlie's for many great memories and so many great meals.

8TSQXe1iC5Zn2Fj2GpoXzw.text: What a great restaurant! I've lived in Scottsdale for several years and have been to Mastro's City Hall, Steak 44, and Bourbon and Bones whenever I had a craving for steak. Honestly, I thought why even try Don & Charlie's. It can't be better than City Hall or Steak 44 (I'm not a fan of Bourbon and Bones). I'm so glad I gave it a try.   My wife had the steak sandwich, which isn't a sandwich at all. It's a NY Strip with a side of cheese bread. She loved it. I had the ribeye and it literally melted in my mouth. The best ribeye I've had in Old Town. I really liked the coleslaw and the original sauce as well. The banana cream pie was delicious.  I'm so glad I came here before the shut it down before the rebuild. We will be coming here from now on when we have a steak craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HVvTRixKw1GLPowtUgY4wg.text: A very three star experience- sat at the bar- ordered broasted chicken, large quantity- breast was dried, thigh and leg ok- waitress failed to say double baked potato was extra charged- I wanted baked potato, she made sound the only choice was double baked. I did not get the soup like she mentioned the plate came with. I got the creamy coleslaw which helped with the dry chicken breast. They took off the double baked potato from the bill!! Always check your your bill!!!  We ordered the artichoke dip, good- wine good- cream brulee good except there was a block of chocolate bar underneath!!! Weird- ok experience

LRleW9M8xePVzR9rYzTdPA.text: Enjoying one last meal before D&C closed the next day. Hopefully, they will be reopening when a new hotel is built on this site. Thanks to Don and all his staff for the great service, fabulous food, and wonderful memories! We hope to see you again!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tFcMZ-HbZN3OQev1DOOcmQ.text: Don and Charlie's was interesting. It's a steakhouse meets sports bar type of place. We came here for a celebratory dinner for my sister after she graduated from college. We made a reservation for 7:45pm. I checked out the menu beforehand and based on the pricing, I envisioned this place to be pretty upscale. I was surprised when I walked in that the whole place is littered with sports memorabilia. It's on the walls, ceiling, everywhere. It's pretty cool to look at but not what I imagined at all. It was very quiet on a Monday night and only a handful of tables were occupied. Our server was sweet and efficient. And so was the bus boy who cleared plates and filled water.   Shortly after we sat down, bread, bagel chips and butter were brought to the table. I love that the butter was room temp so it was easy to spread. We ordered shortly after and the food came out about 20 minutes after that.   Out of 7 of us, 3 people got ribs, 3 got steaks and one salmon. The Parmesan crusted NY which I ordered was delicious. It was cooked medium as I requested. The Parmesan crust fell off the steak so that was a slight annoyance but still tasty. Each entree comes with coleslaw creamy or vinegar style, and a choice of potato. The coleslaw was delicious. It was cold and tangy. The mashed potatoes were ok as well as the fries.   Minor gripes.  My bro ordered the "steak sandwich" which is literally just a piece of steak and cheese toast on the side. The waitress warned him that this was not what you think a sandwich would be, and she was not wrong. But my thing is why would you even call it a sandwich then? Also it came out very burnt. My bro didn't want to complain but I would have said something. Also the ranch although homemade, was SO SALTY. I could barely eat it. And you know I love my ranch.  I hear this place is closing soon because it got bought out by a hotel or something. But I think it will be open for another year or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;steak sandwich&#34;
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My parm crusted NY steak with mushrooms
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creamy coleslaw

vxR8wkM5_0HZCwxLUsc-CA.text: It's a big loss that this place is closing. I guess change is the only constant as they say, but baseball - and America - need good old, well-worn sports watering holes and gathering spots like this. The Spring Training experience will be poorer for not having this restaurant there. Someone should have stepped in.  The food is good. Sure, there are three-star Michelin places in the world and this isn't one of them, but the food is good and hearty. As are the drinks.

TZ9t4wlWJGECtb0MbQltSA.text: I always feel like I stepped into some New York gangsters meeting spot.  Even perhaps going back in time.  There is never a lack of entertainment here: simply from the clientele to the numerous sporting collectible decor.  Service is five star: attentive, informative and personable.  Portions are also plentiful so I believe there is value for your money here.  If you like mayo-based cole slaw, this is your spot.  Sauteed buttery mushrooms?  Also your spot.  A stacked bar and cozy, fun and romantic seating provide for a great date night out, a gentlemen's get together or Grandpa's birthday.  I'd leave the kids at home for this one: the tables are close and adults want to be able to speak freely when they are spending $$$.  Cheers.

oQx1sgNW1zHp5Hry6eb16g.text: Updating this review from 4 stars to 5.   I have now been to Don & Charlie's 3 times. The service and food is consistently great every single time.   I will continue going back and recommend you do too.

_V90a5KKPUT5Ed_f4dY4fw.text: When I moved to the Valley of the Sun 15 years ago I went to the Concierge at the Phoenician -then the best hotel in town- and asked him, "who has the best Prime Rib in town?"  His answer, "Don and Charlies."  Next question: "who has the best BBQ Ribs in town?"  His answer, "Don and Charlies."  That was 15 years ago and since then, it has been my benchmark for every steakhouse I go to.  Don Carson knows his business well, no question and when you go there, he is usually wandering around the restaurant visiting with guests and keeping an eye on the place. I've not had anything bad there, ever, and I think I've pretty much tried everything on their menu. If you want good steak, prime rib or ribs.  Go here.  You won't be disappointed.

pZYNBuuAbhhBHD9KPODerQ.text: AMAZING!  We were in town for business/personal and local friends of our suggested Don & Charlie's..........was wonderful.    We had frog legs - I was skeptical but then I tried them and they really do taste similar to chicken, kids!  My 'chicago style' steak was heaven, vegetables were cooked to perfection and the potatoes were delightful.  Love it, Love it, Love it!

EqUi7R9zP9muNovCm-04Iw.text: Prime rib was fantastic, calamari was also very good, my friend had ribs and a salad, the meat was flavorful but not fall off the bone. Price point is a little high but i wouldn't hesitate going again.   no tank tops

k_RR7nhz_WKisGKfatLdLg.text: Ribs were very dry.  I could not even eat the last two of them.  Used to get the chopped liver appetizer for free and now they charge for it.  Service was very average.  It was Sunday and they didn't even have any of the special left at 5:30 PM.  The person I was with said the prime rib was very good.  Another person said the chicken ceasar salad was good as well.  I did hear a resounding 'YUM' regarding the mashed potatoes.  For what they charge here, I would not be compelled to go back nor would I recommend.

pkV8YM3dIWaMFwAj4Mt4Ug.text: Love this place. Shelly the bartender is so awesome. Food is fantastic and I don't say that lightly. I crave the broasted chicken.  Not to be missed when you come to Scottsdale.

vfpywTZkBvwW_et9FXxeww.text: Food might be okay but I'll never know.  An hour wait at 8:30 on a monday night?  Sorry, I'll pass.

n11Mvx66lg8j3KFLOwUq5Q.text: Sorry, the famous ribs were short on meat and overcooked. The deli slaw was soaked in vinegar.

s-NIOLgA4JdNbwWM-JhwUA.text: This place gets it right from the moment you walk in the door. Signed baseballs jerseys and bats by legends on the wall, a friendly host to greet you and when you sit down they ask if you want free chopped liver. It comes with bits of egg and onion, warm rye bread and bagel chips.   Our waiter, Jeff, was friendly and attentive, even lending us his flashlight to read an old newspaper story in the rafters. The cream of mushroom soup made from scratch was superb. Our mains were baby back ribs, the specialty of the house, cooked perfectly with a flavorful sauce. The 'broasted' chicken was to die for: moist and juicy with a crispy outer skin. The fries were piping hot, as they should be. And the portions are beyond generous.  We topped it off with key lime pie, light and tasty, an ideal complement to the meaty mains. And the bill was under $60, an amazing deal. As a bonus, some of the players drop in during spring training.

7T_5x-8f1AFeNSmRftxJug.text: This was my first visit to Don and Chalie's.  I went with my wife.  When we arrived the lobby was jammed packed waiting to be seated.  Who is sitting in the corner signing autographs, is none other than the famous Willie Mays!  We went into the bar to have a drink before our table was ready.  Sat down and a gentleman came up and started a conversation with us.  Come to find out that this was another friendly patron who was there by himself.  Just needed someone to talk to.  Almost everyone in the restaurant was in a good mood.  Lots of autographed and sports memoribilia.  Found out that the owner's family owned Carson's Ribs: a Chicago staple.  So of course had to have the ribs.  They were fantastic.  Get the vinigar cole saw.  Out of this world.

3c6IMslOuyaiF13W8ByfCg.text: About as good as it gets.  Went last night for about the 5th time and as usual the service and quality was amazing.  The prime rib and Ribs are my two favorite things on the menu and are must haves.  The service is amazing and treated my 3 year old so nicely, they brought over toys for the "treasure chest" which they have to give little kids free toys.  Not a cheap place but if you are looking for a quality dinner in an old time chicago style steakhouse it can't be beat.

SAJ3hkkUWGPehdwE1OBd7Q.text: We love to go here. Always for a special occasion. Food is delicious and we always have so much fun.

rmkJIKg-ZwNI28DT9YCPSg.text: We brought out of town friends for dinner hoping they would love the decor as well as the food. We have eaten at this restaurant with other friends and never been a real big fan, however we decided to give it another try. Worst ribs I have ever had they were tuff and not very meaty. Salad was boring.  The attitude of the ownership as well as the Chef is reflected in the quality of this restaurant. There is such potential, I will say the server was a wonderful lady as were the hostesses. Sorry we won't be back.

49eS2TmL1mydG_16OqdGTg.text: Love restaurants that have this sports atmosphere - plenty of pix, artifacts, autographs and memorabilia.  Food was very good, as was the service.  Prices were reasonable.  We'll go back on next visit to Scottsdale.

-5hsbRQ4UwwoM2HqiFgoVQ.text: yummy food. great deal. onion rings were great. environment ~ sports bar. prime rib ~ yum

Z6nnwOG4WBbBEex2XnfNUA.text: Not much to say here, but if you love sports and have not been here GO.  During Spring Training or weekends, make a reservation or be disappointed.  They have an incredible collection of sports artifacts, allow an hour plus to just look around.  The food is straight-forward mid-west steakhouse and the meat is exceptional quality.  Forget the fish and vegetables, this is a steakhouse.  No pretension here, don't embarrass yourself if you see Hall of Fame athletes (any sport) or celebrities at the next table.  Take a cab, parking is limited and the Scottsdale PD doesn't tolerate DUI.  You'll have more than a few cocktails between dinner and checking out the vintage pictures, jerseys and autographs.

HMvmjLYPNM9mSx6Skzus1w.text: Its restaurants like this that make dining fun again.  Character,service and great food all the ingredients for a great dining experience.  I had the primerib 16 oz which i should have cooked more, but that was my fault.  Great taste even besides my bust.  OMG the scalloped potatoes and the chessie bread are addicting.  Blue cheese wedge salad was even well done. My wife had a cheese burger..yea I know but damn it was great.  Our waiter was proffesional informative,attentive,and best of all respectful and courteous.  About the only thing negative would be the older cacausian clientele that really really like this place, can you say snotty!  I still encourage you to go and eat in the lounge where it is which less stuffy.  Don came out to check on the guests hich was cool you dont see that much anymore.  I will be back once I make my way through my other Scotsdale eateries,which might be a while.

eC67TF4uuN8KJ1qVfmauKA.text: We went to Don & Charlie's tonight and had the best time! Our waiters, Sam & Pedro were incredible, and the food - the ribs - were the best they've ever been! In the 25 years we've been eating at Don & Charlie's, this was the best visit yet due to our service from Sam & Pedro!

W1gWvyTHvZwm0N0sVqLmPQ.text: Amazing food and amazing atmosphere ! We visit every year at Spring training and it is always consistent

PQhFEX8lEyh17ceAnAg8zQ.text: Food was great and Gina was awesome! She was such a great help! :)

cfVCnJICGH6qktnxJUKccA.text: 5 visits to Don & Charlie's and I can form an opinion finally. Well, thats not all True, I had a good opinion formed after the first visit but kept coming back because everyone sang such high praises. In all honesty, I have to wonder about the people singing praises of this place. Are they the same people that think TGI Friday's is a nice night out? Red Lobster is good seafood? A phenomenal upscale night out is Cheesecake Factory? They must be.... MUST BE.  Now before you all go screaming how you are insulted because you like Don & Charlie's, hear me out. They are part of a chain of 35 restaurants called Lettuce Entertain You, cute. The other Phoenix location they own is Maggiano's Little Italy, which is always forgetful. From the moment you walk in and are coldly greeted by a teenage girl, who is only there because daddy wants her to have a job to prove she is mature enough to drive the BMW he just bought her for sweet 16, one has to wonder what they are in for. Is this going to be a fun-filled evening with wacky sports memorabilia all over the walls and fun servers? Are you going to be taken into the wacky world of Chicago/Phoenix sports history? Are you in for the best BBQ you've ever had? Hardly.  Despite warnings from a co-worker whom had been prior to my visit that said the tough and dry ribs won't come off the bone despite any efforts you make, I ordered them. He was right. With me done trying to separate the meat from the bone, and giving up, I put the bone down, still covered in meat. The ribs came with a chicken schnitzel that had pretty much zero flavor, at all. Next visit dad and I both ordered Prime Rib, ate about 2/3 of it and both agreed that eating the rest just wouldn't be worth it. Another visit we ordered a shrimp cocktail, a couple of steaks, wedge salads, calamari, and a few other odds and ends. The 4 of us that night spent quite some time in the bathroom at our respective homes.   The service has never been really friendly, to say the least, but usually spot on helpful. On my 5 visits, I've had 3 different servers. One, a large middle aged gentleman, is the most matter of fact guy I've probably ever encountered. Just not the personality for a server and while I understand where he is coming from, my guests thought he was downright rude. Another, an older woman, likes to slam stuff onto your table, without saying a word. I'm sorry, I expect you to be nice to me. Maybe you could be more like the *runners* at Applebee's and tell me what you are putting in front of me and ask me if I want anything else. Sad that you don't even stack up to a food runner at Applebee's, a place that I'll never give an endorsement to. Stop giving me the cold shoulder. I'm not your enemy, in fact we have never met.  I understand Don & Charlie's for what it is. It is a restaurant that appeals to two crowds. One crowd is the elderly who want blander foods because they don't like the spices. I can understand that, and it's only fair they have a place to go. They go here because they know what they are going to get, have a great choice of early-bird specials, and will never get indigestion from spices. Old people tend to be incontinent anyhow, so they are likely to not notice the diarrhea they get afterward. The second group is tourists/people hosting tourists who go for the kitschy sports atmosphere, and accept that the food is less than average and or don't really care. Maybe some of these people aren't interested in quality and just think food is food. I have a buddy who swears it is the best steakhouse in town. He is also the same guy who eats Taco Bell, Applebee's, Outback, Etc. on a regular basis because they are the best places in town. There is something to be said for people with no taste buds, they are way easy to please!

d0nhpBxws5XmQahnbaC2hA.text: A must for the sports fan!  Who cares about food when there is sooooo much to see?!?! The food happens to be good so it's an added bonus.  Service is fabulous - but make a reservation!  Open seats in the bar are few & far between! Thank you, thank you Justin Green for your awesomeness!!!

q9KNe6t86CBaq9nvkMEUiQ.text: Wow....... This place is a sports memorabilia and steak lovers spot next to heaven!We,were at Don and Charlie's on a Tuesday evening. We called around 6:00 for an 8:00 reservation. It was a birthday celebration and also our first visit to the restaurant.  7:50.....we were in our seats. Our great waitress Haley..... promptly  took drink orders and made sure we received our first visit/complementary Parmesan toast. The menu was traditional steakhouse and didn't disappoint. Wedge salad.....Parmesan NY strip and blue cheese fillet mignon medallions along with creamed spinach were A-1. Bring your appetite to this place....... It compares to the top east coast steak spots. The topper was the birthday sundae. Two candles..... low key and just right to finish the evening. If you're in Scottsdale and a hungry baseball fan.......you have to hit Don and Charlie's...... Great food and great people.

GrD5kwknaKpcNbqLKgzzSg.text: I have been here a 1000 times.  Literally.  My grandparents loved this place and we used to go once a month.  The food is super consistent and the spicy BBQ sauce is the best I have ever had.  Don And Charlies is Chicago style BBQ located in the desert..  Killer food and the help is always super nice.  Every time I go back to AZ, I go here.  It rules.

Wc1Qphq_jeW5JFJbMVz2zg.text: Went there on a Sunday night during spring training.  Tip number 1 get a reservation any day while Spring training is going on or you will be waiting.  They have a great collection of memorabilia so waiting is not such a bad thing.   Tip number 2 get the "Carson" cut if you go with the prime rib, large portion really good.  We had 12 in our group, the prime rib was a hit and the Ribs were a bust!  Service was as good as it can be when every table is full.

l6SYwe3ApQXdUgvQQD3THA.text: A Rogers Park girl finds herself in Scottsdale AZ and where does she go?  Don & Charlies of course!  Wow, how exciting to walk into a place that models itself after places I grew up with.  The ambiance is second to none - the Chicago sports memorabilia is worth millions.  Totally what I had hoped.  Sadly, we caught Don & Charlies at the worst possible time ever.  Our reservation apparently happened just moments after the ASU football team showed up.  It was by far the worst service I have experienced in a long time.  One of my kids fell asleep waiting for his mac and cheese.  And I couldn't get a drink to save my life.  We sent back two of seven meals - and we are not the fussy food type.   I would give this restaurant a single star (because I am a sucker for Chicago memorabilia), but, I give it a second star because the manager was amazing - taking care of us even better than I could have hoped.  He was obviously embarrassed and apologetic.  I will try it again and hope the other reviewers got it right.   But, couldn't justify more than a couple of stars for tonight's dinner (I didn't eat).

u73ailIBy0IVeTf5puA48g.text: Classic American Steakhouse with a baseball twist! I have been a patron at Don & Charlie's since 1985 and has earned a status as one of legendary valley eateries. This famed spring training hangout is not just for the snowbirds or baseball fans in the spring. I have had some of the best meals during the summer season when the hype of spring training has faded.   Amongst the vast collection of baseball memorabilia is a great steakhouse. I have had a lot of fantastic meals and a few not so fantastic meals. Bottom line is that if something wasn't prepared to my liking the management and staff have been trained to please the customer. For that reason I will be a lifelong patron at Don & Charlies! Don Carson and his staff have hit a "grand slam!"

1C0jxGbTjyKv0BpEk1ZdCQ.text: The main reason to go to Don and Charlie's is the great atmosphere. If you are a sports fan then this is the place for you. The memorabilia is amazing. Every where you look there is something to do with sports. Great place during Spring Training. Food is good a decent steak and martini. Great blue cheese dressing.

6XTKsgB_zhwsXHmcbAKV-g.text: Five stars.  Great atmosphere, great service and great food.  Old school steak house that is informal.  Do  not go here for a romantic evening.  The entire place is covered is sports memorabilia.  Amazing.  FIrst Course....Checked in on Yelp and got a free appetizer.  Ordered the cheese toast... boring right?  No... VERY GOOD.. highly recommend.  Second course, ordered the cole slaw.  Saw they had a section and the menu and was intrigued.  They serve it before the meal like soup or salad.
