The beer selection could use some improvement but I didn't go there to drink. Next time I am back in Scottsdale this will be my first stop for dinner!

f1zMQcJYbfyKHeixkbEaEA.text: I brought 4 friends at 5pm yesterday to celebrate my birthday after bragging to them about how great the place was. I'm an Arizona resident and my friends were in from Vegas. Very disappointed. Asked to be seated in dining room after another patron offered his dining room reservation to us because he heard it was my birthday. He was told by the manager it would be "No problem" and then the manager puts us in the bar area anyway near the door at a table that was very cramped for 6 people. Then sits a party of 2 in the large booth right behind us after we sit down. Pretty obvious that regular customers get preferential treatment by the manager. The gentleman who offered us his dining room reservation wasn't very happy that the manager told him "no problem" about accommodating us and then not coming through. Food was good and wait staff were excellent.

T-WYl_8nre3i_TpEjRu4UA.text: This was my first return visit to Don & Charlie's in almost 10 years.  Typically I get their ribs (world's best) but decided on a steak.  The steak was cooked to perfection and juicy as can be.  They serve bagel crisps prior to the meal.  The only thing that changed is the chopped liver that used to be included is now an appetizer.  Although it is good, the meal is the reason to keep me returning.  The atmosphere is a sports lovers dream.  There is memorabilia from every major league sport lining the walls and the ceilings.  The hostess and wait staff are very attentive too.

s-p7OWYMDKy6A3in0tzY-A.text: I went to D & C the other day for Restaurant week.   I went years ago but this time took my mom and her husband there.  The deal was great for restaurant week and I ordered the ribs and I know that's what they are known for and expected the best rib's I have ever had.   The ribs were extremely tough and did not fall off the bone.  The atmosphere was great and it's certainly a fun place with plenty of history.   But I have no idea how they can call these the best rib's. The rib's I buy from the supermarket tasted better.  Very disappointed and really hated to give these guys a bad review.

yrpyUauIzXQwss7Ld25Bbg.text: Had a great dinner with my buddies! Staff was friendly, food was perfect and they got us in and out efficiently even though they were absolutely slammed!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Me and the Sayhey Kid

v3E9Bl4mjYiCiGyDoNhrTw.text: The Food is good I really enjoy the Ribs and Chicken Snitchel, The sauce is very tasty, the bread is good, and the Steak fries our very good. I'd give this place 2 extra stars but the staff is very rude they treat me and my wife like all these Gypsy people that live in the Chandler and Gilbert area, the staff also have a real problem if you table hop which I find ridiculous your not even allot to talk to your friends and family that dine in this restaurant, and the atmosphere is very dark and Noisy. I'd expect a place like this to be very quiet. Another problem I have is the valet only takes cash they do not  accept Credit or Debit Cards which is really annoying.  The Only reason I come to this restaurant is for the food or otherwise I would not return because the staff are real pigs.

3ScRpH3i73hZg6kPtWhvIA.text: Not good experience. Ordered a steak sandwich medium. Came out well done and top half of a bun. What kind of sandwich is that?  Another guy in group ordered steak med rare. Came out rare if not worse. had to send it back two more times to get it right.  Now the manager was concerned about mine but I couldn't eat mine lost my appetite. He did not charge me for mine.   Sports memorabilia is quite impressive. Must top to see the collection

faP7HeJhjD0LsSwZqXHZPg.text: This is one of our family's favorite restaurants!!!  The menu has a variety of choices that we like to pick from-prime rib, baby back ribs, trout, etc. Everything we have ordered had been good and they always check to make sure we are happy with our food.  Ask for Donna - she's really funny and patient.  She really understands our family's quirks. The desserts are really hard to choose from so either order several for the table to share or go back multiple times like we have and try them all. The hot fudge sauce served on the side with the ice cream is my husband's favorite-he'd order it separately if he could!!

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate cake

g8ao41CgVdMSe8JQ9Hgxeg.text: Don & Charlie's is kinda like comfy old pair of shoes. You slip in and are immediately at ease. It's not pretentious and certainly has marked its standing among the finicky crowd of Old Town. In fact, it reminds me of Frasher's but all love for Chicago rather than St. Louis. You can feast your eyes on every type of sports memorabilia so it's like stepping into a museum of goodies. I have to admit it is geared towards your mature active adults, such that you might find yourself amidst the heated debate between councilmen or City of Scottsdale employees ranting as to why this is the most livable city!   I don't disagree with the most recent Yelp reviews. The food isn't amazing, nor will it knock it out of the park. They do serve schnitzel.; burgers are stacked high and salads are generous in portion. The price tag certainly doesn't justify me choosing this over Wildfish or Ruth's Chris. But if you are looking for low key vibe, chill with the power players of Scottsdale, or missing a piece of Chicago, grab a seat and take it all in.

QJNZzeP3xcMveQi1q-AkRw.text: We had a lovely evening in this vintage Scottsdale steakhouse.  We went for my bff's birthday. The service was amazing, yet unobtrusive.  Niko,  our waiter took stellar care of us. The food was delicious. I highly recommend this institution in the Scottsdale culinary scene! Thank you D&C!

83Q-PemJoainuEKYNwhKMA.text: Hadn't been here in a while.....wonderful time w / the family ! Promptly seated; our waitress informed us it was her first ( supervised ) day on the job....would've never known. Great service ; all our meals were prepared to our specs.....best steak sand I've had in a long time. Needless to say , we'll be back ( probably after Spring Training , when things settle down in Old Town Scottsdale )......Come to think of it, I used to play here in the 70's when it was The New London Co. .....worked for singer Michael Collins, a Scottsdale icon !

aaLQnuQ9uu4njliPh5ZrKA.text: I've eaten here for years.  Service used to be great.  I'm done now.  Inept (to put it mildly - and I ALWAYS eat at the bar) bartender overcharged us  $139 (someone else's tab) for broasted chicken.  Bartender couldn't figure out how to void the transaction...  Hello,  Not acceptable.  Way substandard experience.  I'm through cutting D&C's slack.

szqsk4sRLLpjkp2wp1kEtQ.text: I ate here because I had a $50 gift certificate which was great because my meal cost me $100! I asked the waitress for the best steak they had and she brought me a garlic steak. Honestly, a little underwhelming. The steak didn't have a tremendous amount of taste, even with all the garlic. I was really surprised. I also got a couple cocktails and some dessert. The dessert was awesome. Creme brule and it was really amazing. Cocktails were solid also but my steak, and this is a steakhouse wasn't all that.

GTJDnCu4dysFVd5iMWZ6sQ.text: Was taken last night for my Birthday by two friends and we had a wonderful time and delicious dinners.  They shared the large rib plate.  I had the parmesan crusted steak - delicious.  Our waitress, Stephanie, was really fantastic - friendly, helpful, attentive without hovering, and very efficient and professional.  Sad to see the restaurant closing.  Only complaint was it got very loud as more and more diners came in.

Q3KO4duFmPkSpesPpnFjOQ.text: What can I say? Fantastic ribs, the onion strings area amazing and the service was incredible! I forgot how good this place was!!

m1W2gxn8_ra9uahW4N95xA.text: Friends and I were in Scottsdale for Barrett Jackson.  We wanted a good steak and saw the reviews for Don and Charlie's. My friend told the server he wanted his steak we'll done, so what cut of meat would she recommend.  She told him she could not recommend anything because they didn't recommend steak to be cooked well done.  She again said she couldn't recommend anything.  It was obvious she has not been trained to help her customer.  Then when it came to my order, I told her I wanted it med well, pink in the center, but not red u der any circumstance.  She told me with med well, I would not have any pink.  While waiting for our  meal, she never came back to see if we needed any refill so  water or more drinks.  The meals came. My friend that wanted his well done was pink inside.  Mine came bloody red.  We had to hunt our server down because again, she did not come back to see how our meal was.  Another server found her at the bar talking with someone and sent her over.  I showed her my bloody red steak and she took it back, not acknowledging my friends.  By the time my steak came back the rest of the party was almost finished eating.  I was only able to eat around the edges because the center was still red.  Both of us who had filets were extremely disappointed. No flavor, not cooked at all like we had requested.  I have had steak that cost a quarter of the cost of the steaks at Don and Charlie's and much better in taste and were able to be cooked to perfection. Our server was awful! Again, did not offer refills on drinks and did not offer any dessert or coffe.  Would not recommend this establishment!!!

c3vlJqBRQ-lRMfe4sIFa3w.text: Well you can guarantee one thing here - that they do have the best collection of baseball and football stuff I have ever seen. It is worth a trip to see all of it, but the Red Sox jersey in front of the ladies room needs to go. Most of the food was hit and miss, but it all is about Chicago this and Chicago that. RIBS - by far do not order the charred style unless you really like eating a burnt hunk of ribs. The regular style was way better, but both were nowhere close to the best ribs ever, not by a longshot. These don't strip off the bone which is what I prefer.  SIDES - redskin mashed potatoes not good and cole slaw was cold and crisp, but not top notch. APPS - the spinach Artichoke Dip was chunky and good and served with great chips SERVICE - very professional, except when they overcharged us 66 bucks (corrected)  It seems like if you have been going here for years, you don't go anywhere else, but I won't be back for anything really. If your famous for ribs and they are average, then it's case closed.  Free birthday sundae was a nice after thought and the Wedge salad was also decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. better regular
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charred = burnt

dEnAGUYAqVCappdbblAk8g.text: I brought a party of eight to Don and Charlie's right after Christmas for a celebratory dinner (one of our eight was retiring) and was very happy! I'd been maybe 4-5 times before and one of my friend had been a couple of times as well, but none of the other six (three couples, plus another two individuals).  I love a good, old-fashioned steakhouse that doesn't take itself too seriously (no tuxedos, etc.), but that also delivers an excellent meal. While Don and Charlies isn't inexpensive, you could certainly spend a lot more for a similar meal at some of the "bigger" steak houses (chains and otherwise). I've never liked the a la carte aspect of the "fancier" places. Don and Charlies doesn't do that.  My steak, the New York with the parmesan crust, was fabulous. While I liked the preparation with the parmesan, the steak was the star. Excellent and perfectly prepared. Everyone around the table was more than happy with their food.  Highly recommended.

PboCwEXh7U62t493JLs7QQ.text: If you're a baseball fan with an affinity for memorabilia, Don & Charlie's is your place. Excellent food aside, this restaurant has one of the most comprehensive collections I've ever seen. D&C's features delicious barbecue, prime steaks, seafood, and American comfort food. The menu is straightforward and the food is thoughtfully prepared.  Great service, and a full bar make D &C's a real home run! A Scottsdale must try!!

awZHOwb_5cOMk5QoBLTI8A.text: Went with a group of friends Friday to  celebrate some Birthdays. First off ,we were lucky enough to be sat in Pam's section , what a delight she was , great sense of humor , very knowledgeable and quite friendly ! We had the delicious coconut shrimp to start , the amazing ribeye, and the moist and juicy broasted  chicken . Wow we also ordered the creme brulee for dessert and they treated since it was our Bday . What a nice surprise ! We will be going there again soon.

jph16RPIUOSHsnM8vqqeMA.text: One of my favorite places I've been to in AZ. Fun with a group or special occasion. Pretty pricey but the quality is good.

Yxl99092kfMYY0loU4zR1A.text: Fun place w/ so much sports paraphernalia you don't know where to look! Kids portions enormous. Had both types of ribs and the bbq chicken-all good. Best baked potato I've ever had-seasoned skin and super soft! Fries like five guys (according to my kids). Banana cream pie and chocolate cake yummy.

IZuEDi_XHqPf5RvvJ4RLWA.text: Went on 8/13 w a party of 10+ for a bday dinner. Whoever 202 Server S is she was patient and amazing! We had 9pm reservations but arrived late and they were closing at 9:30pm so we were worried we wouldn't get sat. Out waitress didn't rush us or anything! Then we had MORE folks come late and the restaurant was so accommodating! Shrimp scampi tastes wonderful! We will me back. Thanks for a great experience.

GNfYlCkVIFBKHKTtx9SaWg.text: Can't say enough about quality, abundance and welcoming service for the Jewish New Years Roshashana dinner.  Food Super delicious even better than  Bubbie used to make.  Every course delicious and so much food.  Please relax and go with your family For a terrific no sweat Holiday Dinner  Will be our new year Tradition.

1nZtdKF3aybhs-I5CgKwfg.text: On Recommendation from a friend we tried this out at 5 PM and got in easily on a Friday night. The steak was expensive but amazing and worth it. The appetizer was yummy and the creme brulee with dark chocolate on the bottom was delightful

P-3Dyz3DTq5ANtOgmPCLiw.text: I've been going to Scottsdale for Spring Training for 7 years. Just before I left, my buddies Dad a huge fellow Giants fan asked me if I'd been to Don and Charlie's. I said I had not, and he looked at me like I was an alien from Neptune. Apparently, it's like visiting SF and not going to or knowing about Alcatraz. Place is a freaking institution! So, my buddy and I broke away from our large group of 16 and tried to sneak in for a steak dinner on Saturday night. Nothing doing, the place was booked SOLID. Apparently Willie Mays was in the house signing his book. Willie Freakin Mays! When the lady at the check in name dropped Willie, I said "oh I love Willie Nelson, he's here?" She corrected me and got the joke. So, with a little smile she let my buddy and I know we could be served at the bar on a first come first served basis. Well, guess what we totally lucked out! The place was spilling over with baseball fans and celebs alike. Hey is that Ray Fosse?!? We were able to grab two bar seats as a couple was finishing up!  So, my buddy and I sat at the bar and had one of the greatest steak dinners ever while surrounded by literally millions of dollars worth of sports memorabilia. Our bartender Shelly was an absolute class act! She set up our table, introduced herself and even remembered our names in what was truly a challenging environment. Now, the food was crazy good and reasonably priced for a nice steakhouse. I had a 16 oz NY Strip ($43) with char crust, au gratin potatoes and washed it all down with a bottle of Malbec $(33). Just as I was done ordering a local sitting next to us noticed it was our first trip. He yelled over, "Shelly tell them to get the burnt onions." Shelly explained they caramelize onions on the grill while bathed in A1 steak sauce which pairs nicely with the steak. Of course I jumped on the suggestion and I was very glad I did. The onions with the steak were heavenly.! My buddy had essentially the same meal but had a 12 oz filet which was also cooked to perfection.   I will surly make Don and Charlie's my first reservation when I book a trip to Scottsdale. And if someone tells me they go to Scottsdale regularly and they haven't been there I will look at them like they're an alien from Neptune.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 16 oz NY Strip cooked to perfection with Char Crust and au gratin potatoes!

WcnuJCG9_UYToIvkeQ9n6A.text: A MUST for sports fans. If you`re in town for Spring Training, you owe it to yourself to try this place. Very casual, great food and an awesome collection of sports memorabilia displayed all over the place. Get there early during Spring Training as there will be a wait. But very much worth it!

NZbD8bxYsEypBpxfUwUpDg.text: I have been to this old town Scottsdale staple a number of times and got lucky the first time when Mary waited on us.   Clearly a veteran to the service industry, she's what is sadly the exception to the norm in Scottsdale when it comes to impeccable service.  The prime rib with creamy horseradish is perfect and I haven't had a side item here I didn't love. There isn't a better shrimp cocktail / house made cocktail sauce in town.   The ambiance could use some updating and they do have a patio which appears to serve no purpose, but the walls are plastered with sports memorabilia and pictures of all the people who have had a meal there.  It's classy and upscale but not too pretentious like you might feel sometimes in other fine dining establishments. I will request Mary every time I go and you should too!

AVsI-XZ0ezMJ58FbCNxKfg.text: Classic 80's restaurant vibe with an old exterior, but don't be fooled. Great service and they keep the kitchen open late if you arrive late. I got the ribs and mashed potatoes and they were awesome . if you're a sports fan, check out the cool sports memorabilia they have all over their walls!  Old town parking can suck and they have valet!

hqLDFYMIy47TuTP2Fc9YoA.text: I would have given them a higher rating but due to the managers poor service I cannot! The family went there for my husband's 60th birthday. He ordered the ribeye. The waitress said people rave about it. When he got the steak, every piece he cut was fatty. He NEVER complains but he was very disappointed so he gently asked she take it back. The waitress was very apologetic and asked if he would like something else, but he didn't. At this point he didn't want anything else, the waitress said the manager would come over. Let me say our waitress Stephani was VERY good, however the manager Corrina has some of the WORST customer service I have experienced! She never came.  I told Stephanie she never came by. She had even just walked by our table, but walked right by. I requested to speak to her. She was full of excuses why she didn't stop by, she was the only manager on, she normally touches every table.....I said as the manager I would think she would definitely stop by tables that had a problem, so apparently there were a lot of problems. There apparently were not problems elsewhere just more excuses. Overall, it was a very disappointing experience due to extremely poor management. We hope others looking to celebrate a special occasion have a better experience!

ot0-oXGNJC0ib0iSXFjzcw.text: This is an amazing old school steakhouse! Great food, great service, great memorabilia and vintage steakhouse ambience!  Niko our server was attentive, knowledgeable and extremely personable!  You would miss a great culinary experience of you don't eat here!

E81uEK8BxMjKf2AEFndvFA.text: This place is literally awesome.  It's the only restaurant I've ever been to at which waiting for a table is a pleasure.  It's like a sports museum inside.  A person could spend several hours simply looking at the memorabilia.  And the food and service are outstanding.  I would visit this place any time I'm in Phoenix.

ROGvLTYUXrytfYW6rDOnww.text: Don & Charlie's is a great place for sports fans to enjoy a good meal and see sports celebrities. The food is good and the beer is cold. Unfortunately this well know establishment will be closing down to make room for condos.

4QZHe5O5WhQsAHMGSu1JIQ.text: Ordered a NY steak sandwich medium rare for $25. Was served a medium to medium well NY steak with half a piece of garlic bread... on the side. Asked why it wasn't a sandwich  and was informed that it's served open-faced. That was not an open faced sandwich. Server offered to take the steak back and re-do because it wasn't medium rare. I declined because it was really busy and didn't want to wait. Baked potato was good. Service is pretty good and this place has been around forever with many loyal customers but I didn't experience much value this visit and not in a hurry to return.  Update: Updated from 3 stars to 4 today. Was contacted by Don at Don & Charley's and  invited back for another experience. Appreciate the effort.

OLF3cJUDkEHynJx5jNKb4A.text: Finally made it to this landmark steakhouse.  Went on Monday night in March of Spring Training at 5:00 and still couldn't get a table but my wife and I ate at the bar and had a great time.  Great food and amazing memorabilia.  I

QMvEHtE1RDWJCVVPjiRijw.text: Went there tonight only because I had a gift certificate and it's the only LEY restaurant in the area. The waiter was a joke. He thought he was funny and he was simply insulting. After cocktails we told him we wanted to order wine with dinner. He told us nothing about the menu and after we finished ordering he explained that we ordered incorrectly - salads and sides were included and not ala carte (the bill said otherwise, but by that time we had given up).  A server brought our entrees and we asked him to get our waiter so we could order wine. Then a woman showed up  (management?) and took our wine order. When she returned with the bottle our waiter came by to tell us that we mumbled our wine order so he didn't understand. I replied that he never even asked for our wine order. The guy was an ass. Eventually waiter returns, apologizes insincerely, and says he's buying our wine.  Our steaks were medium and we ordered med-rare.   Place is rundown, noisy, and unfriendly.  Martini was excellent.

WCf4yvEfTSIftGIftMqX_A.text: Always have great service and amazing food. The atmosphere and experience is one of a kind. Always make a reservation!

E9SsW0fwLZkOEl9wCqG7yg.text: Love this place! Atmosphere great with tons of amazing baseball memorabilia. Filet with shrimp scampi and ribs perfect. Can't wait to go back

5pNFJuuufL4cql3IDcQe6Q.text: Cool place.  Lots of sports memorabilia to see! Great food and service.  Must see in Scottsdale!

AoZ3zKwE1RXKqslNu-Ugug.text: Short ribs out of this world. Ribs great. Filet magnificent. Great service. Classic place.

f089HbjBFLiQL2t5sCje2A.text: We had just arrived in town and were staying at a hotel across the street. They recommended this restaurant so we decided to give it a try. The place was packed. The host said that the dining room was full, but if we waited in the bar, we might be able to get a table there in about 45 minutes. The only open spot in the bar was in a dark corner with no lights. We got a drink and sat down to wait. After a few minutes, an older gentleman in a blue sweater walked by and asked us why we were sitting in the dark. We told him that it was the only place available for us to wait. Thinking he was a regular patron, my wife asked him what one had to do to get a table there. He replied that he would go see, and he asked our name. Then he wandered off. Five minutes later, we had a table in the dining room!  When we asked our waitress who the older gentleman in the blue sweater was, she relied, "oh, that's Don...he's the owner."  For me, that would have been enough by itself for a five-star review, but the best was yet to come. We both tried the baby back ribs, prepared Don's way, and they were delicious. The sides were equally as good, and the service was excellent. Next time we visit Scottsdale, we will eat here again. We highly recommend this restaurant, but make a reservation!

B9i8UScBGfLud4xd3f0gFg.text: A friend introduced me to this place maybe a year ago, and it is amazing! In my opinion they have the best ribs in the valley, the steaks are great and I crave the the creamy cole slaw all the time. Servers are always attentive without being annoying. I wish they had a bigger beer selection but that is a minor nit-pick.  I highly recommend Don & Charlie's.

pl4o46ic5EtDSXPjHdQr3w.text: We came here for my daughter's and niece's birthday. We've been coming here and used to be really regular but haven't been here for awhile. So we decided D&C's was the place to go this time.   I just love this place because of the atmosphere and the decor. It's all about sports. Baseball, football, jersey, helmets, and pictures all over the place. If you love sports then this is the place for you. The place is always busy and the table are always close to each other. If you get a table in the middle of the dinning room then there is hardly no walking room. This is all part of the experience.   We had the fried calamari and cheese bread for appetizers. The calamari had a nice crust  and crispy. It was pretty good with the tomato sauce. The cheese bread was good and cheesy. Overall, the appetizers were okay.   We all had the clam chowder and it was pretty good for our area but can't be compared to SF. So I had the full rack of baby back ribs. My wife had a half rack of baby back ribs with coconut shrimp and my kids had the cuda cut prime ribs. The baby back ribs were very good. Mouth watering and the meat would just fall off the ribs. The shrimp were huge and were really good. Prime rib was gobbled up. I also had a double baked potato. So overall the dinner was really good.   So if you have a chance to try this place. Enjoy and have fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Baby back ribs and coconut shrimp
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Full rack of baby back ribs
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Trout

QthwioggDNTM4J3LMfZv_A.text: Excellent. Just go. I see a lot of reviews suggesting it is a tourist trap. Definitely not. Great food, great service, great sports memorabilia. I love the strip George Will style - charred. If you are undecided on which bbq sauce, just ask for both on the side. I still can't decide which is best. If you sit in the bar they have the best bartender in town. Also, the Bud Selig is actually very good tho not a "high end" entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. MLB Spring Training - 4 deep @ the bar!

zL41z9QzUk8qSXzogBgIrA.text: This is a staple restaurant in Scottsdale. If you love sports it's a must visit. The walls are full of everything sports. The food was amazing. And the service was welcoming and knowledgeable of the menu. I would visit again.

BleRfyT5J3AkSGhNozub9A.text: Coming to Don and Charlie's is a tradition when you come to Scottsdale, especially for baseball fans.  The place is covered in sports memorabilia and last time I was there, my friends recognized a retired Dodgers player.  They have amazing options and just grabbing a drink to feel the ambiance is great too, even if you're not a sports fan!

5fIecNtx-irtsE-0nGf0Vg.text: Service is great!  Food is delicious. Atmosphere is a bit loud due to the open area seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Open seating area with over-the-top sports memorabilia.

CTYMRBqW_g4lR7wjcQiWOQ.text: I ordered via Uber Eats. Never again. My burger/buns was cold, NO condiments, napkins and plastic ware. They charged $6.99 for a quarter head of lettuce for my wedge salad.

0dz8okRvcpx3JRLRytWqTA.text: What a nice restaurant.   And it was full of nice people.....    in the middle of June!   They didn't have it freezing cold in there with fans blowing and there wasn't any bad loud music screeching and yelling through the sound system.    You can actually have a conversation with your party.   I've eaten here many times over the years and the food and service are still top notch.

HPuUATz0r3bUBTGghKIEpA.text: This was my first time here at the recommendation from the friends we were with and it was also restaurant week. I didn't partake in it but boyfriend did.  The place is a huge memorabilia center...and its full of old people. We were the youngest people there, but I don't think that's a downfall...just funny.  Most people are aware of how restaurant week works - 3 courses usually ranging from $30-$40 on a fixed menu. You also receive a free app when you check in- either the cheesy garlic bread or the onion straws.   One thing I think is a rip off when you do restaurant week with these guys is that if you are two people ordering the restaurant week, you only get one app between the two of you - yet you still pay $30 each. The food is plentiful, but I just don't think that's fair. 4 people out of the 6 ordered from the restaurant week menu and I had the free app so we had the onion straws, cheesy garlic bread, and the spinach dip. The onion straws were bland, the bread was good, and the dip was good.  Boyfriend had the prime rib with the twice baked potato, friends had the ribs with the twice baked potato and another the salmon. All came with cole slaw, either deli (vinegary with a kick) style or creamy (more traditional in my mind). Prime rib was good, not the best, salmon seemed ok from what she told me, and everyone agreed the ribs were the best. The twice baked was yummy (how can you go wrong with baked potato loaded with cheese?  My other friend and I had the french onion soup and the wedge salad. The soup was bland was really pisses me off...this isn't just to this restaurant, its to all. I am not a huge salter, I am very conservative with how I use salt, so for me to go to a restaurant and think something is bland means that it was WAY under seasoned. The salad was good but again, how can you go wrong with something so simple? The portion was huge so boyfriend and I shared that.  I think the real kicked with all of this was the price of the bill. It was $90 per couple including tip which on a regular date night I wouldn't think about, but from what everyone said I was expecting it to be more of a deal and better food. I think anyone is always upset when they don't get what they expect and have to pay a good amount for it.  I would go back here again, but maybe not for dinner, maybe for happy hour or just a couple apps or something. I hate giving bad reviews, and really tried to look on the bright side of our experience and that's why I settled in the middle with three stars.

NFWS-hjElW8-FjccLwvf8g.text: How can you not love this place. For quality food, this is the best value restaurant in Scottsdale. Best Ribs best cole slaw best service. Everything is delicious.

j2gwFKvuaw5Z4yXCcM3TXQ.text: Don and Charlie's is the epitome of an old school Chicago char-house. The sports memorabilia on the walls and pictures of celebrities that ate at the restaurant add to the authentic ambiance. The food was delicious and reminded me of home. The chopped liver plate is a must have for an appetizer. The BBQ baby back ribs were awesome and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BBQ baby back ribs, loaded baked potatoe, and baked mac n cheese
Photo of Don & Charlie's - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chopped liver plate

RYW9BJUNbHlW7-PB5KzMlw.text: What a cool place.  If you're a sports fan, but still enjoy a relaxed, casual setting without all the noise, and craziness of a typical sports bar, this is the place to go.  Sports memorabilia everywhere.  Over 900 autographed, and glass encased baseballs, line the walls.  Jerseys, bats, pictures, banners, and pennants all over the place.  Now, Laura, the awesome waitress who waited on us Friday night, told me this is a "San Francisco Giants" bar/restaurant.  My first reaction, being from Los Angeles and a huge Dodgers fan, was to high-tail it outta there!  But, I got over it and enjoyed our wonderful food.  We shared the fried onion appetizer (check in on yelp and they're free!!).  Real tasty...and huge! (kinda like me hahaha).  Crispy, hot, and seasoned really nicely.  My wife had the ribs with au-gratin potatoes and mayo-based coleslaw (which she said was the best coleslaw she's ever had.  She seemed to really enjoy her meal.  I had the chicken breast smothered in spinach and mushrooms with a very tasty herb-garlic butter sauce.  I didn't care for my coleslaw though.  I chose the vinegar-based slaw.  Over all it was a great dining experience.  We even ran into an old friend.  P.S. - Try to sit in Laura's section.  She's super cool and sweet.  Riiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiight?

GbHKw2kE8agljNd9M9sP_A.text: D&C could really use the advice of an expert chef to re-vitalize a tired menu. My New York strip was ok, but not great. For $45 I expected to be blown away, but wasn't. The Caesar salad was good, but nothing spectacular. Baked potato - well, what else could they do? So the steak - it was too thick to cook properly. To get the inside to a medium, the outside was overdone, crunchy...."Char" is not appetizing. Staff was great, as was the atmosphere. But they really need to look at a 40-50 year old menu and bring it up to date. There are better choices in the area if you're looking for a steak.

Iw7l1vIhwcvPcu-1o0Sbtw.text: Had a great time at Don & Charlies this past weekend. It was my nephew's wedding rehearsal dinner in a room that did a nice job of seating about 100 people. The food was good, but the staff was really amazing.   The servers included Sam, Donna, Christine, Ana Leslie, and Pam. So appreciative of the remarkable job they all did. It's hard to believe that they were able to serve such a large group so well. These guys really know how to do a large group!  So let's talk about the food. The meal started with what I understand is a staple at Don & Charlie's: chopped liver. It was pretty decent chopped liver, but it's hard to get rave reviews from me because my wife's chopped liver is widely believed to be the best in the world. The cheese toast was also pretty darn good and served really hot which, in my opinion, is a must for really good cheese bread.    Our meal included of a choice of salad which included a tossed salad, Cole slaw or potato salad. I choose the Cole slaw and assumed it would be on the side, since I have never had it served as a starter (like a basic tossed salad) but, nope, they serve it before the entree just like a green salad. A little strange to me, but, hell, these guys are entitled to do it any way they want to do it.   Our group had a choice of four different entrees: prime rib, salmon, chicken, or BBQ baby back ribs (I did the ribs, of course). But since it was a family event, I had no problem finding someone to share the other three entrees so I'm here to tell you, all four entrees were damn good. There was nothing unusual about the preparation or particularly creative about their plate presentation. It's just a bunch of good, tasty food served to be chowed. And I definitely chowed! The prime rib was awesome. I love going to Lawry's Prime Rib for killer prime rib, and I gotta say this was some really good prime rib.   The hot fudge sundae was a nice way to finish the meal but I gotta be honest, I was way too full to enjoy it. Although, I did eat most of it! I like the way they serve the hot fudge and whipped cream in separate little serving pieces. It helps keep the ice cream from turning to soup and you can adjust the ice cream, syrup, whipped cream ratio to exactly what you like.  I gotta mention the memorabilia that adorns just about every wall in the place from floor to ceiling. I heard it's all been given the the owner Don, which is not hard to believe since most of it appears to have been signed with a personal note to Don. The guy certainly has received autographed memorabilia from just about everybody. He's even got a baseball signed by Babe Ruth stashed in there, the first one I've ever seen.  Pretty cool place with generous portions of pretty tasty food.

GtfxN-lopDtfNo-2kHtImw.text: Just finished a wonderful evening at Don & Charlies.  The food was cooked to perfection.  Biggest baked potato I have ever had.  Steak was ordered rare and it was cooked rare.  Not always the case at some restaurants.  Our server, Cooper, was top notch.  Only complaint....wasn't able to see all the sports memorabilia.  There is a lot.  .

z28DRf9Z9lV-P6NteoodFA.text: Love the food and the service is perfect. We always ask for Donna. She knows exactly what we like. Don Carson sure knows how to run a restaurant!! We love it here!

xPlJrl6AA0371PzownInJA.text: Pretty good. Wasn't amazed by the food but it was solid did the trick for sure. The staff and service was very friendly and good.   To mgmt: You guys should get a new sign. That faded one you have on the street does a disservice to the restaurant. A new cleaner one would help draw in customers

hA30uVdRyfXJvIpp5aRsHg.text: Over the years I've been to Don & Charlie's MANY times.  It's once of my Dad's favorites, which is exactly why, when tasked with arranging a birthday celebration for him, I chose Don & Charlies.  The food here is solid.  I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had, but it is satisfying every time I am here.  The best part of this place, in my opinion, is the service and the ambiance.  This is truly a "guys place," filled with sports memorabilia... a guys dream.  Wherever you sit, just above your head could be a picture of your favorite athlete, from any sport... that's pretty cool.  This past time we were here, the food was spot on as always for our party of seven.  Everyone enjoyed their LARGE portions and tasty choices.  Our server was AWESOME... he even made a connection with my sister for his upcoming move out to LA.  His attention to detail and cheerful, fun attitude surly made the night that much more special.  I know I didn't talk much about the food, but the fact is you can't go wrong here.  Don't expect a trendy, upscale dining experience, but you will have a night to remember!  Enjoy!

2xgq2v1j4IDkfc1PtAPJNQ.text: The restaurant has a plethora of sports memorabilia that overwhelms its walls. The good news is, it's popular. The bad news is, it's popular. Despite a reservation, we had to wait 30 minutes. They don't have a waiting room, just a sports museum type of long entryway with a very low-hanging ceiling. With a ton of people in the entryway, it started to get very claustrophobic. Once seated, the owner came by and introduced himself. Not sure if it was just because he knew a guy in our party or not, but nevertheless, he was very nice and funny. The waitress had been there for 9 years and was very knowledgable and held good conversation with the table.   As for the menu, it was pretty pricey. I got a burger for $13 because the cheapest steak was a ground beef for I want to say $19. Pretty pricey all around. My burger was typical, big and tasty. I also tried my buddy's fried chicken, which was awesome. All around the table, the portions were huge. There were several to go boxes at our table.  Forgot to mention, MLB commissioner Bud Selig, who has a steak named after him on the menu, came in to dine that night. It was the end of spring training and I'm not sure how often he comes in, but for any sports fan, it's got to be a great endorsement for a place that worships the game of baseball on its walls. Overall, it was a good atmosphere that would make the price worth it on occasion, if I were a resident of Scottsdale.

7dRU_-FTB0-TMLjZMpV5lw.text: There a lot of English reviews so I'll write this in Italian for people of my country.   La migliore bistecca mai mangiata.  La prime rib e eccellente, eccellente.   L'atmosfera e stupenda, luci basse e parrei coperte da cimeli sportivi, specialmente baseball.  Il servizio e qualificato, educato, allegro. Sembra di stare in famiglia.   Ancora una volta, il cibo e divino.  Andate, andate, andate.

x3ljxK3l4j6GkY0SkHSTAA.text: Not really impressed sadly. It was my first time and I have wanted to try Don and Charlie's for years and just never made it over. The food was good but not great. We started with the calamari which wasn't hot, it was barely room temperature. The ribs were good but I have had better at a much more reasonable price. My date had a filet and said it was good. We split the creme brule for desert and it was really good. I sat at the bar while waiting for my date to arrive and the bartender was wonderful. Friendly, fast, and made one hell of a drink! I probably would not go out of my way to go but wouldn't complain if someone picked it either.

j_hBLbCojIFxoxg9FTj7lg.text: Went back to Don and Charlie's for dinner the other night while I was in Scottsdale.  It's been a year since I was last here, but the quality of the food and the service are still top notch.  I discovered that when I checked-into Yelp I received a free appetizer, so I opted for the garlic cheese toast, which was awesome.  The ciabatta was toasted perfectly and if I hadn't thought about not finishing the rest of my meal, I would have eaten all of it.  However, I  managed to eat over half the basket.  I ordered the spicy broasted chicken and had to order their two awesome sides (creamy cole slaw and garlic mashed potatoes.  The skin of the chicken was crispy and the meat was both moist and tender.  The spice was perfect (a little heat, but mostly excellent flavor).  This quite possibly was the best fried (broasted) chicken I've ever had.  Plus, they give you 1/2 a chicken and even the white meat was extremely tender.  All I can say is "Wow".    I again surveyed and admired all the memorabilia inside the restaurant, while watching the Western Conference NHL Playoffs.  My server (Jaime) was very attentive and offered excellent recommendations for my meal.  Needless to say, I enjoyed another great meal here.

x3ZbIgm48InVqHkeGPfeFQ.text: My wife and I go here every few weeks. Everyone is friendly and the food is great. It's also a good value and the bartender now called me by name we like the bar area as it's like home town on some nights durning the week. Tonight our experience was really great and Ginger our waitress made us feel special and was very attentive to us. We plan to go to dinner lots here over the next few years I'm working in the area, thanks!!

it0fCVndoUJ7Fn9L0EOBOA.text: The wait was unexpected at such an early hour of the evening. 5:00pm, but then I noticed everyone was probably coming from the same game we got out of 25minutes earlier...     They have gigantic tables in the restaurant, so it feels a little bit crammed; however, you can not pay for the busy buzz the restaurant has to it...I thoroughly enjoy a restaurant that is loud with laughter and chatter.  The server had ZERO personality and had blinders on. He never looked any of us in the eye or made us feel relaxed.    I ordered the burger with fries and then noticed it was $14.00. It was ordered Med-rare w/ cheddar. I received a Well done burger with American no lettuce, tomato, onion, or mayo... The server rushed by and I could not get his attention so I grabbed the girl who helped him bring out the trays. She was at the podium next to the manager when I explained it to her, so it was taken care of very quickly; yet, the burger just didn't taste that good...There was not much seasoning or flavor to the burger...It was just a big chunk of ground beef grilled...boring...     I gave two stars because the others at our table enjoyed the food. Service sucked, but whatever, it's his tip...Just don't get the burger, it's a $14 lump of $***

0gEbdjuwTZQDhBFFSM9Ozg.text: Since I'm pregnant, ordering steak isn't the same when I can't have it the way I want-medium rare. So I opted the pork chop and it was very good. Mashed potatoes on the side which were fantastic and their cole slaw was sensational. I highly recommend the fresh, not creamy, option. Some of the best cole slaw I've had! I thought it was an enjoyable restaurant.

h6oVgOQFX-6qha2wXCxPrw.text: First time to Don and Charlie's was great! The wait was not what I was expecting from the reviews here. We were seated within 5 mins of arriving for our reservation. Our server was great. He did not come by to much but enough that we always knew if we needed anything we would not have to wait.  I had the prime rib medium rare and my wife had the filet medium. Both cuts were cooked perfectly. I am a bit of a snob when it comes to prime rib but this was really one of the better cuts I have had.   After we were finished Don came over and introduced himself. Very nice guy and seemed genuinely interested in how our experience was. We will be back soon !!

pb-s4vuuBBmeGc6jzYBUug.text: Awful awful awful! The hostess' were stuck up and seemed put out to have to seat us (apparently holding up the wall was more important). The food was awful - I can make a better steak at home. We were seated next to a group of men who felt the need to yell and be inappropriate which the wait staff didn't do anything about.  We will not be coming here ever again

6uWNc3_qB99ZZGkMF9qeiA.text: Great food. Great atmosphere. The owner is very mic and friendly. Service usually great. Try the ribs!

TJgQwwQDOO0hI-13Gi96vw.text: Awesome! Friendly service, fun crowd, prime rib and broasted chicken are out of this world! A must if you're in Scottsdale, especially if you like sports memorabilia - the walls are covered!!

BTzXhB69k35Mil84IvcU-g.text: I have been dragged here several times.  Aside from the exquisite sports memorabilia there is nothing more unless you don't get out much.  For that crew it's an experience but you can get AN EXPERIENCE by going to McDonalds - it just depends on the palate.  This last time I had the chicken sandwich - Chick-Fil A  has it down. Don & Charley's sandwich is AWFUL. Tasteless, dry YUK!  So far I had ribs - the worst, where's the meat?, several chicken dishes - go to Chick-Fil A, the salads - UGH!  Anybody who gives this place a good score must be a factory worker from Detroit.  Oh, I almost forgot, I had the Clam Chowder.  They have the taste right  but my cup had one clam that hadn't been cleaned - I don't like chewing on sand. Even worst was the texture - clams should be tender and not rubbery.

qqGPIOceiH52SpJA_4LxKw.text: Big trouble with reservation.   Manager tried to fix it.    People making reservation  were not interested.  If I had  my way we would have left and spent our $550.00 elsewhere.    The waitress who has been there 20 years got  a $150.00 tip.   She deserved it.    Would I go again?   No. To many places that care for our business.

hkQudO7yOTs0Wmjoah2f-g.text: Great memorabilia exposed all over the place. A True sports showroom is sourounding while dining a great meal.   The atmosphere takes one back in time as if it was yesterday! The owner did an amazing job!

zd0fBOWXmTnFLbxCq0bjKQ.text: Love this place. Cool sports memorabilia and great prime rib. I go there every time I'm in Scottsdale.

5leQEFFEcld3o1-Vm8QO7Q.text: I've never paid so much to be so disappointed in my life.  This was my dad's Christmas present this year. It's ALL he wanted. After we showed up for our RESERVATION we waited another 10 minutes. We were sat on a very busy night, and I'm trying to keep that in mind. Our female server had little to no interest in serving us - intent on keeping an eye on all her tables. She wouldn't even look us in the eye. Never. Made. Eye contact. My dad is REALLY hard of hearing and asked her to repeat herself. She actually got exasperated. Like...huffed. I'm sorry - look around. That's your clientele. People can't hear. Especially on a busy night.  We ordered, and felt supremely RUSHED. Our dishes were constantly being taken away from us before we were even finished. I ordered the Mahi Mahi, the nights "special" - I swear I have seen the exact same dish at Bangle Barbeque in Disneyland. And paid about $15 LESS.   It's pretty sad that the best thing I had that night was the free liver pate. That stuff was amazing. So...yay liver.  We ordered drinks, appetizers, and desserts READ - $$$ - and yet all our server was looking at were the more expensive LOOKING tables. Older gents in suits. Not a family.   Now, I'm aware this is mostly about the server - but isn't that the face of a restaurant? I had a HORRIBLE time - the server severely negatively impacted our entire meal. It was my last weekend visiting my folks. It was awful.  After we paid, we actually went into the bar - hoping to not feel so rushed and relax with each other a little while. It almost felt like it was something the management told everyone to do: servers, bussers, runners - everyone was RUSHING. There was no time to enjoy anything.  Well, the BAR was an entirely different story. We had a GREAT time, stayed a couple hours! Didn't feel rushed, patrons were happy and everyone was having a great time, as was the bartender! I noted to myself that if I HAPPEN to ever come back, I will sit in the bar. It made a horrible night, sting a bit less.  The place is good for sports fans I guess and people in a hurry - or who have money to intimidate, but if you're looking for a great meal, and an enjoyable time, save your money and dignity. Go elsewhere. Except the bar. You can go to the bar.

SMwLncBy-nejFEHJZYUwRA.text: We went on Friday night to Don and Charlie's with some friends.  We didn't have a reservation so the wait was quite long, which really wasen't a big deal because I knew the wait would be long.  The owner saw that we we had been waiting so he found a table for us. The problem was the waitress was quite busy and when we ordered our food she assumed that we would be sharing so she had everything split.  We asked numerous times for ketchup and she kept forgetting.   The biggest problem I had was that I ordered ribs.  They were so dry that I had to pour lots of sauce over them.  Earlier that night the ASU football team was there, I think they cooked a ton of ribs and had extras that they didn't use, so then they served those to us.  They were the worst ribs I have ever had!  I do love the decor and maybe the food would be better at another time.

0Bcqv65vFObjpMG3a19v5w.text: What a spot, Atmosphere, memorabilia, so much sports history and signatures the place could open up as a museum  the walls are just covered in photos and great sports items.   Following a great restaurant set up is amazing food!  wow i love to order sides because they are for sharing and taste so great.    I personally think the steaks here are done right.   Service, 5th Star is always on the service.  People treat you like a home guest.  so many servers have been here for many years.  I can't remember the ladies name that took care of us but she was just a great character .  Some restaurants just bring out the fun personality of its people.    Great place for a big party for those special occasions.

CjkHR9x4pSw7kpI9kpJpsg.text: Went here for a family birthday with 9 people. Everyone claimed the ribs are phenomenal. Ours couldn't have tasted any worse. Very tough and hard to bite in to. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because our server was very good. This place is overrated and over priced. Far better options now in Scottsdale.

q5yCBmPjWGv1LRct-wP4fw.text: This place was so bad on so many levels I'm not even sure where to begin. Our server kept calling me honey.. and seemed to be in such a hurry she wouldn't stop and listen to me. You know how needy I can get and need to be listened too and heard. We started by ordering the Baked Spinach and Artichoke Dip..  what I couldn't understand is 1, how did the chef let this go out and 2, no one but us could smell the scorched burnt smoke coming off the dish. This thing was so badly burned and scorched it was completely inedible. Sent it back and she didn't even offer to bring another one. Perhaps it was because they were so busy they just wanted the food to go out?  So I ordered their Famous BBQ Ribs.. I hate complaining to much but these were old ribs.. maybe maybe a day or 2 before.. pork takes on a funky taste when its fridged for to long.. the texture of the meat (when you could find any) was like jerky. I happily ate my Creamed Spinach (2 star yummy) and didn't eat more then 2 bones of the ribs. When the waitress came to clear the plates (she never checked on us) she asked if I was full. I told her that the ribs weren't to my liking.. she smiled and asked if I wanted dessert.   Over all I would never come back to Don and Charlie's.. aside from the  Creamed Spinach, which I can make myself, there weren't many redeeming qualities. A shame too because it's so close to the house. I don't get it because the Yelps are so good. Maybe they were having  a bad night? It was so bad I wouldn't ever go back to find out.

sF7T5BKexVpx89YDzn-Wzw.text: Great place. Fun atmosphere. Awesome staff. Great pictures everywhere. Food is excellent. Drinks were amazing. I will come here again for sure.

Bf_o3x4yRwYPxbCnVXN3-A.text: It's a ritual.  In February, hoards of people flock to Phoenix to escape the chill, play golf, watch spring training, and go to Don and Charlie's.  Don and Charlie's is an institution around this area, especially during February and March.  Dine here and more than likely you'll see a big league player, manager, scout, etc.  Tonight there were some Milwaukee Brewers dining with us.  This place is covered with so much sports memorabilia, you feel like you're dining in a museum.  I think the memorabilia is worth more than the restaurant, and it's definitely worth more than the food.  Expect a long wait if you come at prime time, as this place does get busy.  Food - your typical upscale ribs, steak, and prime rib place.  Good but not great; the memorabilia is the main attraction here and is worthy of four stars.

7GyClhaHw6nCt3me66tiog.text: Disappointing!  We were here a few years ago and couldn't wait to return.  Unfortunately it is not as good as I remember.  The food is OK, but not special in any way.  The server was aloof, efficient but aloof and not particularly welcoming as if he were doing us a special favor by taking out order.  The sports memorabilia are worth viewing so I would suggest a visit to the bar, have a cocktail, look around and enjoy the decor.  That's our plan for next year's spring training visit.

M_Mhu9Ygnq05b9-YTcnY1w.text: Awesome decor! The waiter even lent us a flashlight to go around the restaurant and see all of the amazing autographs and memorabilia.   Food was really good. Ordered the broasted chicken, ribs and mac & cheese. Chicken was incredibly juicy and had a great skin. Ribs weren't fall off the bone, but we were told they wouldn't be. The flavor was good (wife didn't like the sauce, but I did). Mac and Cheese was subtle underneath the layer of cheese, which was a nice mix.   Also, we mentioned that we saw them on yelp and we were offered the cheese toast for free. And it was so good we wanted to eat each and every one of them.   Entrees came with cole slaw, but since we are not a fan of that we optioned to change them to caesar salads - for an up charge. Salad had an olive oil twist instead of creamy caesar, which was interesting.  We will be back, and we recommend you do the same.

SO6zhhpm1RupfNpL9WI-BA.text: Amazing restaurant! I have been coming here literally since I was a baby with my family. I also recently had the opportunity to plan a private event at D&Cs. Karina was absolutely wonderful to work with! She helped coordinate every detail of our event to help make it a success! Our guests loved the food, ambience and service. I will definitely be back for personal and professional visits!!

Imwo-uuNZlgpfT-Ke5jgpg.text: I really enjoyed the whole experience of the restaurant. When you walk in you are overwhelmed with the sports memorabilia. They have taken advantage of all the space they have in the restaurant. It was fun to be there. The waiter was super sweet he came often and recommended some dishes. We were given warm bread while waiting for our food. We had the cheesy bread as our appetizer. It was ok but not a big whoop. I ordered a Parmesan crusted steak. It was pretty good wasn't the best I ever tatted but I'd order it again. The order came with coleslaw and I chose a baked potato. The skin had salt and pepper on the tater which made for a yummy twist. All of enjoyed our meals. My daughter chose the brosted chicken which I have to say is the star of the show. It was so juicy and delicious. You have to try it when you go.  For dessert I got the key lime pie which again was ok but I've had better. I enjoyed myself mainly because all the staff was very pleasant and the sports memorabilia was so cool. We all agreed we would go back especially for that chicken.
